6000.name: Primary Population Census 2011
6000.overview: The Primary Census Abstract from Ministry of Home Affairs provides basic information on area, count of households, population by age, gender, caste, level of education and types of workers. Further, it provides information on main workers and marginal workers classified by the four broad industrial categories, namely, (i) cultivators, (ii) agricultural labourers, (iii) household industry workers, and (iv) other workers and also non-workers. Rural-urban areas classification in regard is 'town' for urban areas and 'village' for rural areas. City - towns with a population of 1, 00,000 and above are called cities.

6001.name: State wise Funds under Soil Health Card
6001.overview: State wise amount released and utilised under Soil health card scheme. Soil Health Management (SHM) is one of the most important interventions under National Mission for Sustainable Agriulture ( NMSA ). It includes adoption of one village per block for land holding based Soil Sampling, Testing & Distribution of Soil Health Cards and subsequent SHC based demonstrations in each Model village besides organizing one Mela per village for scaling up awareness creation amongst the farmers across India.
6001.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: State wise amount realsed under soil health card in lakhs
State wise amount utilized under soil health card in lakhs

6002.name: Procurement of Wheat and Rice for the Central Pool Range
6002.overview: This dataset provides information on the benefit of farmers from the procurement of food grain. Procurement of food grains carried out by Food Corporation of India (FCI) is one of the most important activities of the food policy of the Government of India. It serves twin purposes, one of providing remunerative prices to the farmers and avoiding distress sale of food-grains at prices below the Minimum Support Price (MSP) and secondly encourages the farmers to increase production of food-grains.
6002.source: Ministry of Consumer Affairs  Food and Public Distribution

6003.name: Household without Crop Insurance
6003.overview: The situation assessment survey of agricultural households in NSS 70th round (January 2013- December 2013) was conducted as a repeat survey of situation assessment survey, 2003 (59th round). Information on households without crop insurance was collected with respect to the crops harvested by the agricultural household during the reference period. The survey also aimed at capturing the condition of agricultural households in the country.
6003.source: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation
columns: Starting month and year of the period
Ending month and year of the period

Ending month and year of the period

6004.name: Minimum Support Price of Crops
6004.overview: Minimum Support Prices (MSP) of crops with respect to season name (Kharif, Rabi and Others), commodity name and variety of commodities. Minimum Support Price (MSP) is a form of market intervention by the Government of India to insure agricultural producers against any sharp fall in farm prices. MSP is price fixed by Government of India to protect the farmers against excessive fall in price during bumper production years.
6004.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6005.name: Average Daily Wage Rates for Agricultural and Non-agricultural Occupations in Rural India
6005.overview: State-wise average daily wage rates, by occupation and gender for agricultural and for non-agricultural occupations. The daily wage rate data received from the field are first normalized for eight working hours a day. The simple arithmetic average of these normalized daily wage rates is worked out for each of the 20 states. These averages are restricted only to those occupations where the number of quotations is five or more in order to avoid the apparent inconsistency in wages paid to different categories of workers on account of differences in number of quotations.
columns: Agricultural and non agricultural occupation types
key_columns: Agricultural and non agricultural occupation types

6006.name: Average outstanding loan per agricultural household
6006.overview: Average amount of outstanding loan (Rs ’00) per agricultural household by Monthly Per capita Consumer Expenditure (MPCE) decile class for different States or Group of UTs. For a household, MPCE is its total consumer expenditure divided by its size and expressed on a per month (30 days) basis. A person’s MPCE is understood as that of the household to which he or she belongs.
6006.source: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation
columns: Monthly per capita consumer expenditure (mpce ) in decile class
Monthly average amount of households per capita consumer expenditure in decile class in hundereds.
Proportion of households with outstanding limit
key_columns: Monthly per capita consumer expenditure (mpce ) in decile class

6007.name: Average amount of outstanding loan per agricultural household by size class of land possessed
6007.overview: Average amount of outstanding loan per agricultural household by size class of land possessed for major States. It reveals that about 52 percent of the agricultural households in the country were estimated to be indebted. The average amount of outstanding loan per agricultural household was Rs.47000/- (approx.). The average amount of outstanding loan was highest for Kerala (Rs.213600/-) followed by Andhra Pradesh (Rs.123400) and Punjab (Rs.119500). Assam (Rs.3400), Jharkhand (Rs.5700) and Chhattisgarh (Rs.10200) were the States with lowest amount of average outstanding loan. The Situation Assessment Survey of Agricultural Households in NSS 70th Round (January, 2013- December, 2013) was conducted as a repeat survey of Situation Assessment Survey, 2003 (59th round).
6007.source: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation
columns: Monthly per capita consumer expenditure (mpce) decile size class of land type
Average amount of outstanding loan (rs ‘00) per agricultural household
Proportion of households with outstanding loan
key_columns: Monthly per capita consumer expenditure (mpce) decile size class of land type

6008.name: District wise Corporate Social Responsibility -Dynamic CSR Report
6008.overview: This dataset gives information about District wise Corporate Social Responsibility ( CSR ). Corporate social responsibility and sustainability is a company’s commitment to its stakeholders to conduct business in an economically, socially and environmentally sustainable manner that is transparent and ethical. The Companies Act, 2013 has introduced the idea of CSR to the forefront and through its disclose-or-explain mandate, is promoting greater transparency and disclosure.
columns: Amount spent by corporate social responsibility

6009.name: Agricultural households reporting sale for selected crops
6009.overview: Agricultural households reporting sale for selected crops data is about  information regarding the sale for selected crops by agency during the agricultural year July, 2012- June, 2013. It also indicates the fact that a major share of agricultural production in the country is for own consumption.
6009.source: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation
columns: Estimated number of households (100)  reporting sale of crop

6011.name: Fertilizer Sale
6011.overview: State-wise and month-wise sales and availability of fertilizer like Urea, Dap and MOP to ensure adequate and timely availability of fertilizers at affordable prices for maximizing agricultural production in the country. The Department of Fertilizers includes ensuring adequate and timely availability of fertilizers to the farmers at affordable prices through planned production and imports and distribution of fertilizers in the country and planning for self-sufficiency in urea production.
columns: Availability of fertlizers for state wise in each month
Sales of fertlizers for state wise in each month

6012.name: Estimated Area, Production and Yield of Crops
6012.overview: Estimated Area, Production and Yield of Crops like cereals, cotton, tur, pulses, Bajra, etc. in kilogram per hectare which may vary from year to year depending upon weather conditions including temporal and spatial spread of rainfall, farmers perception of demand and supply of various agricultural products, emerging international scenario and policies of Union and State Governments.
6012.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6013.name: Agricultural households without crop  Insurance for two seasons of the agricultural year
6013.overview: The situation assessment survey of agricultural households in NSS 70th round (January, 2013- December, 2013) was conducted as a repeat survey of situation assessment survey, 2003 (59th round). Information on households without crop insurance was collected with respect to the crops harvested by the agricultural household during two seasons of the agricultural year. The survey also aimed at capturing the condition of agricultural households in the country.
6013.source: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation

Ending month and year of the period

6014.name: Agricultural households with awareness about MSP
6014.overview: This dataset provides information on number of agricultural households having awareness about MSP but did not sell to procurement agency for selected crops as per 1000 households. Reasons for not selling crops to procurement agency include procurement agency not available, no local purchaser, poor quality of crop, crop already prep ledged, received better price over MSP, and others. The survey aimed at capturing the condition of agricultural households in the country.
6014.source: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation

6015.name: Agricultural households by type of dwelling unit
6015.overview: Distribution of agricultural households by type of dwelling unit as per 1000 households. Types of dwelling units are no unit, owned unit and hired unit. The situation assessment survey of agricultural households in NSS 70th round (January, 2013- December, 2013) is conducted for capturing the condition of agricultural households in the country.
6015.source: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation

Agricultural households ( per 1000 ) who hired dwelling unit

6016.name: State-wise Estimates of Quality Parameters
6016.overview: State wise estimates on Not of Standard Quality ( NSQ ) percentages for government and retail outlet sources with approximate upper and lower 95% confidence limit. The main objective of Ministry of Health and Family Welfare under NSQ is to Estimate proportion of specific critical quality standards at different points of supply chain, Estimate proportions of Spurious and Not of Standard Quality Drugs (NSQ) in the country, Identify possible causes of findings and to propose possible strategies and implementation plan to address the problems identified. For the purpose of Drug Survey, a Drug is considered to be Not of Standard Quality if it does not comply with the Standards of Quality as specified in Section 16 of the Drugs and Cosmetics Act.
6016.source: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
columns: Number of not of standard quality ( nsq ) samples
Not of standard quality ( nsq ) percentage (%)

6017.name: Agricultural households by type of Structure
6017.overview: Distribution of agricultural households by katcha, semi-pucca or pucca type of structure of house per 1000 households. The situation assessment survey of agricultural households in NSS 70th round (January, 2013- December, 2013) was conducted for capturing the condition of agricultural households in the country.
6017.source: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation
columns: Agricultural households ( per 1000 ) with katcha type of structure
Agricultural households ( per 1000 ) with semi- pucca type of structure
Agricultural households ( per 1000 ) with pucca type of structure

6018.name: Agricultural households by type of land possessed
6018.overview: Distribution of agricultural households by homestead or other types of land possessed as per 1000 households. The situation assessment survey of agricultural households in NSS 70th round (January, 2013- December, 2013) was conducted for capturing the condition of agricultural households in the country.
6018.source: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation
columns: Agricultural households ( per 1000 ) possessed with homestead type of land
Agricultural households ( per 1000 ) possessed with homestead and other type of land
Agricultural households ( per 1000 ) possessed with other type of land

6019.name: Agricultural households by type of ration card
6019.overview: Distribution of agricultural households by type of ration cards as per 1000 households. Types of ration cards mentioned are Antyo-daya, BPL and other cards. The situation assessment survey of agricultural households in NSS 70th round (January, 2013- December, 2013) was conducted for capturing the condition of agricultural households in the country.
6019.source: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation

6020.name: Agricultural households by operated land for agricultural activities and MGNREG Job card
6020.overview: Distribution of agricultural households by operated land for agricultural activities and Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee ( MGNREG ) Job card as per 1000 households. The situation assessment survey of agricultural households in NSS 70th round (January, 2013- December, 2013) was conducted for capturing the condition of agricultural households in the country.
6020.source: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation
columns: Agricultural households ( per 1000 ) with any operated land for agricultural activities during last 365 days
Agricultural households ( per 1000 ) having mahatma gandhi national rural employment guarantee ( mgnreg ) job card

6021.name: Agricultural households having awareness about MSP for selected crops
6021.overview: Number per 1000 of agricultural households having awareness about Minimum Support Price ( MSP ) for selected crops. The data shows a lesser level of awareness about MSP and even lower level of sale of these crops to procurement agencies. Except for sugarcane, only less than half of the households, which were aware about MSP, sold off their crop to procurement agencies. Even for the households reported sale to the procurement agency, the quantity sold was a very small percentage of the total sale by these households during the period.
6021.source: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation
columns: Percentage of sale at msp to total sale of the households sold to procurement agency ( % )
Average sale rate revised at msp
Estimated number of households reporting sale of crop

6022.name: Estimated number of agricultural households and rural households in the country
6022.overview: This dataset gives information about Estimated number of agricultural households and rural households in the country during the agricultural year 2012-13 for different social groups for different States/ Group of UTs. The social group includes ST, SC, OBC and others. The estimates of number of rural households are as per the results of Land and Livestock Survey, NSS 70th round.
6022.source: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation

6023.name: Distribution of agriculture households by major source of income
6023.overview: This dataset gives us information regarding the households whose major source of income depends on cultivation, livestock, other agriculture activities, non-agriculture enterprises, wage/salaried employment and others. Among various sources from which the agricultural households received any income during 365 days prior to the date of survey, the source which yielded maximum income was taken as principal source of income. It can be seen that agricultural households were dependent mainly on cultivation followed by wage/ salaried employment for their livelihood, as about 63.5 percent of the agricultural households reported cultivation as their principal source of income and about 22 percent reported wage/ salaried employment as their principal source of income.
6023.source: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation
columns: Per 1000 households engaged in different kind of activities
Per 1000 households whose major source of income depends on each activity

6024.name: Avg monthly expenses and receipts for crop production
6024.overview: Average monthly expenses and receipts per agricultural households engaged in crop production under different expenses like seeds, fertilizers, irrigation, plant protection chemicals, human labour etc. for different States/ Group of UTs. During the period January, 2013- June, 2013, 71.1 percent of the agricultural households in the country were engaged in crop production with an average value of production per household of Rs.36696/-. The average gross cropped area per household during this period was 0.782 ha.
6024.source: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation
columns: Average monthly expenses on plant protection
Average monthly expenses in minor repair and maintenance
Average monthly expenses on lease rent
Average monthly value of preharvest scale
Households enagged in crop prodcuctuon per 1000

6025.name: Production and Procurement of Rice and Wheat in Five Crop Years
6025.overview: State wise amount of production and procurement of wheat and rice in lakh tonne. Procurement of food grains carried out by Food Corporation of India (FCI) is one of the most important activities of the food policy of the Government of India. It serves twin purposes, one of providing remunerative prices to the farmers and avoiding distress sale of foodgrains at prices below the Minimum Support Price (MSP) and also encourages the farmers to increase production of foodgrains.
6025.source: Ministry of Consumer Affairs  Food and Public Distribution
columns: Type of foodgrain namely wheat and rice
Production of rice or wheat in five crop years
Procurement of rice or wheat in five crop years
key_columns: Type of foodgrain namely wheat and rice

6026.name: Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (MGNREGA)
6026.overview: The Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (MGNREGA) seeks to improve rural infrastructure and strengthen the livelihood of the rural poor by providing at least 100 days of guaranteed wage employment in a financial year. This data shows details related to worker participation in the program, demand and allocation of work, employment provided, expenditure and worker accounts.

6027.name: Per capita availability of certain articles of consumption
6027.overview: Per capita availability of certain articles of consumption. Articles contained are edible oil, Vanaspati, sugar, cotton cloth, manmade cloth, tea and coffee. This dataset is under Agricultural Statistics at a Glance which is the flagship publication of the Directorate of Economics & Statistics and is regarded as the most reliable source of comprehensive and updated database on variegated aspects of the agriculture sector in India.
6027.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6028.name: State wise summary of outlets
6028.overview: This dataset gives information about State wise break up of Government Sources and State wise summary of coverage of outlets and Hit Rates from Retail Outlets. The state wise break-up along with particulars of number of sources from which samples were drawn, the number and percentage of assigned ones in them, hit rate, the number of SDOs involved in the drawl of samples, are given in this dataset. According to the statistical principles, it is desirable that the percentage of assigned sources in the total samples drawn is high. We called this percentage as hit rate. Hit rate could be computed for each SDO (Sample Drawing Officer) or for a district or a State or for the entire set of drawn samples.
6028.source: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
columns: State wise breakup of government source and retail outlets
Outlets sampled under government and retail
Outlets assigned under government and retail sources
Hit rate for government and retail sources.
Count of sample drawing officers ( sdo ) involved
key_columns: State wise breakup of government source and retail outlets

6029.name: State-wise Allocation, release and expenditure of funds in National Food Security Mission
6029.overview: State-wise allocation, release and expenditure of funds under National Food Security Mission (NFSM).  NFSM Mission met with overwhelming success and achieved the targeted additional production of rice, wheat and pulses. The Mission continued during 12th Five Year Plan with new targets of additional production of food grains of 25 million tonnes of food grains comprising of 10 million tonnes rice, 8 million tonnes of wheat, 4 million tonnes of pulses and 3 million tonnes of coarse cereals by the end of 12th Five Year Plan.
6029.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Allocation of fund for each crop
Release of fund for each crop
Expenditure of fund for each crop

6030.name: Model Village Programme
6030.overview: This dataset gives us information regarding Model Village Programme of fertilizers namely Nitrogen, phosphorous, Potassium, organic carbon used in three different cycles under Soil Health Management. Soil Health management (SHM) aims at promoting Integrated Nutrient Management (INM) through judicious use of chemical fertilisers including secondary and micro nutrients in conjunction with organic manures and bio-fertilisers for improving soil health and its productivity, strengthening of soil and fertiliser testing facilities to provide soil test based recommendations to farmers for improving soil fertility, ensuring quality control requirements of fertilisers, bio-fertilisers and organic fertilisers under Fertiliser Control Order, 1985, upgradation of skill and knowledge of soil testing laboratory staff, extension staff and farmers through training and demonstrations, promoting organic farming practices etc.
6030.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Fertilizers used in cylce namely nitrogen, phosphorous, potassium, organic carbon.
Count of nutrient status involved in three cycles.
key_columns: Fertilizers used in cylce namely nitrogen, phosphorous, potassium, organic carbon.

6031.name: State wise Macro Nutrient Status
6031.overview: This dataset gives us information regarding State wise Macro Nutrient Status of fertilizers namely Nitrogen, phosphorous, Potassium, organic carbon used in three different cycles under Soil Health management. Soil Health management (SHM) aims at promoting Integrated Nutrient Management (INM) through judicious use of chemical fertilisers including secondary and micro nutrients in conjunction with organic manures and bio-fertilisers for improving soil health and its productivity; strengthening of soil and fertiliser testing facilities to provide soil test based recommendations to farmers for improving soil fertility; ensuring quality control requirements of fertilisers, bio-fertilisers and organic fertilisers under Fertiliser Control Order, 1985; upgradation of skill and knowledge of soil testing laboratory staff, extension staff and farmers through training and demonstrations; promoting organic farming practices etc.
6031.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: State wise Macro Nutrient Status for Cycle I, Cycle II ,Cycle III
Fertilizers used in cylce namely Nitrogen, phosphorous, Potassium, organic carbon.
Count of Nutrient status involved in three cycles.
key_columns: State wise Macro Nutrient Status for Cycle I, Cycle II ,Cycle III
Fertilizers used in cylce namely Nitrogen, phosphorous, Potassium, organic carbon.

6032.name: Distribution of enterprises by location for major States and sector
6032.overview: This dataset shows percentage distribution of enterprises by location for major states and sector. Location of enterprise includes within household premises, outside household premises with fixed location or outside household premises without fixed location. This survey was designed to generate estimates of various operational and economic characteristics of the unincorporated non-agricultural enterprises in manufacturing, trade and other services (excluding construction) at more disaggregated activity category level as required by Central Statistics Office (CSO) which is also one of the prime users of the survey results.
6032.source: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation
columns: Starting month and year of the period
Ending month and year of the period
Location type, with or without household premises
Percentage distribution of enterprises by residence type and location type
key_columns: Starting month and year of the period
Ending month and year of the period
Location type, with or without household premises

6033.name: Annual GVA per enterprise by sector enterprise type for major States
6033.overview: This dataset gives the estimated annual gross value added per enterprise (GVAPE) engaged in market production by type of enterprise separately for rural, urban and combined sector. The 73rd round (July 2015 to June 2016), NSSO an all-India survey was carried out on unincorporated non-agricultural enterprises in manufacturing, trade, non-captive electricity generation & transmission and other service sector (excluding construction). The survey was designed to generate estimates of various operational and economic characteristics of the unincorporated non-agricultural enterprises in manufacturing, trade and other services (excluding construction) at more disaggregated activity category level as required by Central Statistics Office (CSO) which is also one of the prime users of the survey results.
6033.source: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation
columns: Annual gross value added ( gva ) of enterprises

6034.name: Annual GVA per worker for major State
6034.overview: Annual GVA per worker (GVAPW) for major States by type of enterprise separately for rural, urban and combined sector. This dataset comes under 73rd round (July 2015 to June 2016), was designed to generate estimates of various operational and economic characteristics of the unincorporated non-agricultural enterprises in manufacturing, trade and other services (excluding construction) at more disaggregated activity category level as required by Central Statistics Office (CSO) which is also one of the prime users of the survey results.
6034.source: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation
columns: Annual gross value added ( gva ) per worker

6035.name: Distribution of quantity sold by agency for selected crops
6035.overview: This dataset gives information about Percentage distribution of quantity sold by agency for selected crops. The distribution of quantity sold by agency in respect of selected crops shows that majority of the production of all these crops, except sugarcane, was sold off to either local private trader or mandi. The lower share of sale to cooperative & Government agencies shows the lesser utilisation of procurement agencies which provide Minimum Support Price (MSP) to selected crops.
6035.source: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation
columns: Distribution of quantity sold by local private trader ( % )
Distribution of quantity sold by mandi ( % )
Distribution of quantity sold by input dealers ( % )
Distribution of quantity sold by cooperative and government agency ( % )
Distribution of quantity sold by processors ( % )
Distribution of quantity sold by other agencies ( % )

6036.name: Average monthly income and consumption expenditure per agricultural household
6036.overview: This dataset gives information about Average monthly income (Rs.) and consumption expenditure (Rs) per agricultural household for the agricultural year July 2012-June 2013 for different States/ Group of UTs. Average monthly income of the agricultural households included net receipts from cultivation, farming of animals, nonfarm business and income from wages/ salaries. At all-India level, average monthly income per agricultural household during the agricultural year July 2012- June 2013 was estimated as Rs.6426.
6036.source: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation
columns: Average monthly income of the agricultural households from wages
Average monthly net receipt of the agricultural households from cultivation
Average monthly net receipt of the agricultural households from farming of animals
Average monthly net receipt of the agricultural households from non-farm business
Average monthly total consumption expenditure of the agricultural households
Average monthly net investment in productive asset of the agricultural households

6037.name: Average gross cropped area and harvested value for agricultural households
6037.overview: Average gross irrigated and unirrigated cropped area (ha) and harvested value (Rs.) for agricultural households reporting cultivation as major for selected crops by irrigation for different States. the average gross cropped area, gross area under crop, harvested value and quantity produced for agricultural households reporting cultivation as major for selected crops for the period July, 2012- December, 2012.
6037.source: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation

6038.name: Estimated number of enterprises by enterprise type
6038.overview: This dataset gives us information regarding estimated number of enterprises by enterprise type.  Out of the total number of enterprises 51.3 % were in rural areas and the remaining 48.7 % were in urban areas. The estimated value of total owned fixed assets per enterprise by broad activity category for different enterprise types are presented. Enterprise surveys as follow up surveys of Economic Census (EC) are also being conducted by NSSO, periodically, since the first Economic Census in the year 1977. So far 15 such follow up surveys on non-agricultural enterprises have been conducted by NSSO starting from the survey on Unorganised Manufacturing - Non-Directory Establishments and Own-Account Enterprises during NSS 33rd round (July 1978 – June 1979) to the Survey on Unincorporated Non-Agricultural Enterprises (Excluding Construction) of NSS 73rd round (July 2015- June 2016).
6038.source: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation
columns: Estimated number of enterprises for state, sector by enterprise type

6039.name: Estimated number of workers by enterprise type
6039.overview: This dataset gives us information regarding estimated number of workers by enterprise type.  The results of the survey reveals that during 2015-16, about 11.13 crore workers were engaged in unincorporated non-agricultural enterprises (excluding construction) in the country. Among the workers, 55 % worked in urban areas and 45 % worked in rural areas. The Own Account Enterprises (OAEs) accounted for 62 % of the workforce in the unincorporated non-agricultural sector (excluding construction) in the country. At all India level, workers in the OAEs outnumbered those engaged by establishments in all the broad activity categories. Similar pattern is observed in rural areas also. However, in urban sector, in all broad activity categories other than Trading, establishments had a higher share of workers.
6039.source: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation
columns: Estimated number of workers for state, sector by enterprise type

6049.name: Procurement of Wheat/Rice
6049.overview: Procurement of wheat and rice for central pool during different Rabi and Kharif seasons from Food Corporation of India (FCI) and State agencies. The Central Government through Food Corporation of India (FCI), a public sector undertaking under the administrative control of Ministry of Consumer Affairs, Food and Public Distribution procures food grains on large scale on Minimum Support Price (MSP) directly from farmers. Rice is also procured from rice millers under levy scheme. The State Government agencies also procure food grains from farmers on behalf of the FCI. For the procurement of food grains, large numbers of procurement centres are opened by the FCI and State Government agencies in the grain markets and rural areas. Necessary equipment and items like grain cleaners, empty gunny bags, weighing balance, moisture meter, grain sampler and stitching machine etc. are provided at each procurement centre.
6049.source: Ministry of Consumer Affairs  Food and Public Distribution

6050.name: State-Wise Wheat,Rice Procurement Target
6050.overview: State-Wise Wheat, Rice Procurement Target and Procurement in Rabi, Kharif Marketing Seasons. The aim of the procurement of food grains is to provide remunerative prices to the farmers and to avoid distress sale of food grains at prices below the Minimum Support Price (MSP) and also encourages the farmers to increase production of food grains. The requirements of Targeted Public Distribution System (TPDS) are also met from the food grains procured. The procurement of wheat during the Rabi Marketing Season 2006-07 was much below the target and the buffer stock of wheat has also gone down. Therefore, the import of wheat has been decided during 2006-07
6050.source: Ministry of Consumer Affairs  Food and Public Distribution
columns: State wise procurement target of crops in different seasons.

At all India level, around 78.5 percent of the agricultural households did not possess any land outside the village they were residing during the time of the survey. Among the households reported land possession outside the village, about 17.5 percent had land within the State itself and about 4percent had land outside the State.
6051.source: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation

6052.name: Manufacturing units with sample size and NSQ percentage
6052.overview: This dataset gives us information regarding the estimated NSQ percentage for retail outlets in India is 3% with the upper 95% confidence limit of 3.19%. The estimates were also obtained for each State. The estimated percentage of NSQ for Government sources in India is 10.02% and the 95% confidence interval for the same is 9.38% to 10.68% and the estimated percentage of Spurious drugs from Government sources is 0.0597%. State wise, NSQ percentage estimates varied from 0 to 17.39% with the exception of Sikkim. Four UTs i.e. Chandigarh, Dadra and Nagar Haveli, Daman and Diu and Lakshadweep had 0%NSQ. Eighteen States/UTs had NSQ Percentage below national average of 10.02% for Government sources. Thirteen States had NSQ percentage above national average of 10.02% for Government sources.

6053.overview: This dataset gives us information regarding market value of owned fixed assets per enterprise by sector and enterprise type for each State in Indian Rupees. The information on the market value of these fixed assets was collected separately for each asset. Whenever information was collected from the book of accounts, net closing value, i.e., closing values after the depreciation was recorded. At all India level, the market value of owned fixed assets per enterprise was estimated as Rs. 2,31,869. By taking all the enterprises together, the market value of owned fixed assets per enterprise in urban areas was about 3 times the corresponding value in rural areas.

6054.name: Annual gross value added per worker for market enterprises by enterprise type
6054.overview: This dataset gives us information regarding annual gross value added per worker for market enterprises like Own Account Enterprises (OAEs), Establishments by enterprise type and sector for each State and broad activity category. The estimated annual gross value added per enterprise (GVAPE) engaged in market production by type of enterprise separately for rural, urban and combined sector. Gross value added (GVA) per enterprise was substantially high for establishments for all sectors, as expected. The corresponding estimates for urban areas were Rs. 1,26,529 and Rs. 7,03,848 respectively. GVA per enterprise for establishments is higher than the GVAPE for OAEs in both rural and urban and combined sector.

6070.name: Distribution of Enterprises by type of Ownership
6070.overview: Per 1000 distribution of estimated number of enterprises by type of ownership by male, female or transgender. The specific ownership categories covered by the survey were proprietary, partnership, Self Help Group (SHG) and Trusts. In case of proprietary enterprises, information was separately recorded based on the gender (including transgender) of the proprietor. At all India level nearly one-fifth of the enterprises were proprietary headed by a female. However, their concentration was mainly restricted to OAEs, where they had a share of about 22 % across all sectors. Proprietary enterprises had the highest share (96 %) in the unincorporated non-agricultural enterprises in the country. The dominance of proprietary enterprises was almost same (94 % to 97 %) across all sector and enterprise type. 2 % of the estimated number of enterprises was partnerships and another 1.8 % was Self Help Groups (SHG).
6070.source: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation

6071.name: Distribution of Enterprises by type of Location
6071.overview: Per 1000 distribution of enterprises by type of location for each State. Type of locations include within household premises, permanent structure, temporary structure or kiosk or stall, without any structure, mobile market and street vendors etc. One of the main characteristics of the unincorporated sector enterprises in the country is the presence of units which do not have any fixed location of operation. These include those enterprises functions as street vendors or as mobile markets. About 87 % of the unincorporated non-agricultural enterprises in the country during 2015 -16 were reported to have operated out of a fixed location either within the households. Any structure made out of bricks, mud, bamboos etc. will be treated as a permanent structure if it cannot be removed as a whole without dismantling. Temporary structures can be removed from its present location with some effort like stalls, kiosks, etc.
6071.source: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation

6072.name: Fluoride affected rural habitations with excess fluoride
6072.overview: State and District wise Fluoride affected rural habitations with excess fluoride which are yet to be provided safe drinking water. In 2020, 6062 habitations of 139 districts of 17 states were affected by the fluoride problem. In 2020, fluoride in drinking water was found in almost all the districts of Rajasthan, 3569 habitations being affected by this public health problem. West Bengal and Bihar are the other states mostly affected by this problem. The Central Bureau of Health Intelligence (CBHI), annually brings out a Publication “National Health Profile (NHP), which covers all the major information on Demography, Socio-Economic Status, Disease Morbidity & Mortality, Healthcare Finance, Human Resources in Health and Healthcare Infrastructure. NHP is an initiative which is at par with international standards of data publications.

Between 2018 (1,78,832 deaths) and 2019 (1,81,113 deaths) there has been a 1.2% increase in the number of deaths due to road traffic accidents. The Central Bureau of Health Intelligence (CBHI), annually brings out a Publication “National Health Profile (NHP), which covers all the major information on Demography, Socio-Economic Status, Disease Morbidity & Mortality, Healthcare Finance, Human Resources in Health and Healthcare Infrastructure. 6075.name: Accidental Deaths & Suicides in India
6075.overview: Number of Accidental Deaths & Suicides of male, female and transgender in India. Suicide rates are increasing significantly among young adults. The Central Bureau of Health Intelligence (CBHI), annually brings out a Publication “National Health Profile (NHP), which covers all the major information on Demography, Socio-Economic Status, Disease Morbidity & Mortality, Healthcare Finance, Human Resources in Health and Healthcare Infrastructure. 6077.overview: Number of Dental Colleges & Admissions to Bachelor of Dental Surgery ( BDS ) and Master of Dental Surgery ( MDS ) courses in India from 1994-95 to 2020-21. The number of dental colleges in India grew from 77 in 1994-95 to 315 in 2020-21. At present out of 315 dental colleges 269 colleges had Master of Dental Surgery ( MDS ) seats. Thus, a total of 27285 Bachelor of Dental Surgery ( BDS ) seats and 6513 Master of Dental Surgery ( MDS ) seats in 2020-21 were reported.

6080.name: AYUSH Hospitals and Dispensaries in India
6080.overview: State wise Number of AYUSH Hospitals and Dispensaries in India. This dataset under Central Government Health Scheme (CGHS) was started under the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare in 1954 with the objective of providing comprehensive medical care facilities to Central Government employees, pensioners and their dependents residing in CGHS covered cities, annually brings out a Publication “National Health Profile (NHP), which covers all the major information on Demography, Socio-Economic Status, Disease Morbidity & Mortality, Healthcare Finance, Human Resources in Health and Healthcare Infrastructure. NHP is an initiative which is at par with international standards of data publications.
6080.source: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare

6081.name: Licensed Public Blood Bank
6081.overview: State wise Number of Licensed public blood bank which includes government blood banks and licensed private blood banks which includes charitable trust banks. Total number of licensed Blood Banks in the Country till December 2020 is 3500. The Central Bureau of Health Intelligence (CBHI), annually brings out a Publication “National Health Profile (NHP), which covers all the major information on Demography, Socio-Economic Status, Disease Morbidity & Mortality, Healthcare Finance, Human Resources in Health and Healthcare Infrastructure. NHP is an initiative which is at par with international standards of data publications.
6081.source: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
columns: Licensed public blood bank which includes government blood banks
Licensed private blood bank which includes charitable trust blood banks.

6082.name: Physical achievement under National Iodine Deficiency Control Programme
6082.overview: This dataset gives information about Physical achievement under National Iodine Deficiency Control Programme (NIDDCP). Iodine is required for the synthesis of the thyroid hormones, thyroxine (T4) and triiodothyronine (T3) and essential for the normal growth, development and well-being of all humans. It is a micronutrient and normally required around 100-150 microgram for normal growth and development.  Deficiency of iodine in the diet may result in the development of goiter and other iodine deficiency disorders (IDD) including physical and mental retardation and endemic cretinism. Due to sustained efforts of salt commissionerate with state governments, Iodised salt now finds place in the public distribution system in the states thereby enabling access of iodised salt to Below Poverty Line ( BPL ) population.
6082.source: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
columns: Salt samples tested ( quantitative ) for iodine
Salt samples confirming to standard at iodine content >15 parts per million ( ppm )
Samples tested for urinary iodine excretion ( uie )
Urine samples having optimal iodine greater than 100 µg/litre
Salt samples tested ( qualitative ) by salt testing kit (stk)

6083.name: State or UT wise distribution of Suicidal deaths
6083.overview: The dataset gives information about State or UT wise distribution of Suicidal deaths categorised by sex and age group. Suicide rates are increasing significantly among young adults. Total Suicides recorded in 2019 were 1, 39,123. Maximum number of Suicide Cases (48,774) are reported between the age group 18- 30 Years followed by 44,287 cases in age group of 30 -45 years.
6083.source: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare

6084.name: State or UT wise Cases and Deaths due to Snake Bite
6084.overview: The dataset provides state wise information on number of cases and deaths due to Snake Bite. Human Resources for Health focuses on planning, development, performance, management, retention, information, and research on human resources for the healthcare sector. National Health Profile (NHP), covers all the major information on Demography, Socio-Economic Status, Disease Morbidity & Mortality, Healthcare Finance, Human Resources in Health and Healthcare Infrastructure.
6084.source: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare

6085.name: Statewise Leprosy Case Detection, Treatment and Discharge in India
6085.overview: The dataset provides state-wise information on Leprosy Case Detection, Treatment, Discharge and Prevalence in India. All detected cases are initiated treatment with MDT (Multidrug Therapy). The data is strictly provisional and subject to updation. National Health Profile (NHP), covers all the major information on Demography, Socio-Economic Status, Disease Morbidity & Mortality, Healthcare Finance, Human Resources in Health and Healthcare Infrastructure.
6085.source: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
columns: New cases detected in present year
Cases discharged as cured in present year
Deletion of other release from treatment ( rft ) in present year
Cases on record under treatment in present year

6086.name: State and Disease wise number of Outbreaks reported under Integrated Disease Surveillance Project (IDSP)
6086.overview: State and disease wise number of outbreaks reported under the Integrated Disease Surveillance Project ( IDSP ). Initiated Integrated Disease Surveillance Project (IDSP) initiated in 2004 aims to detect and respond to outbreaks of epidemic prone diseases. Mission of IDSP is to strengthen the disease surveillance in the country by establishing a decentralized State based surveillance system for epidemic prone diseases to detect the early warning signals, so that timely and effective public health actions can be initiated in response to health challenges in the country at the Districts, State and National level.
6086.source: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
columns: Outbreaks reported under integrated disease surveillance project ( idsp )

6087.name: National Programme for Prevention and Control of Cancer, Diabetes, Cardiovascular Diseases and Stroke (NPCDCS)
6087.overview: This dataset provides information on patients who attended Non-communicable diseases ( NCDs ) clinics and were diagnosed with diabetes, hypertension, cardiovascular diseases, stroke and common cancers. National Programme for Prevention and Control of Cancer, Diabetes, Cardiovascular Diseases and Stroke (NPCDCS) launched in 2010 aimed to prevent and control these diseases through awareness generation, behaviour and lifestyle changes, early diagnosis of persons with high levels of risk factors. The programme manages chronic Non-Communicable diseases especially Cancer, Diabetes, CVDs and Stroke through early diagnosis, treatment and follows up through setting up of NCD clinics. It aims to promote health through behaviour change with the involvement of community, civil society, community-based organizations, media etc.
6087.source: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
columns: Patients attended  non-communicable diseases ( ncds ) clinics. diseases that cannot be directly transmitted from man to man, animal to animal or from the environment (through air, dust, soil, water, food etc.) to man or animal are deemed as non-communicable diseases.
Patients diagnosed with hypertension and diabetes mellitus( htnand dm )
Patients diagnosed with cardiovascular diseases ( cvds )

6088.name: State or UT Wise number Of Sub-Centres, PHCs, CHCs & HWC Functioning In Rural & Urban Areas
6088.overview: State-wise information on number of sub centers, Primary Health Centres's ( PHC ), sub centers and Primary Health Centres's ( PHC )  under Health and Wellness Centre's ( HWC ) and Community Health Centre’s( CHC ) functioning in rural and urban areas.
6088.source: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
columns: Functioning sub centre’s under health and wellness centre’s( hwc )
Functioning primary health centre’s( phc ) under health and wellness centre’s( hwc )

6089.name: State or UT wise Cases and Deaths due to Diseases in India
6089.overview: This dataset gives information about State/UT wise Cases and Deaths due to Diseases in India. Various diseases includes Acute Diarrhoeal Diseases, Acute Encephalitis Syndrome, Acute Respiratory Infection, Chicken Pox, Chikungunya, Cholera, Dengue, Diphtheria, Encephalitis, Enteric Fever(Typhoid), Gonococcal Infection, Influenza, Japanese Encephalitis, Kala-azar, Malaria, Measles, Meningococcal Meningitis, Pneumonia(All Causes), Rabies, Syphilis, Tetanus Neonatal, Tetanus Other than Neonatal, Viral Hepatitis(All Causes), Viral Meningitis, Whooping Cough. The National Health Profile of India ( NHP ) provides recent trends in demography, disease profile (communicable and non-communicable / lifestyle diseases) and available health resources that define a country’s health status.
6089.source: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare

6090.name: Number of people tested and having HIV/AIDS in different programmes
6090.overview: The dataset is about Number of people tested and having Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV)/Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndrome (AIDS) in different programmes includes people living with HIV/ AIDS currently alive & on Antiretroviral Therapy (ART), number of general clients counselled and tested for HIV and sero-positivity detected and performance of the prevention of parent to child transmission of HIV/AIDS (PPTCT) Programme till December 2020. Based on data from 587 ART centres from across India, 14, 73,041 individuals are living with HlV/ AIDS. A total of 186.6 Lakh general clients were counselled and tested for HIV and 0.56% general clients were detected sero positive for HIV. In 2020, in India 219.69 lakhs pregnant women were tested for HIV, out of whom 6,835(31.1/100000 testes) were detected HIV sero-positive.
6090.source: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
columns: People living with hiv ( plhiv ) currently alive and on art
General individuals detected sero-positive for hiv
Pregnant women detected sero-positive for hiv
Pregnant women and mothers newly initiated on lifelong art
Babies initiated on antiretroviral therapys (arvs) prophylaxis

6091.name: Estimates of Cost of Cultivation/Production
6091.overview: The dataset is about estimates of Cost of Cultivation and cost or Production which includes all operational cost, human labour, fertilizers etc. Cost of cultivation surveys are an important mechanism for data generation on cost structure of crops. These are very intensive surveys wherein data are collected on the various inputs which are used for the cultivation of crop. The data collection approach in these surveys is inquiry based which implies that the information on the input use is obtained by inquiry from the farmer. The farmer is visited repeatedly during the growth stage of the crop and during the time of harvest so that the information on input use is correctly and properly recorded. As a result a huge volume of data is generated through these surveys. The data so collected is generally used to work out cost per unit area or cost per unit weight.
6091.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Material & labour input per hectare of fertilizers.
Material and labour input per hectare of manure
Material and labour input per hectare of human labour
Material and labour input per hectare of animal labour
Break up of cost of cultivation under casual human labour hours

6102.name: State/UT wise number of active Kisan Credit Cards (KCCs)
6102.overview: The dataset gives information about State/UT wise number of active Kisan Credit Cards (KCCs). The Kisan Credit Card (KCC) Scheme was introduced in 1998 for issue of KCC to farmers so that farmers may use them to readily purchase agriculture inputs such as seeds, fertilizers, pesticides etc. and draw cash for their production needs. The KCC scheme is being implemented by the all Co-operative banks, Regional Rural Banks and Public Sector Banks throughout the country. Through the KCC scheme, farmers are exempted from the high interest rates of the loans offered by regular banks. The interest rates for KCC is between 2%-4%. This low interest rate helps farmers in repaying loans better, of course taking into account the harvesting period of the crop and the date at which the loan was granted.
6102.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Gap in kisan credit cards ( kcc ) coverage

6103.name: Tentative Allocation of Financing Facility among States/UTs
6103.overview: The dataset gives information about Tentative Allocation of Financing Facility among States/UTs. Tentative state wise allocation of financing facility has been worked out on the basis of the ratio of total value of output of Agriculture and Allied sectors of states/UTs. Financing facility of Rs. 1,00,000 crore will be provided for funding agriculture infrastructure projects at farm-gate & aggregation points (Primary Agricultural Cooperative Societies, Farmers Producer Organizations, Agriculture entrepreneurs, Start-ups, etc.). Any grant or subsidy available under any present or future scheme of central/state government can be availed for projects under this financing facility.
6103.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6104.name: State wise Integrated Pack House created under MIDH
6104.overview: The dataset gives information about State-wise Integrated Pack House created under Mission for Integrated Development of Horticulture ( MIDH ).
6104.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Number of integrated pack house created

6105.name: State-wise Comparison of Productivity
6105.overview: This dataset gives information about Comparison of Productivity for 3 years (2015-16 to 2017-18) between each state.
6105.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6106.name: State-wise Area and Production
6106.overview: This dataset gives information about State wise Area and Production of Individual Horticultural Crops.

6107.name: Area and Production for Major Producing States in 2016-17
6107.overview: The dataset gives information about District wise Area (in Thousand hectares), and Production (in Thousand Metric Tonnes) of crops for 2016-17 for Major Producing States/Districts.
6107.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6108.name: Advance estimates of production of food grains, oil seeds and commercial crops
6108.overview: The dataset is about Advance estimates of production of food grains, oil seeds and commercial crops. First advance estimates of production of major kharif crops for 2022-23 and the second advance estimates of production of major Rabi crops for the year 2021-22 have been released by the Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare. As per first advance estimates for 2022-23 (Kharif only), total food grain production in the country is estimated at 149.92 million tonnes. As per second advance estimates for 2021-22 (Rabi only), total food grains production in the country is estimated at record 316.06 million tonnes.
6108.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6109.name: All India Crop Situation in Kharif and Rabi season
6109.overview: The dataset is about All India Crop Situation in Kharif and Rabi seasons. Indicating comparative position of area coverage under major crops during current Rabi and kharif seasons includes normal area for whole Rabi season and kharif season, area sown reported and absolute change. The study finds that soybean and wheat are the major crops grown in kharif and Rabi seasons respectively. Summer crops not only provide extra income but also create employment opportunities in between Rabi and kharif for the farmer’s thereby increasing crop intensity. The government has taken new initiatives through various programmes for cultivation of summer crops such as pulses, coarse cereals, nutricereals and oilseeds.
6109.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Average or normal area as on date
Area sown reported in this year
Percentage of reported normal area sown for whole season ( % )
Area sown reported for last year
Absolute change over (+/-) average/normal on date

6121.overview: This dataset contains Estimated Number of Operational Holdings Receiving Irrigation in hundred units and Area Irrigated by different sources like canals, tanks, wells, tube wells and other sources in hundred hectares . This publication presents a comprehensive picture of the Indian horticulture sector by using statistical data across states, districts and time periods, covering diverse aspects such as area, production, productivity, growth trends, percentage share, value of output, outlays and expenditure under horticultural activities, monthly series of prices and arrivals over past year, production and demand over the last three years in respect of onion, potato and tomato; inputs for horticultural crops, exports and imports, infrastructure availability, India’s position in world scenario of horticulture production etc.
6121.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
