columns: Area covered under national programme for organic production (npop) for organic farming.
Area covered under participatory guarantee system (pgs) for organic farming.

6143.name: Population and Agricultural Workers across the Country
6143.overview: This dataset gives information about Population and Agricultural Workers across the Country.
6143.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6144.name: State wise Percentage of Population Below Poverty Line
6144.overview: This Agricultural Statistics at a Glance dataset gives information about State wise Percentage of Population below Poverty Line.
6144.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Percentage of population under below poverty line ( bpl ) ( % )

6145.name: Normal Estimates of area, production and yield of major crops in India
6145.overview: This dataset gives information about Normal Estimates of area, production and yield of major crops in India for different categories like food grains, oilseeds and cash crops in kharif and rabi seasons.
6145.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Type of season includes kharif and rabi
key_columns: Type of season includes kharif and rabi

6146.name: Foreign Direct Investment ( FDI ) equity inflows in agriculture services sector
6146.overview: The Agricultural Statistics at a Glance dataset gives information about Statement on financial year-wise Foreign Direct Investment ( FDI ) equity inflows from April 2001 to September 2021 in agriculture services sector.
6146.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6147.name: Disaggregated Outlay and Expenditure on Developmental Heads by Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
6147.overview: This dataset of Agricultural Statistics at a Glance gives information about Disaggregated Outlay and Expenditure on Developmental Heads by Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare.
6147.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6148.name: Share of Gross Capital Forrmation (GCF) in Agriculture and Allied sector at Current and Constant Prices
6148.overview: This dataset gives information about Share of Gross Capital Formation ( GCF ) in Agriculture and Allied sector in Gross Value Added ( GVA ) of Economy at Current and Constant Prices.
6148.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Public GCF in agriculture and allied sector
Private GCF in agriculture and allied sector
Public share of GCF in agriculture and allied sector in GVA of economy ( % )
Private share of GCF in agriculture and allied sector in GVA of economy ( % )

6149.name: Gross Capital Formation in Agriculture & Allied sector at Current Prices and at Constant Prices
6149.overview: This data set of Agricultural Statistics at a Glance is about Gross Capital Formation in Agriculture & Allied sector at Current Prices and Gross Capital Formation in Economy in constant prices with the base year as 2011-2012.
6149.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Public or private type of agriculture and allied sector.
Gross Capital Formation (GCF) in Agriculture & Allied sector
Percentage Share of Gross Capital Formation (GCF) in Agriculture & Allied sector in Gross Capital Formation (GCF) of economy
key_columns: Public or private type of agriculture and allied sector.

6150.name: Gross State Value Added of Agriculture and Allied Sector at Constant and Current Prices
6150.overview: The dataset of Agricultural Statistics at a Glance is about Gross State Value Added of Agriculture and Allied Sector at Constant and Current Prices, where prices are from 2011-12. The date set also has the percentage share of Gross State Value Added in current prices so as the percentage growth over the previous year at current prices.
6150.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Gross state value added of agriculture and allied sector at constant prices
Gross state value added of agriculture and allied sector at current prices
Growth rates of gross state value added of agriculture and allied sector at constant prices ( % )
Share of gross state value added ( gsva ) of agriculture and allied sector in total gsva of state at current prices in ( % ) share

6151.name: Trends in Percentage Composition of Consumer Expenditure
6151.overview: Agricultural Statistics at a Glance is the flagship publication of the Directorate of Economics & Statistics and the dataset gives information about Trends in Percentage Composition of Consumer Expenditure since 1993-94.
6151.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Percentage share in total consumer expenditure ( % ).

6152.name: State wise Storage Capacity
6152.overview: The dataset by Agricultural Statistics at a Glance is about State wise Storage Capacity. Storage capacity pertains to Food Corporation of India ( FCI ) both owned and hired and state agencies.
6152.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6153.name: State wise Classification of Agricultural Workers
6153.overview: The dataset by Agricultural Statistics at a Glance is about State wise Classification of Agricultural Workers. The population of India exclude those portions of Jammu & Kashmir, which are under illegal occupation of Pakistan and China.
6153.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6154.name: State-wise Area and Production of various Horticultural Crops
6154.overview: State-wise Area (in 1000 hectares) and Production (in 1000 million tonnes) of various Horticultural Crops during the Year 2020-21 is the 3rd Advance Estimates by Agricultural Statistics at a Glance. This is the flagship publication of the Directorate of Economics & Statistics and is regarded as the most reliable source of comprehensive and updated database on variegated aspects of the agriculture sector in India, including economic & social dimensions, production, trade, minimum support prices, cost of production, food security, subsidy, agriculture input, insurance, land use statistics etc.
6154.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6155.name: Wholesale Price Index and Growth Rate (Inflation) of Foodgrains (Base:2004-05)
6155.overview: Wholesale Price Index and Growth Rate (Inflation) of food grains and commercial crops of different commodities like primary articles, manufactured products, foodgrains ( cereals + pulses), fuel & power, food articles, non-food articles etc., for the base year 2004-05.
6155.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Value of wholesael price index for every year.

6156.name: Wholesale Price Index and Growth Rate (Inflation) of Foodgrains (Base:2011-12)
6156.overview: Wholesale Price Index and Growth Rate (Inflation) of food grains and commercial crops of different commodities like primary articles, manufactured products, foodgrains ( cereals + pulses), fuel & power, food articles, non-food articles etc., for the base year 2011-12.
6156.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Value of wholesael price index for every year.

6157.name: Minimum Support Prices (According to crop year)
6157.overview: Minimum Support Prices of commodities like paddy, urad, cotton, jute, barley, sugarcane etc. by crop variety like common, grade A, hybrid, medium etc and weighted average of cost of production in rupees per quintal. Cost A2 includes all actual expenses in cash & kind incurred in production by owner and rent paid for leased-in-land, Family Labour (FL) is calculated on the basis of statuary wage rate or the actual market rate, whichever is higher.
6157.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Commodites includes kharif and rabi crops
Minimum support price ( msp ) of crops from different commodities.
Weighted average cost of production(a2+fl) of major crops.
key_columns: Commodites includes kharif and rabi crops

6158.name: Procurement of Pulses and Oilseeds by NAFED under Price Support Scheme (PSS)
6158.overview: Procurement of Pulses and Oilseeds by National Agricultural Cooperative Marketing Federation of India Ltd (NAFED) under Price Support Scheme (PSS). Pulses and oilseeds included in this dataset are arhar, copra, moong, sesamum, sunflower seed etc., in major states.
6158.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: commodities under pluses and oil seeds.
Support price for fair average quality ( FAQ ).
Quantity of oil seeds and pulses procured.
States with major procurement of pulses and oil seeds
key_columns: commodities under pluses and oil seeds.
States with major procurement of pulses and oil seeds

6159.name: Selected Economic and Social Indicator
6159.overview: This dataset shows Selected Economic and Social Indicators which includes GDP at constant and current prices, including Gross Domestic Product ( GDP ) rates, wholesale price index, production food grains, crude oil, coal and also foreign trade on imports and exports, birth rates, education literacy rates etc.
6159.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Gross Domestic Product ( GDP ) at current prices
Gross Domestic Product ( GDP ) at constant prices
Per capita income at constant prices
Percentage of Gross capital formation to GDP at current prices. ( % )
Percentage of Gross domestic savings to GDP at current prices ( % )
Consumer Price Index for Industrial workers (CPI-IW).
Foreign exchange reserves in US millions
Life expectancy at birth in years
Life expectancy at birth of males in years
Life expectancy at birth of females in years
Percenatge of education literacy rate in male ( % )
Percenatge of education literacy rate in female ( % )

6160.name: Share of GCF in Agriculture & Allied sector in GVA from Agriculture & Allied sector
6160.overview: This dataset tells about Share of Gross Capital Formation ( GCF ) in Agriculture and Allied sector in Gross Value Added ( GVA ) from Agriculture and Allied sector at constant and current prices in percentage under public and private sectors. Here 2018-19 are 3rd revised estimates, 2019-20 are 2nd revised estimates and 2020-21 are 1st revised estimates.
6160.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Percentage share of GCF in agriculture and allied sector in GVA from agriculture and allied sector at constant prices ( % )
Percentage share of GCF in agriculture and allied sector in GVA from agriculture and allied sector at current prices ( % )

6161.name: All India Area, Production and Yield along with coverage under Irrigation
6161.overview: All India Area (1000 hectares), Production (1000 tonnes) for Sunhemp in 1000 Bales of 180 Kgs each and Yield (kilogram per hectare) along with coverage under Irrigation in various crops like food grains, rice, wheat, jowar, bajra, maize, total pulses, gram, tur, groundnut, rapeseed and mustard, cotton etc.
6161.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6162.name: Area, Production and Yield in Major Producing States along with coverage under Irrigation
6162.overview: This dataset regarding Area, Production and Yield in Major Producing States along with coverage under Irrigation different crops like food grains, oilseeds, sugarcane, etc. The Directorate of Economics & Statistics (DES) releases estimates of area, production and yield in respect of principal crops of food grains, oilseeds, sugarcane, fibers and important commercial crops. These crops account for a significant share in the Gross Value Added by agriculture and allied sector.
6162.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6163.name: State wise Production of Milk, Eggs, Meat and Wool
6163.overview: The dataset presents State wise Production of Milk (1000 Tonnes), Eggs (lakh numbers), Meat (1000 Tonnes) and Wool (1000 kgs) from the entire rural and urban areas of States/UTs and the survey is conducted by the States/UTs in three seasons.
6163.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6164.name: Fish Production in India
6164.overview: This dataset contains Fish Production in India in inland and marine in thousand tonnes. The fisheries sector is a source of cheap and nutritious food, at the same time it is an instrument of livelihood for a large section of economically backward population of the country.
6164.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6165.name: India’s Imports or Exports of Principal Agricultural Commodities
6165.overview: This dataset having information about India’s Imports or Exports of Principal Agricultural Commodities includes tea, coffee, rice, groundnut etc. India is among the world’s leading producers of many commodities such as dairy, cereals, spices, fruits & vegetables, rice, wheat, cotton, and others.
6165.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Quantity of imports or exports of principal agricultural commodities
Value of imports or exports of principal agricultural commodities

6166.name: Consumer Price Index
6166.overview: This dataset indicates Consumer Price Index (Combined) and growth rate (Inflation) of Food and Beverages. Data is imputed for certain commodities for April, 2020 and May 2020 as due to COVID it was not feasible for the field enumerators to visit the specified outlets to collect data quotations.
6166.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Groups and sub groups contains all  food beverages like cereals and products , aeat and fish, pulses, spices etc.
Weight of the groups and sub groups
Consumer Price Index ( CPI ) of food and beverages for base year 2012
Growth Rate (Inflation) of food and beverages.
key_columns: Groups and sub groups contains all  food beverages like cereals and products , aeat and fish, pulses, spices etc.

6167.name: Index Numbers of Area, Production and Yield
6167.overview: This dataset related to index Numbers of Area, Production and Yield in agriculture until 1999-2000. Yield rate is defined as production per unit of area. Principal Crops as referred to in this publication include only those crops which are covered for preparation of index numbers.
6167.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Index numbers of area of principal crops
Index numbers of production of principal crops
Index numbers of yield of principal crops

6168.name: State-wise Procurement of Rice and Wheat in major Rice and Wheat Producing States
6168.overview: This dataset refers to State-wise Procurement of Rice and Wheat in major rice and wheat producing states in thousand tonnes. 50000 tonnes Maize was approved as central pool on 30.12.2016, 20000 tonnes of Bajra has been approved as central pool, 4385 tonnes of Nutri grains has not been approved and 115000 tonnes of Bajra has been approved as Central Pool.
6168.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns:
Procurement of rice and wheat in major rice and wheat producing 
states.

6169.name: All-India Estimates of Yield of Major Crops
6169.overview: This dataset having All-India estimates of yield of major crops. The yield estimates of major crops are obtained through analysis of Crop Cutting Experiments (CCE) conducted under scientifically designed General Crop Estimation Surveys (GCES).The primary objective of GCES is to obtain fairly reliable estimates of average yield of principal food and non-food crops for States and UTs which are important from the point of view of crop production.
6169.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6170.name: Area and Production of Horticulture crops
6170.overview: This dataset indicates Area and Production of horticulture crops. Horticulture Crops like almonds, apples, turmeric, grapes, kiwi etc. are of different categories like fruits, vegetables, flowers, aromatic etc. which provides data about area in 1000 hectares and production in 1000 metric tonnes.
6170.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6171.name: Livestock Population
6171.overview: This dataset tells about Livestock population in India. Livestock is about Animal husbandry and dairying of animals which are in millions. Livestock of species like cattle, buffalo, sheep, camels, mules, donkey etc. are covered. The data were collected from each household and non-household of both, rural and urban areas.
6171.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6172.name: State-wise Yield by Kharif and Rabi seasons Food Grains
6172.overview: This dataset gives information about State wise yield by kharif and rabi seasons food grains like rice, wheat, bajra, maize, etc. 2020-21 is 4th advance estimates. Yield rate is defined as production per unit of area.
6172.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6173.name: Selected Categories of Land Use
6173.overview: This dataset indicates Selected Categories of Land Use. The indicators includes in this dataset are net area sown, total cropped area, area sown more than once, net irrigated area, gross irrigated area and area irrigated more than once in million hectares.
6173.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6174.name: All India rainfall distribution
6174.overview: This dataset refers to All India rainfall distribution till 28.02.2022 in different seasons like monsoon, post-monsoon, winter, pre- monsoon. The indicators includes in this dataset are actual rainfall, normal rainfall and percentage departure of realized rainfall from normal rainfall in millimetres.
6174.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6175.name: Consumption of Electricity for Agricultural Purposes
6175.overview: This dataset regarding Consumption of electricity for agricultural purposes. It gives the data about how much electricity is consumed for agriculture and total electricity consumed in gigawatt hours with percentage share of electricity consumption for agriculture to total electricity consumption.
6175.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Percentage share of electricity consumption for agriculture to total electricty consumption.

6176.name: Number and Area of Operational Holdings by Size Group
6176.overview: This dataset shows information regarding Number and area of operational holdings by size and categories like marginal (less than one hectare), small (1 to 2 hectares), large (10 hectares and above). The operational holding determines the use of technology and in turn the production and farm income. The size of operating unit affects the income from agriculture which is the main source of income of people and the status of size group, number of operational holdings, area of operational holdings, average size of holdings.
6176.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6177.name: Gross Capital Formation in Agriculture & Allied sector at Current Prices and at Constant (2004-05) Prices
6177.overview: This dataset gives information about Gross Capital Formation in Agriculture & Allied sector at current and constant prices by public or private type of agriculture and allied sector with base year 2004-05. In this dataset 2012-13 are 1st revised estimates, 2011-12 are 2nd revised estimates and 2010-11 are 3rd revised estimates.
6177.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Public or private type of agriculture and allied sector.
Gross Capital Formation (GCF) in Agriculture & Allied sector
Percentage Share of Gross Capital Formation (GCF) in Agriculture & Allied sector in Gross Capital Formation (GCF) of economy
key_columns: Public or private type of agriculture and allied sector.

6178.name: Tariffs and Bound Rates on Major Agricultural Commodities or Groups
6178.overview: Tariffs and Bound Rates on Major Agricultural Commodities or Groups like cereals and pulses, dairy products, horticulture, plantation crops etc. Tariffs impose costs both in the country where they are applied and on other countries. This dataset includes indicators like Prevailing Basic Customs Duty ( BCD ), Agriculture Infrastructure and Development Cess ( AIDC ) and Bound duty.
6178.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Agriculture Infrastructure and Development Cess ( AIDC ) ( % )

6179.name: Food Subsidy
6179.overview: The dataset on Food Subsidy is about both a consumer and a producer subsidy. It is used to buy grains from farmers at a price that makes farming remunerative and then sell the grain to poor households at lower prices or for free.
6179.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6180.name: Consumption, Production and Import of Fertilisers
6180.overview: This dataset having information on Consumption, Production and Import of Fertilizers like Nitrogen, Phosphate and Potash in lakh tonnes with Cost and freight ( C&F ) Value of Import. There was no import of Urea in 2000-01, 2002-03 and 2003-04 in Government account. The imports made after decanalisation of phosphatic fertilisers and potassic fertilisers include the quantities imported by private parties also.
6180.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6181.name: Performance of South West Monsoon
6181.overview: This dataset tells about Performance of South West Monsoon in India. The southwest monsoon is so powerful that its performance from June to September decides the state of agricultural productivity in India, which in turn, decides the state of the economy. Total number of Meteorological sub-divisions for large excess or excess or normal rainfall was 35 up to 2001. From 2002 onwards, the number of meteorological sub-divisions is 36.
6181.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Number of meteorological sub-divisions for large excess or excess or normal rainfall
Number of meteorological sub divisions for deficient or large deficient rainfall
Percentage of districts with large excess or excess or normal rainfall ( % )
Actual rainfall as percentage of normal rainfall in all India ( % )

6182.name: Break-Up of Cost of Cultivation
6182.overview: This dataset gives information about Break-Up of Cost of Cultivation. The comprehensive scheme for studying the cost of cultivation of principal crops in India was initiated in 1970-71 on the recommendations of a technical committee on indices of input costs appointed by Government of India. The items of cost of cultivation cover both paid out cost (out of pocket expenses) and the imputed costs. The items covered under these costs are hired labour (human, animal and machinery), maintenance expenses on owned animals and machinery, expenses on material inputs such as seed (home grown and purchased), fertiliser, manure (owned & purchased), pesticides and irrigation, depreciation on implements and farm buildings (such as cattle sheds, machine sheds, storage sheds), land revenue, rent paid for leased-in-land.
6182.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Fertilizer cost under fertilizer and manure
Manure cost under fertilizer and manure
Depreciation on implements and farm building under fixed costs
Interest on fixed capital under fixed costs
Land revenue, taxes, cesses under fixed costs
Rent paid for leased in land under fixed costs
Rental value of owned land under fixed costs
Operational cost on curing attached under human labour
Operational cost on curing casual under human labour
Operational cost on curing family under human labour

6183.name: State wise National Agricultural Insurance Scheme (NAIS)-Cumulative upto Kharif 2014-15, Rabi 2014-15, Rabi 2015-16
6183.overview: This dataset regarding State wise National Agricultural Insurance Scheme (NAIS)-Cumulative up to Kharif 2014-15, Rabi 2014-15, Rabi 2015-16. Insurance schemes includes National Agricultural Insurance Scheme ( NAIS ), Modified National Agricultural Insurance Scheme ( MNAIS ), Weather-based Crop Insurance Scheme ( WBCIS ). The indicators includes in this dataset are number of farmers covered, area insured, sum insured, farmer’s premium, State government premium share, Government of India premium share, gross premium, claims payable, claims paid and number of farmers benefitted.
6183.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Season upto kharif 2014-15, rabi 2014-15 and rabi 2015-16
key_columns: Season upto kharif 2014-15, rabi 2014-15 and rabi 2015-16

6184.name: Season wise National Agricultural Insurance Scheme (NAIS) - Cumulative upto Kharif, Rabi 2015-16
6184.overview: This dataset having information on Season wise National Agricultural Insurance Scheme (NAIS) - Cumulative up to Kharif, Rabi 2015-16. Insurance schemes includes National Agricultural Insurance Scheme ( NAIS ), Modified National Agricultural Insurance Scheme ( MNAIS ), Weather-based Crop Insurance Scheme ( WBCIS ). The indicators includes in this dataset are number of farmers covered, area insured, sum insured, farmer’s premium, State government premium share, Government of India premium share, gross premium, claims payable, claims paid and number of farmers benefitted.
6184.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6185.name: Estimated Number of Operational Holdings by Size Classes and Irrigation Status
6185.overview: This dataset refers to Estimated Number of operational holdings by Size Classes and irrigation status. The operational holding determines the use of technology and in turn the production and farm income. The size of operating unit affects the income from agriculture which is the main source of income of people and the status of size group.
6185.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6186.name: State-wise Model Village status of Soil Health Card Scheme
6186.overview: This dataset related to State-wise model village status of soil health card scheme. It also has target for soil samples collection, testing & distribution of SHCs. Soil Health Card Scheme is a very beneficial scheme for farmers. There are many farmers in India. And they do not know which types of crops they should grow to get maximum yield. Basically, they do not know the quality and the type of their soil. They might know by experience what crops grow and what crops fail. But they don't know what they can do to improve the condition of the soil.
6186.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Target for soil samples collection, testing & distribution of shcs
Count of soil samples collected from each state.
Count of soil samples tested from each state.
Count of soil health cards distributed in each state.

6187.name: Broad region-wise Monsoon (June-September) Rainfall Distribution
6187.overview: This dataset having  information on Actual, normal and percentage departure of rainfall distribution in different regions like north-west India, central India, south peninsula and east & north-east India.
6187.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Actual rainfall distribution in paticular region
Normal rainfall distribution in paticular region

6189.name: Crop wise Distribution of Certified or Quality Seeds
6189.overview: Crop-wise Distribution of Certified or Quality Seeds. Certified seeds are produced and labelled the rules and standards of a government seed-certifying agency. Certified seeds ensure that growers and buyers get the crop and variety they want, with a high germination rate and minimal contamination by the seeds of weeds and other plants. Seed is a basic input in agriculture. As per Seed Act (1966) seed includes seed of food crops including edible oil seeds and seeds of fruits & vegetables, cotton seeds, seeds of cattle fodder, Jute seeds. The quality seed should have high genetic purity, high pure seed percentage (physical purity), high germ inability, high vigour, good shape, size, colour etc., according to the specification of variety.
6189.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Crop wise distribution of certified or quality seeds

6190.name: State-wise Coconut Palm Insurance Scheme
6190.overview: State-wise Coconut Palm Insurance Scheme (CPIS) provides information about how the scheme is benefited for coconut and palm farmers. Coconut and palms are perennial crops. Coconut is cultivated under rain-fed management and is susceptible to biotic and abiotic stresses, whereas palm trees are characterized by periodic system of crop setting and outcomes, hence resemble seasonal annual crops. So, both are eligible for insurance cover. This dataset gives information about indicators like state, number of farmers under the scheme, number of palms, sum insured, premium amount given to farmer, state and Coconut Development Board (CBD), claims paid and number of farmers benefited.
6190.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Count of palms for coconut palm insurance scheme
State wise amount insured for coconut palm insurance scheme
State wise premium for farmers under coconut palm insurance scheme
State premium for coconut palm insurance scheme
State wise coconut development board (cdb) premium
Claims paid for coconut palm insurance scheme
Farmers benifited under coconut palm insurance scheme

6191.name: Production and Use of Agricultural Inputs in India
6191.overview: Production and Use of Agricultural Inputs in India. Agriculture is mostly made up of cultivation practices by giving subsequent inputs namely seeds, electricity power, mechanization, fertilizers and pesticides etc. This dataset gives information about indicators like programmes which has seeds which includes production of breeder seeds in thousand quintals, production of foundation seeds in lakh quintals, distribution of certified or quality seeds in lakh quintals,  consumption of chemical fertilisers like Nitrogenous (N), Phosphatic(P) and Potassic(K) in thousand tonnes and consumption of pesticides of technical grade material in thousand tonnes.
6191.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Distribution of certified or quality seeds
Consumption of nitrogenous, phosphatic and potassic fertilizers.
Consumption of pesticides of technical grade material.

6192.name: State wise Consumption of Fertilisers in Terms of Nutrients (N, P & K)
6192.overview: State wise Consumption and Estimated Consumption of Fertilisers gives information in terms of nutrients like Nitrogen (N), Phosphorus (P) and Potassium (K) per hectare in thousand tonnes for states per zone wise. Per hectare fertilizer consumption is higher in the case of crops with a larger proportion of irrigated area. About 40 percent of the agricultural area in India is irrigated, accounting for 68.5 percent of total fertilizer consumption. Estimates of Gross Cropped Area (GCA) are based on the data from respective State Governments.
6192.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6193.name: State wise Status of Soil Health Card Scheme
6193.overview: State wise Status of Soil Health Card Scheme during Cycle-I and Cycle-II. Status of soil health card scheme includes  indicators like cumulative target for soil samples collection and testing, number of samples collected, number of samples tested, cumulative target for printing and distribution of Soil Health Card Scheme ( SHCs ) and number of Soil Health Card Scheme ( SHCs ) distributed during cycle-I and cycle-II.
6193.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Cumulative target for soil samples collection and testing
Cumulative target for printing and distribution of shcs
Soil health card scheme ( shcs ) distributed

6194.name: Flow of Institutional Credit to Agriculture Sector
6194.overview: Flow of Institutional Credit to Agriculture Sector from different agencies. It includes indicators like production Short Term (ST) credit  which has co-operative banks, RRBs(Regional Rural Banks) and commercial banks, MT or LT( Medium Term or Long Term) credit which also includes co-operative banks, RRBs(Regional Rural Banks) and commercial banks with total which ranges from the year 1999-2000 to 2021-22.
6194.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Particulars like production short term credit, medium term credit and long term credit
Flow of institutional credit to agriculture sector
key_columns: Particulars like production short term credit, medium term credit and long term credit

6195.name: Agricultural Land by type of Use
6195.overview: Agricultural Land by type of Use. Indicators includes in this dataset like geographical area, reporting area for land utilisation statistics, forest, land not available for cultivation, other uncultivated land excluding fallow land, permanent pastures and other grazing lands, land under miscellaneous tree crops and groves not included in net area sown, culturable waste land, fallow lands other than current fallows, current fallows, net area sown, agriculture land or cultivable land or culturable land or arable land etc.in thousand hectares. In this dataset ‘0’ relates to the area below 500 hectares.
6195.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Reporting area for land utilisation statistics
Agriculture land not available for cultivation
Permanent pastures and other grazing lands
Land under miscellaneous tree crops and groves not included in net area sown
Fallow lands other than current fallows
Agriculture land or cultivable land or culturable land or arable land

6196.name: Share of area under organic cultivation
6196.overview: Share of area under organic cultivation in each country for every year in thousand hectares. Organic cultivation which involves the planting of crops and raising animals in natural ways. It involves the use of natural resources which avoid artificial materials to maintain soil fertility and maintains ecological balance thereby reducing pollution and degradation. Organic cultivation is a new phase in India. According to the Union Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare, approximately 78 million hectares of farms have been under organic cultivation the country which is 2% of the 140.1 million hectares of net sown area.
6196.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6197.name: Water Stress Percentage
6197.overview: Water Stress Percentage in each country. Water stress is the ratio between total freshwater withdrawn by all major sectors and total renewable freshwater resources, after taking into account environmental water requirements. Water stress occurs when the demand for water exceeds the available amount during a certain period or when poor quality restricts its use. Water stress causes deterioration of fresh water resources in terms of quantity (aquifer over-exploitation, dry rivers, etc.) and quality (eutrophication, organic matter pollution, saline intrusion, etc.)
6197.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Percenatge of water stress in selected countries

6198.name: Crop-wise Requirement and Availability of Certified/ Quality Seeds
6198.overview: Crop-wise requirement and availability of certified or quality seeds. Certified or quality seed plays an important role in achieving higher yields. Hence supply of quality seed to the farmers is one of the most important interventions to increase the production and productivity of any crop. This dataset gives the information about indicators like crop names like wheat, paddy, ragi, barley etc., requirement, availability in public and private in lakh quintals.
6198.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Requirement of certified or quality seeds
Public availability of certified or quality seeds
Private availability of certified or quality seeds
Total availability of certified or quality seeds

6199.name: Crop-wise requirement and availability of Certified/Quality of Hybrid Seeds
6199.overview: Crop-wise requirement and availability of Certified or Quality of Hybrid Seeds for different crops. Certified or quality seed plays an important role in achieving higher yields. Hence supply of quality seed to the farmers is one of the most important interventions to increase the production and productivity of any crop. This dataset includes indicators like crop names like wheat, paddy, ragi, barley etc. with requirement and availability in thousand tonnes.
6199.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6200.name: State-wise Consumption of Electricity for Agricultural Purpose
6200.overview: State-wise Consumption of Electricity for Agricultural Purpose as per regions including union territories. It gives the data with indicators like agriculture in Giga Watt-hour(GWh) , total energy sold in Giga Watt-hour(GWh) and  percentage share of consumption of agriculture.
6200.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Percentage share of electricity consumption for agriculture to total electricty consumption.

6201.name: State-wise Agricultural Loan disbursed
6201.overview: State-wise Agricultural Loan disbursed. This dataset includes indicators like state names like Delhi, Haryana, Himachal Pradesh, etc., crop loan with number of accounts and amount disbursed, term loan with number of accounts and amount disbursed in lakhs. The Interest Subvention Scheme is to provide short term agri-loans to the farmer at concessional rate of interest. Under the scheme, short term crop loans up to Rs.3.00 lakh is available to farmer engaged in agriculture and other allied activities at benchmark rate.
6201.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Agriculture loan accounts under crop and term loan

6202.name: State wise Irrigation Potential created under Accelerated Irrigation Benefit Programme (AIBP)- All Major and Medium Irrigation Projects
6202.overview: State-wise Irrigation Potential created under Accelerated Irrigation Benefit Programme ( AIBP )- All Major and Medium Irrigation Projects in different Irrigation potentials like ultimate potential, potential created before Accelerated Irrigation Benefit Programme ( AIBP ), target for Accelerated Irrigation Benefit Programme ( AIBP ) and potential created under Accelerated Irrigation Benefit Programme ( AIBP ). Irrigation potential  is the total area which is technically feasible, economically and financially profitable, socially viable and environmentally acceptable that is irrigated or capable of being irrigated on the basis of water availability, land availability and suitability.
6202.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Potential created before accelerated irrigation benefit programme ( aibp )
Potential created under accelerated irrigation benefit programme ( aibp )

6203.name: Irrigated and Un-irrigated Area by Size Classes under different Crops
6203.overview: Irrigated and Un-irrigated Area by Size Classes under different Crops. This dataset includes indicators like crops like paddy, wheat, other cereals, total pulses, sugarcane etc., irrigated area with size classes like marginal, small, semi medium, medium and large, unirrigated area with size classes like marginal, small, semi medium, medium and large. In this dataset all crops include few more crops other than those listed viz., fruits, vegetables, spices tea, coffee, rubber, etc. Paddy includes paddy of all the seasons.
6203.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Type of area like irrigated or unirrigated area
key_columns: Type of area like irrigated or unirrigated area

6204.name: Usage of Chemical Fertilizers, Farm Yard Manure and Pesticides by major Size Groups
6204.overview: Usage of Chemical Fertilizers, Farm Yard Manure and Pesticides by major Size Groups. This dataset has indicators like size groups like marginal, small, semi medium, medium and large in thousand hectares, gross cropped area, area treated with fertilizers, quantity applied in Di Ammonium Phosphate ( DAP ), quantity applied in urea, quantity applied in super phosphate, quantity applied in ammonium sulphate, quantity applied in nitrogen, quantity applied in phosphorus, quantity applied in potassium in metric tonnes. Chemical fertilizers have been widely used to achieve maximum productivity in conventional agricultural systems which plays a substantial role in plant growth promotion.
6204.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Quantity of di ammonium phosphate ( dap ) applied to agricultural land area
Quantity of urea applied to agricultural land area
Quantity of super phosphate applied to agricultural land area
Quantity of ammoninum sulphate applied to agricultural land area
Quantity of nitrogen (n) applied to agricultural land area
Quantity of phosphorus (p) applied to agricultural land area
Quantity of potassium (k) applied to agricultural land area

6205.name: State-wise-Number of Active KCC (Yearly Data)
6205.overview: State-wise-Number of Active KCC (Yearly Data) provides information about state wise active number of Kisan Credit Cards ( KCC ). The Kisan Credit Card scheme is a Government of India scheme which provides farmers with timely access to credit. The Kisan Credit Card (KCC) scheme was launched in 1998 with the aim of providing short-term formal credit to farmers and was created by NABARD (National Bank for Agriculture and Rural Development).The KCC scheme was introduced to ensure that the credit requirements for farmers in the agriculture, fisheries and animal husbandry sector were being met. This was done by helping them avail short-term loans and provide them with a credit limit to purchase equipment and for their other expenses as well.
6205.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: State wise active number of kisan credit cards.

6206.name: State-wise Sale of Tractors(2014-15 to 2021-22)
6206.overview: State-wise Sale of Tractors. As a result of different programmes implemented by the government of India over the years the farm mechanization has been increasing steadily over the years. This is evident from the sale of tractors and power tillers, taken as indicator of the adoption of the mechanized means of farming.
6206.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6207.name: Area Irrigated by different Source of Irrigation by Size Classes (Yearly Data)
6207.overview: Area Irrigated by different Sources of Irrigation by Size Classes in thousand hectares. This dataset includes different indicators such as size class like marginal, small, semi medium, medium and large and different sources of irrigation like canals, tanks, wells, tube wells and others.
6207.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Area irrigated by diffeent size class
key_columns: Area irrigated by diffeent size class

6208.name: State-wise crop area insured under all Insurance Schemes
6208.overview: State-wise crop area insured under all Insurance Schemes . This dataset includes different indicators like gross area sown, area insured and percentage of area insured for different states and union territories in lakh hectares. At present four crop Insurance schemes namely National Agricultural Insurance Scheme (NAIS), Pilot Modified National Agricultural Insurance Scheme (MNAIS), Pilot Weather Based Crop Insurance Scheme (WBCIS) and Pilot Coconut Palm Insurance Scheme (CPIS) is being implemented in the country.
6208.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Gross area sown under all insurance schemes
Area insured under all insurance schemes

6209.name: Crop-wise area Insured under all Insurance Schemes
6209.overview: Crop-wise area Insured under all Insurance Schemes. This dataset provides information on indicators like gross area sown, area insured and percentage of area insured for different states and union territories in lakh hectares. At present four crop Insurance schemes namely National Agricultural Insurance Scheme (NAIS), Pilot Modified National Agricultural Insurance Scheme (MNAIS), Pilot Weather Based Crop Insurance Scheme (WBCIS) and Pilot Coconut Palm Insurance Scheme (CPIS) is being implemented in the country.
6209.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Gross area sown under all insurance schemes
Area insured under all insurance schemes

6210.name: Indebtedness of Agricultural Households(all-India) in Different Size Classes of Land Possessed
6210.overview: Indebtedness of Agricultural Households (all-India) in Different Size Classes of Land Possessed gives information about indebtedness of agricultural households. This dataset includes indicators like land possessed in hectares, estimated number of agricultural households in lakhs, percentage to total in each class, estimated number of indebted agricultural households in lakhs, percentage distribution of indebted agricultural household, percentage of indebted agricultural households  and average outstanding loan amount.
6210.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Percentage to total in each class ( % )
Estimated number of indebted agricultural households
Percentage distribution of indebted agricultural households ( % )

6211.name: Incidence of Indebtedness in Major States
6211.overview: Incidence of Indebtedness in Major States. This dataset includes indicators like state, estimated number of indebted agricultural households, percentage to total indebted agricultural households, percentage share in total foodgrains with area and production. Incidence of Indebtedness is defined as number of households with any one loan divided by all households in that population segment.
6211.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Estimated number of indebted agricultural households
Percentage to total indebted agricultural households ( % )
Percentage share in area of total foodgrains in 2020-21 ( % )
Percentage share in production of total foodgrains in 2020-21 ( % )

6212.name: The percentage distribution of indebted agricultural households by size class of land possessed for selected States
6212.overview: The percentage distribution of indebted agricultural households by size class of land possessed for selected States. It includes indicators like state, percentage of marginal indebted agricultural households, percentage of small indebted agricultural households, percentage of semi medium indebted agricultural households, percentage of medium indebted agricultural households, percentage of large indebted agricultural households.
6212.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Percentage of marginal indebted agricultural households upto 1.0 ha of land ( % )
Percentage of small indebted agricultural households from 1.01 to 2.00 ha ( % )
Percentage of semi medium indebted agricultural households 2.01 to 4.00 ha ( % )
Percentage of medium indebted agricultural households 4.01 to 10.00 ha ( % )
Percentage of large indebted agricultural households >10.00 ha ( % )

6213.name: Year wise sale of Tractors and Power Tillers
6213.overview: Year wise sale of Tractors and Power Tillers gives information about the sale of tractors and power trillers in thousands with indicators tractors and power trillers. Mechanization has been well received in India as one of the important elements of modernization of agriculture. It is now recognized that availability of mechanical power and improved equipment has enabled sates like Punjab, Haryana and Western region of Uttar Pradesh to achieve high levels of land productivity.
6213.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6214.name: Gross Cropped Area Percentage Distribution
6214.overview: Gross Cropped Area Percentage Distribution. It includes indicators like crops like jowar, bajra, pulses, sugarcane, fruits, vegetables, oilseeds etc, and percentage share of area to gross cropped area, this represents the total area sown once or more than once in a particular year that is the area is counted as many times as there are sowings in a year. Area represents the areas on which crops are cultivated more than once during the agricultural year this is obtained by deducting net area sown from gross cropped area.
6214.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Percentage share of area to gross cropped area ( % )

6215.name: State wise Area Covered under Micro Irrigation
6215.overview: The dataset includes indicators like name of state, drip, sprinkler .The Government is making all efforts to enhance water use efficiency at farm level through adoption of micro irrigation in all the States of the Country and so far an area of 137.80 lakh ha has been covered under Micro Irrigation. The objective of facilitating the States in mobilising resources for expanding coverage of micro irrigation, Micro Irrigation Fund (MIF) has been created with National Bank for Agriculture and Rural Development ( NABARD ). The major objective of the fund is to facilitate the States in mobilizing the resources for expanding coverage of Micro Irrigation by taking up special and innovative projects and also for incentivising micro irrigation beyond the provisions available under Per Drop More Crop ( PDMC ) scheme to encourage farmers to install Micro Irrigation systems
6215.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Total area covered under micro irrigation

6216.name: Ceilings on Land Holdings
6216.overview: Dataset about Ceilings on Land Holdings gives information about irrigated land with one or two crops. This dataset includes indicators like state, irrigated land with two crops, irrigated land with one crop and  dry land in acres. Ceilings on land holdings means fixing a maximum portion of land that can possibly be owned by an individual or particular family. Ceiling limits mainly set limits over land possession. Ceiling on land holdings helps in setting a limit over how land an individual or corporation can hold. In this dataset, the actual limits for lands in Karnataka and Uttar Pradesh are higher due to classification of land. The actual ceiling limits in Himachal Pradesh and Rajasthan are higher due to hilly terrain and desert lands.
6216.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Irrigated land area with minimum two crops
Irrigated land area with maximum two crops
Irrigated land area with minimum one crop
Irrigated land area with one maximum crop

6217.name: Area,Production and Yield of Principal Crops
6217.overview: Area, Production and Yield of Principal Crops in various Countries. This dataset includes indicators like country, area, production, yield and production percentage. The Directorate of Economics & Statistics (DES) releases estimates of area, production and yield in respect of principal crops of food grains, oilseeds, sugarcane, fibres and important commercial crops. These crops account for a significant share in the Gross Value Added by agriculture and allied sector.
6217.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6218.name: India’s Position in World Agriculture
6218.overview: Dataset shows India’s Position in World Agriculture provides information about the position of India in world agriculture. This dataset includes indicators like item like area, population, crop production, fruits and vegetables production, livestock and dairy products, India, world, percentage share, India’s rank and next to.
6218.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Percentage share of india in the world
Postion of india next to the other countries
key_columns: Postion of india next to the other countries

6219.name: State-wise Progress under Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY) - Cumulative upto Rabi 2020-21
6219.overview: Progress under Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana ( PMFBY ) across the states. Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY) is the government sponsored crop insurance scheme. It is a yearly data from year range 2016-17 to 2020-21. It consists of detailed information related to number of farmer applicants covered under PMFBY scheme and area insured in hectares and the amount insured for particular state. The amount released under farmers premium, government of India premium (share), state government premium (share) and gross premium is in rupees lakhs. This dataset also consists of information related to claims reported, claims paid and number of farmer applicants benefited for a particular state for particular year.
6219.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6220.name: Estimated Institutional Credit taken for Agricultural Purposes by Size Groups
6220.overview: Estimated Institutional Credit taken for Agricultural Purposes by Size Groups. This dataset includes indicators like total number of operational holdings, estimated number of operational holdings that took institutional credit, number of operational holdings that took institutional credit from Primary Agricultural Credit Society ( PACS ) , Primary Land Development Bank of State Land Development Bank ( PLDB/ SLDB ), Commercial Bank Branch ( CBB ), Regional Rural Bank Branch ( RRBB ) by different size groups marginal, small, semi medium, medium and large.
6220.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Estimated number of operational holdings that took institutional credit
Operational holdings that took institutional credit from primary agricultural credit society ( pacs )
Operational holdings that took institutional credit from primary land development bank/state land development bank ( pldb/ sldb )
Operational holdings that took institutional credit fromcommercial bank branch ( cbb )
Operational holdings that took institutional credit from regional rural bank branch ( rrbb )
Operational holdings that took institutional credit from primary agricultural credit society ( pacs ) by short term
Operational holdings that took institutional credit from primary agricultural credit society ( pacs ) by medium term
Operational holdings that took institutional credit from primary agricultural credit society ( pacs ) by long term

Institutional credit taken by primary land development bank/state land development bank ( pldb/ sldb ) long term
Institutional credit taken by commercial bank branch ( cbb ) short term
Institutional credit taken by commercial bank branch ( cbb ) medium term
Institutional credit taken by commercial bank branch ( cbb ) long term
Institutional credit taken by regional rural bank branch ( rrbb ) short term
Institutional credit taken by regional rural bank branch ( rrbb ) medium term
Institutional credit taken by regional rural bank branch ( rrbb ) long term

6221.name: Season-wise Progress under Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY)
6221.overview: The dataset gives information about Season-wise Progress under Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY) and Restructured Weather Based Crop Insurance Scheme (RWBCIS) for different seasons like kharif and rabi. It includes indicators like number of farmers covered, area insured, sum insured, farmers premium, GoI premium share, state government premium share, gross premium, claims reported, claims paid, number of farmers benefitted. Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY) aims at supporting sustainable production in agriculture sector by providing financial support to farmers suffering crop loss/damage arising out of unforeseen events, stabilizing the income of farmers to ensure their continuance in farming and encouraging farmers to adopt innovative and modern agricultural practices. Restructured weather-based crop insurance scheme is simplified form of insurance solution that allows insurance company to compensate the insured for possible loss it may suffer on account vagaries of weather.
6221.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6222.name: State-wise Percent Coverage of Irrigated Area under Principal Crops
6222.overview: This dataset presents State-wise Percent Coverage of Irrigated Area under Principal Crops during 2018-19 (Provisional). In this dataset principal crops includes gram, total pulses, soyabean, rapeseed & mustard, total foodgrains, bajra, tobacco, total oilseeds, coarse cereals, sunflower, wheat, tur or arhar, maize, jowar, groundnut, sugarcane, total cereals, barley, rice and cotton. The area is assumed to be irrigated for cultivation through sources such as canals, tanks, tube-wells, other wells and other sources.
6222.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6223.name: Number of Operational Holdings by Size Group
6223.overview: This dataset related to Number of Operational Holdings by Size Group. The operational holding determines the use of technology and in turn the production and farm income. The size of operating unit affects the income from agriculture which is the main source of income of people and the status of size group, number of operational holdings, area of operational holdings and average size of holdings.
6223.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6224.name: Rural Households, Agricultural Households and Indebted
6224.overview: This dataset refers to Estimated Number of Rural Households, Agricultural Households and Indebted Agricultural Households. The survey collected information on the receipts and households relating to farming, average income from wage/salary employment.
6224.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Estimated  number of agricultural households having loan
Average monthly income of rural households, agricultural households and indebted agricultural households

6225.name: Fertiliser Consumption per Hectare of Agricultural Land in Selected Countries
6225.overview: This data presents information about the Fertiliser Consumption per Hectare of Agricultural Land in Selected Countries. Fertilizer played crucial role in the country’s self-sufficiency in food production in the process of crop production, nutrients present in soil are depleted and the same can be replenished through the addition of fertilizers.
6225.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Fertilizers used for agricultural land like nitrogen ( n ), phosphorus pentoxide ( p205 ), potassium oxide ( k20 ).
Consumption of fertilizer in agricultural land
key_columns: Fertilizers used for agricultural land like nitrogen ( n ), phosphorus pentoxide ( p205 ), potassium oxide ( k20 ).

6226.name: Calculated data for CH4 emissions (in kilotonnes) from Rice Cultivation in Select Countries
6226.overview: This dataset refers to Calculated data for CH4 emissions in kilotons from Rice Cultivation and Burning-Crop Residues in Select Countries. Estimating a methane (CH4) inventory and developing mitigation options in select countries and was performed jointly from rice fields conducted. Methane emissions were measured by a closed chamber method, in rice plots at locations with the single rice cropping system.
6226.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Data for methane (ch4) emissions from rice cultivation
Data for methane (ch4) emissions from burning-crop residues

6227.name: Credit taken for Agricultural Purposes by different Size-Group
6227.overview: This data presents information about the total Institutional Credit taken for Agricultural Purposes by different Size-Group. Credit is one of the critical inputs for agricultural development. It capitalizes farmers to undertake new investments and or adopt new technologies. Realizing the importance of agricultural credit in fostering agricultural growth and development, the emphasis on the institutional framework for agricultural credit is being emphasized since the beginning of the planned development era in India.
6227.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Institutional credit taken under short term loans
Institutional credit taken under medium term loans
Institutional credit taken under long term loans
Value of quantity of fertilizers given under short term loans
Value of quantity of other inputs given under short term loans
Short term loans given as cash

6228.name: Agricultural Land by use in India (Yearly Data)
6228.overview: This dataset includes indicators like geographical area, gross irrigated area, net irrigated area, area sown more than once, area under non-agricultural uses, barren & un-culturable land, cropping intensity, culturable waste land, current fallows, fallow lands, fallow lands other than current fallows, forest, land under miscellaneous tree crops & groves not included in net area sown, net area sown, not available for cultivation, other uncultivated land excluding fallow land, permanent pasture & other grazing land and total cropped area.
6228.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Agricultural land area sown more than once
Fallow lands other than current fallows
Fallow lands other than current fallows (%)
Land under miscellaneous tree crops and groves not included in net area sown
Land under miscellaneous tree crops and groves not included in net area sown (%)
Land area not available for cultivation
Other uncultivated land excluding fallow land
Permanent pasture and other grazing land
Permanent pasture and other grazing land (%)
Reporting area for land utilisation statistics

6231.name: Mineral Production and Value of Mineral Production (Monthly)
6231.overview: This dataset gives information about Mineral Production and Value of Mineral Production monthly. This monthly dataset presents important statistics on mineral production in all the States and Union Territories of India. The estimated value of mineral production (excluding fuel minerals, atomic minerals and minor minerals) at Rs. 10172 crore in January 2021 increased by 12.8% as against Rs.9018 crore in the previous month. This dataset includes mineral production covering fuel, metallic and non-metallic minerals excluding atomic minerals and minor minerals.

6232.name: Information of Pregnant Ladies and Deliveries
6232.overview: The dataset gives information about district wise data on number of pregnant women tested for haemoglobin 4 or more times, number of pregnant women treated anaemia (Hb<7), number of pregnant women (PW) having severe anaemia (Hb<7), Total number of estimated deliveries, number of institutional deliveries, institutional delivery means giving birth to a child in a medical institution under the overall supervision of trained and competent health personnel. It also signifies an availability of amenities to handle the situation and save the life of the mother and child. Number of deliveries at home and number of home deliveries attended by Skilled Birth Attendants (SBA) or (Doctor/Nurse/ Auxiliary Nurse Midwifery (ANM)).
6232.source: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
columns: Pregnant women tested for Heamoglobin 4 or more times
Home deliveries attended by Skilled Birth Attendants (SBA) or (Doctor/Nurse/ANM)

6233.name: Information of Underweight Children and under 6 years
6233.overview: The dataset gives information about Percentage of underweight children under 6 years. This dataset collects information on indictors includes number of underweight children under-6 years (weight for age Z score <-2 SD), total number of children under-6 years enrolled in Anganwadi, percentage of underweight children under 6 years out of total children, number of stunted children under-6 years and percentage of stunted children under 6 years.
6233.source: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
columns: Under weight children under 6 years (weight for age Z score <-2 SD)
Children under 6 years of age enrolled in Anganwadi
Under weight children under 6 years out of total children NH13 (%)

6234.name: Severe Acute Malnourished (SAM) children under 6 years
6234.overview: The dataset gives the detail information about Percentage of Severe Acute Malnourished (SAM) children under 6 years. Severe Acute Malnutrition (SAM) is both a medical and social disorder. The medical problem is due to the social problems at home. Incorrect breast feeding practices, late introduction of complementary feeds, inappropriate foods and feeding practices, feeding diluted feeds containing less amount of nutrients, repeated cases of diarrhoea, acute respiratory infections, malaria and measles. SAM increases significantly the risk of death in children under five years of age. It can be direct cause of child death by increasing the case fatality rate in children suffering from common illnesses such as diarrhoea and pneumonia. Children who are severely wasted are 9 times more likely to die than well-nourished children.
6234.source: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
columns: Children under 5 Years of age with ARI enrolled for treatment in the last two weeks
Children under 5 Years of age with ARI
Children under 5 Years of age with Acute Respiratory Infections (ARI) NH17 (%)
Severe acute malnutrition ( SAM ) children under-6 years
Children under-6 years enrolled in Anganwadi centres

6235.name: Moderate Acute Malnourished (MAM) children under 6 years
6235.overview: The dataset tells about Percentage of Moderate Acute Malnourished ( MAM ) children under 6 years. Moderate acute malnutrition (MAM), also known as wasting, is defined by a weight-for-height indicator between -3 and -2 z-scores (standard deviations) of the international standard or by a mid-upper arm circumference (MUAC) between 11 cm and 12.5 cm.
6235.source: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
columns: Moderate Acute Malnourishment children under 6 years
Children under 6 years of age enrolled in Anganwadi centre
Moderate Acute Malnutrition (MAM) in children under 6 years NH19 (%)
Breast feeding children receiving adequate diet
Breast feeding children in 6-23 months old.
Breast feeding children receiving adequate diet (6-23 months) NH20 (%)

6236.name: Distribution of Chemical Fertiliser
6236.overview: The dataset is a combination of 3 datasets which is about percentage of chemical fertilizers distributed to District total, Kisan Credit Card ( KCC ) distributed and Soil Health Card ( SHC ) distributed. The KCC scheme is being implemented by the all Co-operative banks, Regional Rural Banks and Public Sector Banks throughout the country. Through the KCC scheme, farmers are exempted from the high interest rates of the loans offered by regular banks. Soil health card scheme includes cumulative target for soil samples collection and testing, number of samples collected, number of samples tested, cumulative target for printing and distribution of Soil Health Card Scheme ( SHCs ).
columns: Chemical fertilizers distributed to District total (%)

6237.name: Artificial insemination coverage of Livestock
6237.overview: The dataset tells about Taluk wise Percentage of Artificial Insemination coverage of Livestock. The indicators includes number of animals vaccinated, total Livestock, percentage of animals vaccinated NA17, artificial insemination coverage (cattle & buffaloes), total cattle & buffaloes and percentage of artificial insemination coverage (cattle & buffaloes) NA18. Artificial insemination is the technique in which semen with living sperms is collected from the male and introduced into female reproductive tract at proper time with the help of instruments. This has been found to result in a normal offspring. Artificial insemination is not merely a novel method of bringing about impregnation in females. Instead, it is a powerful tool mostly employed for livestock improvement.
6237.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Artificial Insemination Coverage of Cattle and Buffaloes
Artificial Insemination Coverage of Cattle and Buffaloes NA18 (%)

6238.name: Permanent Pasture Area to Total Geographical Area
6238.overview: The dataset is about the Percentage of Permanent Pasture Area to Total Geographical Area. Permanent pasture area means permanent meadows and pastures is the land used permanently (five years or more) to grow herbaceous forage crops, either cultivated or growing wild (wild prairie or grazing land). Geographical area means the latest figures of geographical area of the State/Union Territories are as provided by the Office of the Surveyor General of India.
6238.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Permanent Pasture to Geo graphical Area (%)

6239.name: Net Area Irrigated to Net Sown Area
6239.overview: The dataset is about Percentage of Net Area Irrigated to Net Sown Area. Net area irrigated is the area irrigated through any source once in a year for a particular crop. Net sown area represents the total area sown with crops and orchards. Area sown more than once in the same year is counted only once. In this dataset, indicators includes tube wells gross irrigated area and net area irrigated, lift irrigation gross irrigated area and net area irrigated, other sources gross irrigated area and net area irrigated.
6239.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Gross and Net Area Irrigated under Tube wells
Gross Irrigated Area under Tube wells
Net Area Irrigated under Tube wells
Gross and Net Area Irrigated under Lift Irrigations
Gross Irrigated Area under Lift Irrigation
Net Area Irrigated under Lift Irrigation
Gross Irrigated Area under Other sources
Net Area Irrigated under Other sources
Net Area Irrigated to Net Area Sown (%)

6240.name: Cold Storages available for Horticulture Crops
6240.overview: This is about Number of Cold Storages available for Horticulture Crops. There are 8186 number of cold storages with capacity of 374.25 Lakh MT is available in the country for storing perishable horticulture produce like fruits and vegetables. Government is implementing schemes like Mission for Integrated Development of Horticulture ( MIDH ) and Pradhan Mantri Kisan SAMPADA Yojana ( PMKSY ) under which financial assistance is provided for setting up of cold storages throughout the country to bridge the gap between availability and required cold storage capacity.
6240.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6241.name: Marginal Farmers to Total Farmers as per Agriculture Census
6241.overview: The dataset gives information regarding district wise Percentage of Marginal land owners to Total land holders as per Agriculture Census and It has the count of all the male and female land owners.
6241.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Marginal land holders to the total land holders (%)

6242.name: Road Statistics
6242.overview: The dataset gives information regarding the district wise total geographical area in kilometres, road length in kilometres and number of habitations have access to all weather roads and also percentage of habitation having access to all weather roads.
6242.source: Ministry of Road Transport and Highways
columns: Number of habitations access to all weather roads
Habitations having access to all weather roads (%)

6243.name: Sex Ratio at Birth
6243.overview: This dataset gives information regarding the sex ratio of rural and urban from census 2001 and 2011 and the percentage decadal change from 2001 to 2011. The sex ratio of the total population (females per 1000 males) is expected to increase (i.e. become more feminine) from 943 in 2011 to 952 during 2036

6244.name: Female literacy rate - 2011 Census
6244.overview: The dataset gives information regarding the male and female population on urban and rural areas and also the Female literacy rate. The literacy rate in 2001 was 64.84 percent, which improved to 72.98 percent in 2011. Interestingly, the literacy rate improved sharply among females by 10.96 percent points from 53.67 to 64.63 percent as compared to a rise of 5.62 percent points in case of males from 75.26 to 80.88 percent.

6245.name: Infrastructure Facilities in Primary Schools (Lower and Higher)
6245.overview: This dataset gives information regarding percentage of schools with functional drinking water facility. A basic drinking water service means that water from an improved source is available at the school. Improved drinking water sources are those that, by nature of their design and construction, have the potential to deliver safe water. Globally, in 2016, 69% of schools had an improved source of drinking water with water available and were therefore classified as providing a basic drinking water service. This also provides data about the schools having correct Compound, Library and computer facilities.

6246.name: Infrastructure Facilities in High Schools
6246.overview: A basic drinking water service means that water from an improved source is available at the school. Improved drinking water sources are those that, by nature of their design and construction, have the potential to deliver safe water. Globally, in 2016, 69% of schools had an improved source of drinking water with water available and were therefore classified as providing a basic drinking water service. This also provides data about the schools having correct Compound, Library and computer facilities.

6247.name: Schools with functional girls toilets
6247.overview: The dataset is regarding the percentage of schools with functional girl’s toilets. It also have the information about the total schools excluding boys school, number of schools complying with RTE specified pupil teacher ratio and count of schools providing text books within 1 month of start of academic year.
columns: Number of schools excluding boys schools
Elementary schools complying with RTE specified Pupil Teacher Ratio
Schools provided text books within 1 month of start of academic year

6248.name: Habitations with access to roads
6248.overview: This dataset gives information regarding percentage of habitations with access to roads and also percentage of habitation having access to all weather roads. It also has the total sanctioned Kilometres and Cumulative number of Kilometres of all weather road work completed under The Pradhan Mantri Gram Sadak Yojana (PMGSY).
6248.source: Ministry of Road Transport and Highways
columns: Habitations with access to all weather roads
Habitations with access all weather roads (%)
All weather road work completed under PMGSY
Total Kilometers of road Sanctioned under PMGSY
Kilometers of road completed as againist the sanctioned under PMGSY (%)

6249.name: Individual households with Toilets
6249.overview: This dataset gives information regarding the Percentage of individual households with toilets. In this scenario, Individual Household Toilets (IHHTs) are instrumental in addressing the overall health & wellbeing of the communities. Having a toilet at home can address privacy and safety concerns for women. For the elderly, people with disabilities, and transgender persons a household toilet can be a remedy. Even as awareness and incentive-based approach has been adopted to motivate citizens to construct toilets in their homes.

6250.name: Bank Accounts seeded with Aadhar
6250.overview: This dataset gives information regarding the count of bank accounts and accounts seeded with aadhar and Percentage of bank accounts seeded with Aadhar.It also has the information about the population with Pradhan Mantri Jan Dhan Yojana (PMJDY) accounts per lakh population. PMJDY is a National Mission on Financial Inclusion encompassing an integrated approach to bring about comprehensive financial inclusion of all the households in the country. The plan envisages universal access to banking facilities with at least one basic banking account for every household, financial literacy, access to credit, insurance and pension facility.
6250.source: Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology
columns: Pradhan Mantri Jan Dhan Yojana ( PMJDY ) accounts
Pradhan Mantri Jan Dhan Yojana ( PMJDY ) accounts per lakh population

6251.name: Disbursement of Mudra loan
6251.overview: Information on distribution of mudra loans to total population and enrolments under Pradhan Mantri Jeevan Jyoti Bima Yojana (PMJJBY).
columns: Mudra Loan distributed per lakh population
Enrollment under Pradhan Mantri Jeevan Jyoti Bima Yojana ( PMJJBY )
Enrollment per lakh population under Pradhan Mantri Jeevan Jyoti Bima Yojana ( PMJJBY )

6252.name: Details of Anganwadis
6252.overview: This dataset provides information on number of anganwadis or Urban Primary Health Centers (UBHC) and number of anganwadis with own buildings. Main objective of anganwadi is to lay the foundation for proper psychological, physical and social development of the child, to reduce the incidence of mortality, morbidity, malnutrition and school dropout, to achieve effective co-ordination of policy and implementation amongst the various departments to promote child development and to enhance the capability of the mother to look after the normal health and nutritional needs of the child through proper nutrition and health education.
columns: Anganwadis/UPHCs conducted at least 1 Village/Urban Health Sanitation & Nutrition day outreach in last 1 month
Anganwadis/UPHCs have conducted at least 1 Village Health Sanitation & Nutrition day (%)

6253.name: Number of Tractors and Livestock units

6254.name: Village Accountant Circles

columns: Grama Panchayat having Common Service Centres

6268.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6271.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6272.name: Area under Principal Crops -Cereals
6272.overview: Dataset containing information on area under cereals namely paddy, jowar, bajra, maize, ragi, wheat and other creals and minor millets
6272.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
