Area Under Total cereals and minor millets

6273.name: Area under Principal Crops-Pulses
6273.overview: Dataset containing information on area under pulses namely tur, horse gram, black gram, green gram, avare and cowpea.
6273.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6274.name: Area Under Principal Crops-Oil Seeds
6274.overview: Dataset containing information on area under oilseeds namely ground nut, sun flower, safflower, castor, sesamum, nigerseed, musturd, soyabean, linseed, oil palm, jatropha and other oil seeds.
6274.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Area under Oil Seeds to Total Area Sown (%)

6275.name: Area Under Principal Horticulture Crops- Fruits-1
6275.overview: Dataset containing information on area under fruits namely banana, mango, lemon, pineapple, guava and grapes.
6275.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6276.name: Area Under Principal Horticulture Crops-Fruits-2
6276.overview: Dataset containing information on area under fruits namely sapota, pomegranate, papaya, orange, watermelon and other fruits.
6276.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6277.name: Area Under Principal Horticulture Crops -Vegetables-1
6277.overview: Dataset containing information on area under vegetables namely tomato, brinjal, cucumber, beans, cluster beans, cabbage, ridge guard and bitter guard.
6277.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6278.name: Area Under Principal Horticulture Crops -Vegetables -2
6278.overview: This dataset has information on area under vegetables namely raddish, onion, beetroot, carrot, knol khol, ladies finger, green chillies and snake guard. India has witnessed increase in horticulture production over the last few years. Significant progress has been made in area expansion resulting in higher production.
6278.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6279.name: Area Under Principal Horticulture Crops-Vegetables-3
6279.overview: This dataset contains information on area under vegetables namely bottle guard, potato, pumpkin, cauliflower, leafy vegetables and other vegetables. India has witnessed increase in horticulture production over the last few years. Significant progress has been made in area expansion resulting in higher production.
6279.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6280.name: Area under Commercial Crops
6280.overview: Dataset has information on area under commercial crops namely cotton, sugar cane, tobacco, total fibers, condiments and spices, coconuts, areca nuts and plantation crops in hectares.
6280.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6281.name: Production of Important Crops-Cereals
6281.overview: The dataset is about Production of Important Crops like rice, jowar, bajra, maize, ragi, wheat etc. After rice and wheat, maize is the most important cereal crop in India. It accounts for approximately one-tenth of the total agricultural produce in India. Cultivation of maize is focused in the regions of Andhra Pradesh and Karnataka. The huge demand for cereals in the global market is creating an excellent environment for the export of Indian cereal products. India is the largest producer as well as the largest exporter of cereal products in the world.
6281.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Production of Total Small Minor Millets
Production of Total Cereals & Minor Millets

6282.name: Production of Important Crops-Pulses
6282.overview: This dataset is about Production of Important Crops like tur, horse gram, black gram, green gram, avare, cowpea, bengal gram, other pulses, total food grains. The most important states of pulses production are Madhya Pradesh, Rajasthan, Maharashtra, Uttar Pradesh and Andhra Pradesh, which together accounts for 82 % of the production from 74% area. Importance of pulse crops in India is pulses are rich in proteins and found to be main source of protein to vegetarian people of India and It is second important constituent of Indian diet after cereals.
6282.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Food grains production to District total (%)

6283.name: Production of Important Oil Seeds
6283.overview: This dataset is about Production of Important Oil Seeds like ground nut, sun flower, safflower, castor, sesamum, linseed, soya bean and nigerseed + mustard. Oilseeds are among the major crops that are grown in the country apart from cereals. In terms of acreage, production, and economic value, these oilseed crops are second only to food grains. With its rich agro-ecological diversity, India is ideally appropriate for growing all the major annual oilseed crops.
6283.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Production of Including other Total Oil Seeds

6284.name: Production of Commercial Crops
6284.overview: This dataset is about Production of commercial crops like cotton, sugarcane and tobacco. In different regions of India, farmers grow various varieties of crops dependent on regions, monsoon, water availability, climate, topography. In commercial farming, varieties of cash crops are cultivated by the farmers. These crops are sugarcane, tobacco, jute and cotton
6284.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6285.name: Production of Plantation crops
6285.overview: This dataset is about production of plantation crops like coconut, areca-nut, cardamom, pepper, cashew-nut and cocoa. Plantation crops are high-value commercial crops which play a vital role in the agricultural economy and export trade of many developing and developed countries. Plantation crops are very important for national and agriculture.
6285.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6286.name: Production of Important Horticulture Crops -Fruits
6286.overview: The dataset is about Production of important horticulture crops under fruits like banana, mango, lemon, pine apple, gauva, grapes, sapota, pomegranate and papaya. Horticultural crops include fruits, vegetables, medicinal, aromatic, and ornamental plants. These crops are important dietary nutritional components and sources of medicines and aroma along with significant esthetic values for human beings.
6286.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6287.name: Production of Important Horticulture Crops -Vegetables
6287.overview: This dataset is about Production of Important Horticulture Crops under Vegetables like potato, tomato, brinjal, beans, cluster beans, onion, green chillies, total leafy vegetables and total gaurd variety vegetables. Horticultural crops include fruits, vegetables, medicinal, aromatic, and ornamental plants. These crops are important dietary nutritional components and sources of medicines and aroma along with significant esthetic values for human beings.
6287.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6288.name: Yield of Important Crops -Cereals
6288.overview: The dataset is about yield of important crops under cereals like paddy, jowar, bajra, maize, ragi, wheat, total small millets, total cereals & millets. After rice and wheat, maize is the most important cereal crop in India. It accounts for approximately one-tenth of the total agricultural produce in India. The huge demand for cereals in the global market is creating an excellent environment for the export of Indian cereal products. India is the largest producer as well as the largest exporter of cereal products in the world.
6288.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6289.name: Yield of Important Crops -Pulses
6289.overview: This dataset is about Yield of important crops under Pulses like tur, horse gram , black gram, green gram, avare, cowpea, bengal gram, other pulses, total pulses and total food grains. At the end of fiscal year 2021, the yield of pulses produced in India was over 892 kilograms per hectare. Importance of pulse crops in India is pulses are rich in proteins and found to be main source of protein to vegetarian people of India and It is second important constituent of Indian diet after cereals.
6289.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6290.name: Yield of Important Oil Seeds
6290.overview: This dataset is about Yield of important oil seeds like groundnut, sunflower, castor, linseed, soya bean, sesame, Niger seed + mustard. Oilseeds are among the major crops that are grown in the country apart from cereals. In terms of production, and economic value, these oilseed crops are second only to food grains. With its rich agro-ecological diversity, India is ideally appropriate for growing all the major annual oilseed crops.
6290.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6291.name: Yield of Commercial Crops
6291.overview: This dataset is regarding the yield of commercial crops like cotton in kilograms per hectare, sugarcane in tonnes per hectare. These crops account for a significant share in the Gross Value Added by agriculture and allied sector. The estimates of crop production are obtained by multiplication of area estimates by corresponding yield estimates. The estimates of area and yield rates assume prime importance in the entire gamut of agricultural statistics.
6291.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6292.name: Productivity of Major Crop in Kharif Rabi
6292.overview: This dataset is regarding productivity of major crops in kharif and rabi seasons. Agriculture mechanization is an essential input to modern agriculture to increase productivity and for making judicious use of other inputs like seeds, fertilizers, chemicals & pesticides and natural resources like water, soil nutrients etc.
6292.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6293.name: Yield of Plantation Crops and Forest Area
6293.overview: This dataset is regarding yield of plantation crops like processed areca-nut, Cardamom, Pepper, processed cashew and cocoa and forest area under forest department in sqkms and saplings planted in lakhs. Yield rate is defined as production per unit of area. The yield estimates of major crops are obtained through analysis of Crop Cutting Experiments (CCE) conducted under scientifically designed General Crop Estimation Surveys (GCES).
6293.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6294.name: Distribution of Cereals and Pulses seeds
6294.overview: This dataset is regarding the distributed seeds like paddy, wheat, jowar, ragi, maize, bajra, bengal gram, safflower, tur and black gram. Distribution is the process of moving packaged seed from the stores to the farmers. Seed distribution can be carried out by government, public sector agencies, cooperatives and the private sector or, as is often the case, by a combination of all of these.
6294.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6295.name: Distribution of oil seeds
6295.overview: This dataset is regarding the distributed seeds like Green Gram, Cowpea, Ground Nut, Sun flower and Soya bean in total quality and percentage of seeds distributed to districts. Distribution is the process of moving packaged seed from the stores to the farmers. Seed distribution can be carried out by government, public sector agencies, cooperatives and the private sector or, as is often the case, by a combination of all of these.
6295.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6296.name: Markets and sub-markets
6296.overview: This dataset is regarding the regulated and sub markets. It also have the data about number of mandis linked to electronic market. The agricultural marketing sector requires strengthening of supply chain through investments in infrastructure for value addition to agricultural produce, reduction in post- harvest losses, etc.
6296.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Number of Mandis linked to Electronic Market

6297.name: Farm Harvest Price  Minimum Support Price- Wheat
6297.overview: This dataset is regarding the difference between farm Harvest Price and Minimum Support Price of Wheat in quintal per rupees and percentage change in quintal per rupees. Farm Harvest prices of a commodity is defined as the average wholesale price, at which the commodity is disposed of by the producer to the trader at the village site during the specified marketing period after the commencement of harvest. MSP is price fixed by Government of India to protect the producer - farmers - against excessive fall in price during bumper production years. The minimum support prices are a guarantee price for their produce from the Government.
6297.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Difference of Farm Harvest Price & Minimum Support Price-Wheat

Farm Harvest prices of a commodity is defined as the average wholesale price, at which the commodity is disposed of by the producer to the trader at the village site during the specified marketing period after the commencement of harvest. MSP is price fixed by Government of India to protect the producer - farmers - against excessive fall in price during bumper production years. The minimum support prices are a guarantee price for their produce from the Government.
6298.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Difference of Farm Harvest Price & Minimum Support Price-Paddy (Common)

MSP is price fixed by Government of India to protect the producer - farmers - against excessive fall in price during bumper production years. 6303.name: Livestock Census-Cattle, Buffaloes and Sheep
6303.overview: This dataset is regarding the livestock census of Cattles with Indigenous, Exotic and Cross breed, buffaloes and sheep’s with Indigenous, Exotic and Cross breed. Livestock sector is emerging as one of the potential and income-generating source to the rural community and providing full time employment in rural as well as semi-urban areas. Livestock wealth is the backbone of the rural economy. It covers all domesticated animals and its headcounts for total 16 species of animals like Cattle, Buffalo, Mithun, Yak, Sheep, Goat, Pig, Horse, Pony, Mule, Donkey Camel, Dog, Rabbit and Elephant and poultry birds (Fowl, Duck, Turkeys and other poultry birds) possessed by the households, household enterprises/non- household enterprises and institutions at their site.
6303.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6304.name: Livestock Census-Goat, Pigs
6304.overview: This dataset is regarding the livestock census of goats and pigs with Indigenous, Exotic and Cross breed. Livestock sector is emerging as one of the potential and income-generating source to the rural community and providing full time employment in rural as well as semi-urban areas. Livestock wealth is the backbone of the rural economy. It covers all domesticated animals and its headcounts for total 16 species of animals like Cattle, Buffalo, Mithun, Yak, Sheep, Goat, Pig, Horse, Pony, Mule, Donkey Camel, Dog, Rabbit and Elephant and poultry birds (Fowl, Duck, Turkeys and other poultry birds) possessed by the households, household enterprises/non- household enterprises and institutions at their site.
6304.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6305.name: Livestock Census-Dogs, Livestock and Poultry
6305.overview: This dataset is regarding the livestock census of rabbit, dogs and other poultry. It also have percentage of total livestock to each district total. Livestock sector is emerging as one of the potential and income-generating source to the rural community and providing full time employment in rural as well as semi-urban areas. Livestock wealth is the backbone of the rural economy. It covers all domesticated animals and its headcounts for total 16 species of animals like Cattle, Buffalo, Mithun, Yak, Sheep, Goat, Pig, Horse, Pony, Mule, Donkey Camel, Dog, Rabbit and Elephant and poultry birds (Fowl, Duck, Turkeys and other poultry birds) possessed by the households, household enterprises/non- household enterprises and institutions at their site.
6305.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6306.name: Veterinary Institutions
6306.overview: This dataset is regarding the Veterinary Hospitals, Dispensaries, Primary Veterinary Centres, Mobile Dispensaries, Artificial Insemination Centres. Livestock Health and Disease Control is being implemented with the aim to reduce risk to animal health by prophylactic vaccination against diseases of livestock and poultry, capacity building of Veterinary services, disease surveillance and strengthening veterinary infrastructure. Under the scheme, during the next five years, Mobile veterinary clinics will be established in the country to deliver animal health services at doorstep which will prevent annual loss to the farmers.

6307.name: Fisheries-Ice plants , Cold storage and Fishing tanks
6307.overview: This dataset is regarding fisheries, it has the fish catch in tonnes, count of Ice plant and their capacity, count of cold storage and their capacity and number of fishing tanks under panchayth raj and minor irrigation department. Fisheries sector occupies a very important place in the socio-economic development of the country. It has been recognized as a powerful income and employment generator as it stimulates growth of a number of subsidiary industries, and is a source of cheap and nutritious food besides being a foreign exchange earner.
6307.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Number of Fishing Tanks Tanks of Panchayth Raj
Number of Fishing Tanks Tanks of Minor Irrigation Department

6308.name: Families Involved in Fishiries
6308.overview: This dataset is regarding count of families involved in fisheries as a part time or full time and count of beneficiaries under Matsyashraya Yojane. Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY) is designed to address critical gaps in the fisheries value chain from fish production, productivity and quality to technology, post-harvest infrastructure and marketing. It aims to modernize and strengthen the value chain, enhance traceability and establish a robust fisheries management framework while simultaneously ensuring the socio-economic welfare of fishers and fish farmers.
6308.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6351.overview: The dataset is about Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndrome (AIDS) Leprosy and Tuberculosis (TB) Control Programmes. It includes indicators like male AIDS patients identified, female AIDS patients identified, Transsexual (TS) or Transgender (TG) AIDS patients identified, total AIDS patients identified, male AIDS patients identified and death occurred during 2020-21, female AIDS patients identified and death occurred during 2020-21, Transsexual (TS) or Transgender (TG) AIDS patients identified and death occurred during 2020-21, total AIDS patients identified and death occurred during 2020-21.

6352.name: Details of Male and Female Leprosy patients
6352.overview: This dataset which provides information about Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndrome ( AIDS ) Leprosy and Tuberculosis ( TB ) Control Programmes.  It includes indicators like male leprosy patients identified and cured during 2020-21, female leprosy patients identified and cured during 2020-21, total leprosy patients identified and cured during 2020-21, cured male leprosy patients during 2020-21, cured female leprosy patients during 2020-21, total cured leprosy patients during 2020-21.
6352.source: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare

6353.name: Details of Tuberculosis (TB) cases
6353.overview: This dataset gives information about Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndrome (AIDS) Leprosy and Tuberculosis (TB) Control Programmes. It includes indicators like number of estimated tuberculosis (TB) cases in Government institutions, number of estimated tuberculosis (TB) cases in private institutions, number of estimated tuberculosis (TB) cases in both government and private institutions, number of notified tuberculosis (TB) cases in government institutions, number of notified tuberculosis (TB) cases in private institutions, number of notified tuberculosis (TB) cases in both government and private institutions, number of tuberculosis (TB) cases healed in public and private institutions, deaths of tuberculosis (TB)patients.
6353.source: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare

It is for students from minority communities such as; Muslim, Christian, Sikh, Buddhist and Parsi. This fully-funded scholarship initiated by the Government of India is for students with an annual family income of rupee one lakh or below.
6372.source: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare

6373.name: Statewise Reproductive Child Health (RCH) Report Indicator Related to Maternal Health Antenatal Care (ANC)
6373.overview: Reproductive and Child Health (RCH) seeks to create an environment where women have the ability to reproduce and regulate their fertility. The main aim of RCH is to reduce infant and maternal mortality rate. This dataset contains information on the count of women registered for antenatal care and women registered with 3 check-ups.
6373.source: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
columns: Ante natal care-anc registered with 3 check-ups

6374.name: Members of Stree Shakti Self Help Groups
6374.overview: Dataset Stree Shakti Self Help Groups and Members includes indicators like number of Stree Shakti Self Help Groups, percentage to District total, number of Scheduled Castes (SC) women, Scheduled Tribes (ST) women and other women members in self-help groups. Stree Shakthi Groups (SSGs) are formed at the village level to inculcate the savings habit in the members empowering the women economically. About 15 to 20 women members who are from below poverty line families, landless agricultural labourers.
6374.source: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare

6377.overview: Dataset providing information about Anganwadi Centres and Creche which consists of indicators like having own building, school building or some other buildings and the percentage of Anganwadi centres having own buildings, the number of creches, and creches students. A Creche is a facility which enables parents to leave their children while they are at work and where children are provided stimulating environment for their holistic development.

6378.overview: The dataset is about Anganwadi Teachers Workers and Supplementary Nutrition Programme with indicators like District wise number of beneficiaries under supplementary nutrition programme of age 0 to 3 years and 3 to 6 years, pregnant women, lactating women, adolescent girls and total count of beneficiaries under this programme, number of Anganwadi worker and helpers involved in programme. Supplementary Nutrition provided to the Anganwadi Services beneficiaries at Anganwadi Centres varies from place to place depending upon the locally available foods and food preference or habits of the local population.

6383.name: Swachh Bharath Mission-Rural
6383.overview: The main objective of the Swachh Bharat Mission Garmin Karnataka Program is to achieve total sanitation in a proper manner. Every household, school and Anganwadi should have a toilet and it should be accessible. Everyone must use toilets instead of open defecation. It should be maintained well. Roads and lanes must be clean. Solid-liquid waste management is also one of the main objectives of this mission. Overall, SBMG Karnataka is working towards implementing activities to bring in total sanitation in all villages.
6383.source: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare

6795.name: Land Use Statistics : Classification of Area
6795.overview:
Land use statistics contain data on all India and Statewise land use classification, gross and net irrigated area, the irrigated area under crops, and area under crops with the purpose of showing existing land distribution according to actual use.

This dataset provides information on the classification of the land in terms of cultivated area, uncultivated area, area sown, cropped area, forest area etc.
6795.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Permanent pasture and other grazing land area
Land under miscellaneous tree crops and groves not included in net area sown
Fallow lands other than current fallow lands
Land area sown more than once

6796.name: Land Use Statistics : Source Irrigated Area
6796.overview:
Land use statistics contain data on all India and State wise land use classification, gross and net irrigated area, the irrigated area under crops, and area under crops with the purpose of showing existing land distribution according to actual use.

This dataset provides information on different sources and sub-sources of irrigation.
6796.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Net or gross irrigation land area
key_columns: Net or gross irrigation land area

6797.name: Land Use Statistics: Crop Irrigated Area
6797.overview:
Land use statistics contain data on all India and State wise land use classification, gross and net irrigated area, the irrigated area under crops and area under crops with the purpose of showing existing land distribution according to actual use.

This dataset provides information on irrigated area under different types of crops like cereals, millets, pulses, fibres, oilseeds, fruits and vegetables etc.
6797.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
columns: Irrigated land area of a crop

6798.name: Land Use Statistics: Area Under Crops
6798.overview:
Land use statistics contain data on all India and State wise land use classification, gross and net irrigated area, the irrigated area under crops and area under crops with the purpose of showing existing land distribution according to actual use.

This dataset provides information on the area under various types of food and non-food crops which are been planned in various crop seasons.
6798.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6802.name: Marine Fisheries Census
6802.overview: Marine fisheries census data containing information about fisheries resources, length of coastal region, fishing villages, fisher folk population, fisherman families who are below poverty line etc. of the coastal states and union territories of India. Information on marine fisheries will be useful to examine the impact of developmental programmes implemented on a basic sampling frame for estimation of marine fish landings in country.
6802.source: Ministry of Fisheries  Animal Husbandry and Dairying
columns: Fishermen families which have BPL status

6810.name: Financial Assistance Provided by National Fisheries Development Board (NFDB)
6810.overview: Data on financial assistance provided by National Fisheries Development Board for implementation of various projects under Blue Revolution Scheme. Data is published in "Annual Report" by Department of Animal Husbandry, Dairying & Fisheries and Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare.
6810.source: Ministry of Fisheries  Animal Husbandry and Dairying
columns: Proposals recommended by national fisheries development board for implementation of various projects
Amount recommended by national fisheries development board for implementation of various projects
Amount released by national fisheries development board for implementation of various projects

6820.name: Land Use Statistics : Crop Production Statistics
6820.overview:
Land use statistics contain data on all India and State wise land use classification, gross and net irrigated area, the irrigated area under crops and area under crops with the purpose of showing existing land distribution according to actual use.

This dataset provides information on statistics for different type of crops and seasons.
6820.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

6991.name: Monthly Coal Statements
6991.overview: This dataset provides information on coal stock position of thermal power stations. The monthly details include plant capacity, monthly allocation of coal, opening stock, monthly consumption, closing stock of coal for power stations.

6992.name: Monthly Power Generation
6992.overview: This dataset contains information on station-wise data on monthly power generation including the location, sector, category, fuel, utility, installed capacity, programmed generation and actual generation during the month for different power stations.
columns: Generation Programme is prepared by CEA

7040.name: Reserve Bank of India (RBI): Statewise deployment of ATMs
7040.overview: State-wise deployment of ATMs dataset provides state-wise quarterly data on deployment of ATMs by various banks like Private sector banks, Public sector banks, Foreign banks in India, etc. While ATM enables a variety of transactions for customers, their major utility has been for withdrawal of cash and balance enquiry. Rapid deployment of ATMs supported by well-established infrastructure and expert recommendations from Financial Software and Systems (FSS) bring in intelligent approach to ensure high revenues, optimum uptime, business continuity, high scalability and increased efficiency at reduced costs.

7042.overview: This dataset contains counts of the number of crimes, cases, and value of property filed under different broad headings on the Indian Penal Code (IPC).  Crime headings include cognizable crimes, murder cases, offence against state, special and local laws, etc. Data is available at the state/UT level from 2016 to 2018.

7044.name: Comprehensive National Nutrition Survey (CNNS) 2016-18 : Key Anthropometric Indicators by Sex
7044.overview: Statewise key anthropometric indicators classified by sex (male or female) from the CNNS 2016-18. The CNNS is the first ever national nutrition survey covering school-age children, and adolescents in rural and urban areas across 30 states of India. The CNNS provides national and state level representative data for nutritional status and micronutrient deficiencies among children and adolescents from birth to 19 years and estimates of biomarkers for non-communicable diseases (NCDs) among those aged 5-19 years. Several anthropometric measurements were collected from survey participants including measurements of height, weight, Mid-Upper Arm Circumference (MUAC) and Triceps Skinfold Thickness (from participants aged 0-19 years), Subscapular Skinfold Thickness (from participants aged 1-19 years) and waist circumference and handgrip strength (from participants aged 5-19 years). The survey was carried out from 24 February 2016 to 26 October 2018.
7044.source: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare

7045.name: Comprehensive National Nutrition Survey (CNNS) 2016-18: Key Anthropometric Indicators by Residence
7045.overview: Statewise key anthropometric indicators classified by residence (urban or rural) from the CNNS 2016-18. The CNNS is the first ever national nutrition survey covering school-age children, and adolescents in rural and urban areas across 30 states of India. The CNNS provides national and state level representative data for nutritional status and micronutrient deficiencies among children and adolescents from birth to 19 years and estimates of biomarkers for non-communicable diseases (NCDs) among those aged 5-19 years. Several anthropometric measurements were collected from survey participants including measurements of height, weight, Mid-Upper Arm Circumference (MUAC) and Triceps Skinfold Thickness (from participants aged 0-19 years), Subscapular Skinfold Thickness (from participants aged 1-19 years) and waist circumference and handgrip strength (from participants aged 5-19 years). The survey was carried out from 24 February 2016 to 26 October 2018.
7045.source: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare

7046.name: Comprehensive National Nutrition Survey (CNNS) 2016-18 : Key Indicators of Micronutrient Deficiencies and Non-Communicable Disease Risks
7046.overview: Statewise key indicators of micronutrient deficiencies and non-communicable disease risks from the CNNS 2016-18. The Comprehensive National Nutrition Survey (CNNS) is the first ever national nutrition survey covering 112,316 pre-schoolers, school-age children, and adolescents in rural and urban areas across 30 states of India. The CNNS provides national and state level representative data for nutritional status and micronutrient deficiencies among children and adolescents from birth to 19 years and estimates of biomarkers for non-communicable diseases (NCDs) among those aged 5-19 years. In order to estimate prevalence of micronutrient deficiencies, and NCDs among survey participants, biological samples were collected from about half of the survey participants aged 1-19 years. The survey was carried out from 24 February 2016 to 26 October 2018.
7046.source: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare

7047.name: Handbook of Statistics on Indian States : Banking
7047.overview: This dataset provides information on credit, deposits and number of offices of scheduled commercial banks and regional rural banks. The dataset is published in the 'Banking' section of the annual 'Handbook of Statistics on Indian States' publication by the Reserve Bank of India. Data are at the state level and cover from 2011 to 2021.

7048.name: Handbook of Statistics on Indian States: Fiscal Indicators
7048.overview: This dataset provides information on fiscal indicators including revenue, expenditure, deficits etc. of states. The dataset is published in the 'Fiscal' section of the annual 'Handbook of Statistics on Indian States' publication by the Reserve Bank of India. Data are at the state level and cover from 2011 to 2021. (Notes: 1. Minus sign (-) indicates surplus in deficit indicator. 2. Figures in respect of Jammu and Kashmir relate to revised estimates from 2004-05 to 2009-10. 3. Figures in respect of Manipur relate to revised estimates from 2004-05 to 2008-09. 4. Figures in respect of Jharkhand relate to revised estimates from 2004-05 to 2010-11. (Source: Handbook of Statistics on State Government Finances-2010 and State Finances: A Study of Budgets, Reserve Bank of India, various issues.)

7049.name: Handbook of Statistics on Indian States: Composition of Outstanding Liabilities
7049.overview: This dataset provides information on composition of outstanding liabilities (loans of state governments from internal and external sources). The dataset is published in the 'Fiscal' section of the annual 'Handbook of Statistics on Indian States' publication by the Reserve Bank of India. Data are at the state level and cover from 2011 to 2021. (Note: Minus balance is mainly due to accounting for payments without corresponding credits which are under investigation or reconciliation by CAG.) (Sources: 1. State Finances: A Study of Budgets, Reserve Bank of India, various issues; 2. Combined Finance and Revenue Accounts of the Union and State Governments in India, CAG; 3. Ministry of Finance, Government of India; 4. Reserve Bank Records; 5. Budget Documents of the State Governments; 6. Controller General of Accounts (CGA)).

7050.name: Handbook of Statistics on Indian States: State Domestic Product (Base: 2004-05)

Data includes gross, net and per-capita state domestic product as well as gross or net state value added by economic activities like agriculture, industry, manufacturing, services, construction, and banking or insurance. The dataset is published in the 'State Domestic Product' section of the annual 'Handbook of Statistics on Indian States' publication by the Reserve Bank of India. Data are at the state level and cover from 2011 to 2015.

7055.name: National Achievement Survey (NAS) 2017: Survey of Learning Outcomes - District report for Class 3
7055.overview:
Districtwise reports of performance on learning outcomes for subjects EVS, Language and Mathematics for Class 3, recorded during the National Achievement Survey (NAS) 2017.
 
The National Council of Educational Research and Training (NCERT) conducted National Achievement Survey (NAS) throughout the country on November 13, 2017 for Classes 3, 5 and 8 in government and government aided schools. This dataset reports findings for Class 3. Multiple test booklets were used in Classes III, V and VIII in Mathematics, Language, Environmental Sciences, Sciences and Social Sciences. The learning outcomes reflect the competency-based test questions.

These were recently incorporated in the Central Rules for RTE Act by the Government of India. This is the largest assessment survey conducted in the country and is amongst the largest conducted in the world. The attainment of the competency-based learning outcomes of 2.2 million students from 1,10,000 schools across 701 districts in all 36 States or UTs were assessed.

7056.name: National Achievement Survey (NAS) 2017: Survey of Learning Outcomes - District report for Class 5
7056.overview:
Districtwise reports of performance on learning outcomes for subjects EVS, Language and Mathematics for Class 5, recorded during the National Achievement Survey (NAS) 2017.
 
The National Council of Educational Research and Training (NCERT) conducted National Achievement Survey (NAS) throughout the country on November 13, 2017 for Classes 3, 5 and 8 in government and government aided schools. This dataset reports findings for Class 5. Multiple test booklets were used in Classes III, V and VIII in Mathematics, Language, Environmental Sciences, Sciences and Social Sciences.  The learning outcomes reflect the competency-based test questions.

These were recently incorporated in the Central Rules for RTE Act by the Government of India. This is the largest assessment survey conducted in the country and is amongst the largest conducted in the world. The attainment of the competency-based learning outcomes of 2.2 million students from 1,10,000 schools across 701 districts in all 36 States or UTs were assessed.

7060.name: Crime in India: Indian Penal Code (IPC) Crimes Statistics
7060.overview: This dataset contains number of crimes filed under each category of the Indian Penal Code (IPC), number of victims of those crimes, and average crime rate. The data is presented separately by IPC category and sub-category. Data are available at the state/UT level for 2018.

7062.name: Water Resources Information System (WRIS): Monthwise- Reservoir Level and Storage Data
7062.overview:
The India-WRIS is a 'Single Window Solution' for all water resources data (rainfall, snowfall, geo-morphological, climatic, geological, surface water, ground water, water quality, ecological, water extraction and use, irrigated area, glaciers, etc.) and information in a standardized national Geographical Information System (GIS) framework.

This dataset provides information on storage and capacity of reservoirs across districts in India.

7063.name: Water Resources Information System (WRIS): Ground Water Level Monthly
7063.overview:
India-WRIS is a 'Single Window Solution' for all water resources data (rainfall, snowfall, geo-morphological, climatic, geological, surface water, ground water, water quality, ecological, water extraction and use, irrigated area, glaciers, etc.) and information in a standardized national Geographical Information System (GIS) framework.

This dataset provides district-wise information on level of Ground water in meters.

7064.name: Water Resources Information System (WRIS): Surface Water Quality Monthly
7064.overview:
India-WRIS is a 'Single Window Solution' for all water resources data (rainfall, snowfall, geo-morphological, climatic, geological, surface water, ground water, water quality, ecological, water extraction and use, irrigated area, glaciers, etc.) and information in a standardized national Geographical Information System (GIS) framework.

This dataset has water quality parameters including chemical, physical, and biological properties and can be tested or monitored based on the desired water parameters of concern. Parameters that are frequently sampled or monitored for water quality include temperature, dissolved oxygen, pH, conductivity, ORP(Oxidation Reduction Potential), and turbidity

7065.name: Water Resources Information System (WRIS): Ground Water Quality Yearly
7065.overview:
India-WRIS is a 'Single Window Solution' for all water resources data (rainfall, snowfall, geo-morphological, climatic, geological, surface water, ground water, water quality, ecological, water extraction and use, irrigated area, glaciers, etc.) and information in a standardized national Geographical Information System (GIS) framework.

This dataset describes the district-wise condition of groundwater relative to substances that are dissolved or suspended in the water.

7066.name: Water Resources Information System (WRIS): Rainfall Data Monthly
7066.overview:
India-WRIS is a 'Single Window Solution' for all water resources data (rainfall, snowfall, geo-morphological, climatic, geological, surface water, ground water, water quality, ecological, water extraction and use, irrigated area, glaciers, etc.) and information in a standardized national Geographical Information System (GIS) framework.

This dataset provides district-wise information on actual, normal and deviation in rainfall data. .

7067.name: Health Management Information System (HMIS): Performance of Key Health Management Information System (HMIS) Indicators across District (2007-08 to 2016-17)
7067.overview: Data on performance of key HMIS Indicators across districts (from 2007-08 to 2016-17). Health Management Information System (HMIS) is a Government to Government (G2G) web-based Monitoring Information System that has been put in place by Ministry of Health and Family Welfare (MoHFW), Government of India to monitor the National Health Mission and other Health programmes and provide key inputs for policy formulation and appropriate programme interventions. Dataset contains information related to health indicators for maternal health  like Antenatal Care Services (ANC), Pregnancies, Deliveries, Post - Natal Care etc.; Child Immunization, Patient Services, Laboratory Testing, Deaths, Inventory/stocks of certain medicines and equipment etc.

7069.name: Apprenticeship Program
7069.overview: Apprenticeship training program is one of the most efficient ways to develop skilled manpower for industry by using training facilities available in the establishments without putting any extra burden on exchequer to set up training infrastructure. Persons after undergoing apprenticeship training can easily adapt to industrial environment at the time of regular employment.
7069.source: Ministry of Skill Development and Entrepreneurship
columns: Training centers established for the program

7071.name: Pradhan Mantri Kisan Sampada Yojana (PMKSY) - Cold Chain Progress report
7071.overview: Pradhan Mantri Kisan SAMPADA (Scheme for Agro-Marine Processing and Development of Agro-Processing Clusters) Yojana (PMKSY) is a comprehensive package which will result in creation of modern infrastructure with efficient supply chain management from farm gate to retail outlet. It will not only provide a big boost to the growth of food processing sector in the country but also help in providing better returns to farmers and is a big step towards doubling of farmers income, creating huge employment opportunities especially in the rural areas, reducing wastage of agricultural produce, increasing the processing level and enhancing the export of the processed foods.

7072.name: Digital transactions, BHIM transactions, debit card
7072.overview: The Digital India programme is a flagship programme of the Government of India with a vision to transform India into a digitally empowered society and knowledge economy. Digital India promotes cashless transactions and to convert India into less-cash society.
7072.source: Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology

7073.name: Digital Literacy
7073.overview: Digital literacy is an effort to complement government's vision to make each household digitally literate. Beneficiaries under this scheme are households where none of the family members is digitally literate. This dataset lists the number of beneficiaries registered, trained, and certified under this scheme.
7073.source: Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology

7076.name: Crime: Statewise Jail Types
7076.overview: The state-wise jail types dataset provides information on the number of jails by jail type. Types include central jails, district jails, sub jails, women jails, borstal schools, open jails, and special jails. Data is at the state level and covers from 2011 to 2019.

7077.name: Scholarships Scheme for Minorities
7077.overview: The scholarship at the pre-matric level will encourage parents from minority communities to send their school going children to school, lighten their financial burden on school education and sustain their efforts to support their children to complete school education. A level playing field in the competitive employment arena.

7078.name: Water Quality of Rivers
7078.overview:
The Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) in collaboration with State Pollution Control Boards (SPCB) in the States and Pollution Control Committees (PCC) in Union Territories has established a National Water Monitoring Programme (NWMP) in order to assess status of water quality and to facilitate for prevention and control of pollution in water bodies (especially rivers, lakes, ponds, tanks, ground water, sea or marine water).

This dataset describes the water quality of rivers using various characteristics such as pH Value, Dissolved Oxygen, Temperature, Conductivity, Bio-Chemical Oxygen Demand, Nitrate-N + Nitrite-N (mg/l), Faecal Coli form and Total Coli form.
7078.source: Ministry of Environment  Forest and Climate Change
columns: Minimum value of dissolved oxygen in water
Maximum value of dissolved oxygen in water
Minimum potential of Hydrogen value in water
Maximum potential of Hydrogen value in water
Minimum amount of Nitrate N + Nitrite N
Maximum amount of Nitrate N + Nitrite N

7079.name: Water Quality in Lakes, Ponds, and Tanks
7079.overview:
The Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) in collaboration with State Pollution Control Boards (SPCB) in the States and Pollution Control Committees (PCC) in Union Territories has established a National Water Monitoring Programme (NWMP) in order to assess status of water quality and to facilitate for prevention and control of pollution in water bodies (especially rivers, lakes, ponds, tanks, ground water, sea or marine water).

Comparison of water bodies Lakes, Ponds and Tanks to check their water quality using various characteristics such as PH, Dissolved Oxygen, Temperature, Conductivity, Bio Chemical Oxygen Demand, NitrateN + NitriteN (mg/l), Faecal Coli form , Total Coli form.
7079.source: Ministry of Environment  Forest and Climate Change

7080.name: Water Quality Medium Minor Rivers
7080.overview:
The Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) in collaboration with State Pollution Control Boards (SPCB) in the States and Pollution Control Committees (PCC) in Union Territories has established a National Water Monitoring Programme (NWMP) in order to assess status of water quality and to facilitate for prevention and control of pollution in water bodies (especially rivers, lakes, ponds, tanks, ground water, sea or marine water).

Water Quality of Medium and Minor Rivers, using various characteristics such as pH Value, Dissolved Oxygen, Temperature, Conductivity, Bio-Chemical Oxygen Demand, Nitrate-N + Nitrite-N (mg/l), Faecal Coli form, Total Coli form.
7080.source: Ministry of Environment  Forest and Climate Change

7081.name: Craftsmen Training Scheme
7081.overview: Craftsmen Training Scheme is the most important in the field of Vocational Training, which is been shaping the craftsmen to meet the existing as well as future manpower need, through the vast network of ITI s spread over various States or Union Territories in the country
7081.source: Ministry of Skill Development and Entrepreneurship
columns: Enrolled trainees under craftsmen training scheme
Institutes for training under craftsmen training scheme scheme

7082.name: Pradhan Mantri Shram Yogi Maandhan (PMSYM)
7082.overview: Pradhan Mantri Shram Yogi Maandhan dataset provides information on subscribers enrolled under the pension scheme of Pradhan Mantri Shram Yogi Maandhan which was introduced by the Government of India for unorganized workers. The entry age for this scheme is 18 to 40 years with monthly income of Rs.15000 or less.
columns: Name of the ministry or department
Subscribers enrolled under pradhan mantri shram yogi maan-dhan cheme.
Subscribers covered by common services centers

7083.name: Water Quality of Canals, Seawater, Drains, STPs (Sewage Treatment Plant) and WTPs (Water Treatment Plant)
7083.overview:
The Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) in collaboration with State Pollution Control Boards (SPCB) in the States and Pollution Control Committees (PCC) in Union Territories has established a National Water Monitoring Programme (NWMP) in order to assess status of water quality and to facilitate for prevention and control of pollution in water bodies (especially rivers, lakes, ponds, tanks, ground water, sea or marine water).

This dataset describes the Water Quality of Canals, Seawater, Drains, STP (Sewage Treatment Plant) and WTPs (Water Treatment Plant) using various characteristics such as pH Value, Dissolved Oxygen, Temperature, Conductivity, Bio-Chemical Oxygen Demand, Nitrate-N + Nitrite-N (mg/l), Faecal Coli form and Total Coli form
7083.source: Ministry of Environment  Forest and Climate Change

7084.name: Water Quality of Ground Water
7084.overview:
The Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) in collaboration with State Pollution Control Boards (SPCB) in the States and Pollution Control Committees (PCC) in Union Territories has established a National Water Monitoring Programme (NWMP) in order to assess status of water quality and to facilitate for prevention and control of pollution in water bodies (especially rivers, lakes, ponds, tanks, ground water, sea or marine water).

This dataset describes the Water Quality of Ground Water using various characteristics such as pH Value, Dissolved Oxygen, Temperature, Conductivity, Bio Chemical Oxygen Demand, NitrateN + NitriteN (mg/l), Faecal Coli form and Total Coli form
7084.source: Ministry of Environment  Forest and Climate Change

7086.name: Socio Economic Caste Census
7086.overview: The Socio Economic Caste Census (SECC) 2011 is a study of socioeconomic status of rural and urban households and allows ranking of households based on predefined parameters. SECC 2011 has three census components which were conducted by three separate authorities but under the overall coordination of Department of Rural Development in the Government of India. Census in Rural Area has been conducted by the Department of Rural Development (DoRD). Census in Urban areas is under the administrative jurisdiction of the Ministry of Housing and Urban Poverty Alleviation (MoHUPA). Caste Census is under the administrative control of Ministry of Home Affairs: Registrar General of India (RGI) and Census Commissioner of India.

7087.name: Rashtriya Krishi Vikas Yojna (RKVY)
7087.overview: Rashtriya Krishi Vikas Yojna (RKVY) scheme was initiated in 2007 as an umbrella scheme for ensuring holistic development of agriculture and allied sectors by allowing states to choose their own agriculture and allied sector development activities as per the district or state agriculture plan.
7087.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

7088.name: Livestock Census - Rural
7088.overview: Livestock Census is a complete count of the livestock and poultry at pre-defined reference point of time.
7088.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

7091.name: Expenses on Inmates
7091.overview: The expenses on inmates dataset provides information on total recurring expenditure on prison inmates with details of expenses made on food, clothing, medical, vocational, educational facilities, welfare, and other expenditure. The data is at the state level and covers from 2011 to 2019.

7092.name: Potential, Generation, Capacity - Renewable
7092.overview: This dataset gives information about renewable electricity potential, capacity, generation of various Indian states. Renewable power generation capacity is measured as the maximum net generating capacity of power plants and other installations that use renewable energy sources to produce electricity.
7092.source: Ministry of New and Renewable Energy
columns: Energy value type ( potential, capacity, generation )
key_columns: Energy value type ( potential, capacity, generation )

7093.name: Coal Consumption
7093.overview: The Coal Consumption Report is based on offtake numbers Reported by Coal Producing Companies in India.

7094.name: Coal Supply Production by State
7094.overview: Amongst fossil fuels, India is most well-endowed with coal. Approximately 7% of the world's proven coal reserves are located in India, which enhances its stature amongst the basket of fuels. This dataset reports coal production by state.

7095.name: Coal Reserves Production by State
7095.overview: Coal reserves refer to large deposits of coal which, based on geological surveys and engineering studies. Amongst fossil fuels, India is most well-endowed with coal. Approximately 7% of the world's proven coal reserves are located in India. This dataset reports coal reserves by state.

7096.name: Pradhan Mantri Gram Sadak Yojana (PMGSY)
7096.overview: Pradhan Mantri Gram Sadak Yojana is an initiative under Ministry of Rural Development with the goal of promoting access to economic and social services by providing all-weather road access to every village or habitation and thereby generating increased agricultural incomes and productive employment opportunities. This data set provides block wise information on length, maintenance and sanctioned costs of the roads constructed across India.
columns: Maintenance cost maintenance cost for the road
Road length of state and district
Sanction cost granted by ministry of rural development to for road construction
Total work done for each state in terms of habitations connected

7097.name: Primary Population Census 2001
7097.overview: The Primary Population Census 2001 from the ministry of home affairs provides basic information on area, total number of households, total population, scheduled castes, scheduled tribes population, population in the age group 0-6, literates, main workers and marginal workers classified by the four broad industrial categories, namely, (i) cultivators, (ii) agricultural labourers, (iii) household industry workers, and (iv) other workers and also non-workers. Rural-urban areas classification in regard is 'town' for urban areas and 'village' for rural areas.

7100.name: Statewise Road Statistics of India
7100.overview: Road Statistics of India dataset provides State or Union Territory wise data on various categories of roads like district roads, urban roads, rural roads, etc. at National, State or UT, District, and Local Levels (Municipal or Panchayat) including the data on length of road constructed. Recognizing the importance of a reliable road network in the country and the role it plays in economic development of the nation, Ministry of Road Transport and Highways (MoRTH) has undertaken the responsibility of building safer and better roads and highways across the country.
7100.source: Ministry of Road Transport and Highways

7101.name: Kisan Credit Card Scheme
7101.overview: Trend and Progress of statewise banking with respect to Kisan credit card scheme for commercial, cooperative, regional rural banks where credit (loan) is given to farmers with aim to mitigate any financial shortcoming experienced during crop cultivation, harvesting, and maintenance of crops.
columns: Amount due from farmers for using kisan credit cards
The assessment of the functioning of the banks in respective regions for kisan credit card scheme

7102.name: Goods & Service Tax (GST) Returns
7102.overview: GST return (GSTR) is a document containing details of all income or sales or expense or purchase which a taxpayer (every GSTIN) is required to file with the tax administrative authorities. This dataset of GST Return includes the information related to the tax payers who are eligible to pay the tax, who paid the tax before due date and the number of tax payers who have to pay after due date.
columns: Gst ( goods and service tax ) return type
Payer eligible for gst ( goods and service tax ) registration
Gst ( goods and service tax ) payers registered before due date
Gst ( goods and service tax ) payers registered after due date
key_columns: Gst ( goods and service tax ) return type

7103.name: Goods & Service Tax ( GST ) registration
7103.overview: In the Goods and Service tax (GST) Regime, businesses whose turnover exceeds certain threshold value as per Indian government acts (One Hundred and First Amendment Act, 2016) is required to register as a taxable entity with permanent account number (PAN). This process of registration is called GST registration and involves central GST, state GST, union territory GST, integrated GST (inter-state).
columns: Online information and database access or retrieval services from a place outside india to a non-taxable online recipient

7104.name: Statewise Statistics on Account Opening Report
7104.overview: The objective of "Pradhan Mantri Jan-Dhan Yojana (PMJDY)" is to ensure access to various financial services like availability of basic savings bank account, access to need-based credit, remittances facility, insurance and pension to the excluded sections i.e. weaker sections and low-income groups. The plan envisages universal access to banking facilities with at least one basic banking account for every household, financial literacy, access to credit, insurance and pension facility. In addition, the beneficiaries would get a RuPay Debit card having inbuilt accident insurance cover of Rs. 1 lakh. The Data set describes the beneficiaries at rural or semi-urban centre bank branches, beneficiaries at rural or semi-urban centre bank branches and balance in beneficiary accounts (in crore) Reported on 08/09/2021.
columns: Beneficiaries at rural or semi-urban centre bank branches under pradhan mantri jan-dhan yojana ( pmjdy )
Beneficiaries at urban or metro centre bank branches under pradhan mantri jan-dhan yojana ( pmjdy )
Balance in beneficiary accounts under pradhan mantri jan-dhan yojana ( pmjdy )
Rupay cards issued to beneficiaries under pradhan mantri jan-dhan yojana ( pmjdy )

7105.name: Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) Performance Ranking of States and Union Territories
7105.overview: This data set gives ranking of states and union territory who all are availing central governments Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) launched on 1st January, 2013. DBT aims to transfer benefits directly into the bank or postal accounts, preferably Aadhaar seeded, of accurately targeted beneficiaries.
7105.source: Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment
columns: Direct benefit transfer per capita, normalised-scores

7106.name: E-way Bill
7106.overview: An E-way bill is a document required by a person in charge of the conveyance carrying any consignment of goods of value exceeding Rs.50,000/- as mandated by the Government (in terms of Section 68 of the Goods and Services Tax Act read with Rule 138 of the Rules framed thereunder). It is generated from the GST Common Portal for E-Way bill system by the registered persons or transporters who cause movement of goods before the commencement of such movement.

7107.name: Settlement of Integrated Goods and Service Taxes (IGST)
7107.overview: Integrated goods and services tax (IGST) would mean the tax levied under the IGST Act, 2017 on the supply of any goods and/or services in the course of inter-state trade or commerce. Integrated GST shall also apply to the import of goods and services into India. This dataset gives information about the cross utilization of credits between Centre and states.
columns: Settlement of integrated goods and services tax ( igst )

7108.name: Telecom Subscription Data
7108.overview: The dataset about Telecom Subscription Data provides information about the number of active wireless subscribers, the wire-less subscribers active on the date of peak Visitor Location Register (VLR) and Wireline subscribers across states of India. The Indian telecom sector is the second largest in the world in terms of the number of subscribers. The sector has witnessed exponential growth over the last few years as a result of many factors such as affordable tariffs, wider service availability, rolling out of new facilities and services such as 3G and 4G, evolving consumption patterns of subscribers, and conducive regulatory environment.
columns: Proportion of VLR on a peak day

7109.name: Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) Disbursements - Statewise, Schemewise Data
7109.overview: Direct Benefit Transfer or DBT is a major reform initiative launched by Government of India on 1st January 2013 to re-engineer the existing cumbersome delivery processes using modern Information and Communication Technology (ICT). DBT programme aims to transfer benefits directly into the bank or postal accounts, preferably Aadhaar seeded, of accurately targeted beneficiaries. This data set gives direct benefit transfer (DBT) scheme disbursement for each state as per scheme type, benefit type under various ministries and their departments in yearly manner.
7109.source: Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment
columns: Dbt (direct benefit transfer ) scheme benefit type
key_columns: Dbt (direct benefit transfer ) scheme benefit type

7110.name: Prime Minister Employment Generation Program (PMEGP)
7110.overview: The scheme is implemented by Khadi and Village Industries Commission (KVIC) functioning as the nodal agency at the national level. At the state level, the scheme is implemented through State KVIC Directorates, State Khadi and Village Industries Boards (KVIBs), District Industries Centres (DICs) and banks. In such cases KVIC routes government subsidy through designated banks for eventual disbursal to the beneficiaries or entrepreneurs directly into their bank accounts.
7110.source: Ministry of Micro  Small and Medium Enterprises
columns: Micro, small, medium enterprises (msme) projects under prime minister employment generation programme (pmegp)
Fund released under prime minister employment generation programme (pmegp)
Employment generated under prime minister employment generation programme (pmegp)

7111.name: Selected Indicators of Primary Agricultural Credit Societies
7111.overview: A Primary Agricultural Credit Society (PACS) is a basic unit and smallest co-operative credit institutions in India. It works on the grassroots level (gram panchayat and village level). PACS deals directly with the rural (agricultural) borrowers, by giving and collecting loans. The current data set shows PACS parameters in state-wise manner.

7112.name: Number and Percentage of Population below Poverty Line
7112.overview: The dataset provides State or Union Territory Wise Distribution of number and percentage of persons below Poverty Line for both rural and urban area.
columns: Based on mrp or urp consumption or 30-day recall period
Percentage of the population below the poverty line.
key_columns: Based on mrp or urp consumption or 30-day recall period

7113.name: Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) Statistics
7113.overview: Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) is investment through capital instruments by a person who is a resident outside India in an unlisted Indian company. Any non-resident investment in an Indian company is direct foreign investment. This dataset contains the information about the amount invested by Foreign Direct Investment across India.
columns: Foreign Direct Investments across various states in Crores
Foreign Direct Investments across various states in US$ Million

7114.name: Tax Revenue Collection on Goods & Service Tax (GST) Portal
7114.overview: Under the Goods and Services Tax (GST) law, the Central Government will collect Central Goods and Services Tax (CGST), State Goods and Services Tax (SGST), Integrated Goods and Services Tax (IGST) or CESS depending upon whether the transaction is intrastate or interstate. When the supply of goods or services happens within a state called intra-state transactions, then both the Central Goods and Services Tax (CGST) and State Goods and Services Tax (SGST) will be collected. Whereas if the supply of goods or services happens between the states called as inter-state transactions, then only Integrated Goods and Services Tax (IGST) will be collected. And Cess is a form of tax charged/levied over and above the base tax liability of a taxpayer.
columns: Central goods and services tax ( cgst ) revenue
State goods and services tax ( sgst )revenue
Integrated goods and services tax ( igst )revenue

7115.name: National Food Security Act (NFSA) Monthly Allocation, Transaction and Foodgrain Distribution
7115.overview: The aim of the National Food Security Act (NFSA) is to provide food grains to a targeted population below the poverty line (BPL). The basic concept of food security globally is to ensure that all people, at all times, should get access to the basic food for their active and healthy life and is characterized by availability, access, utilization and stability of food. This dataset includes information related to the number of ration cards issued, number of Aadhaar cards authenticated, distribution of food grains.
7115.source: Ministry of Consumer Affairs  Food and Public Distribution
columns: Epos (electronic point of sale system) distribution of food grains

7116.name: Electronic Point of Sale (EPOS) Transactions -Aadhaar Authenticated and other Mode of Authentication under Automated
7116.overview: Electronic Point of Sale (EPOS) relates to the computerization of operations at the Fair Price Shop. Aadhaar is the basis of authentication of the beneficiary at the time of food grains delivery. All (Fair Price Shop) FPSs were equipped with PoS terminals for the purpose of authenticating or verifying beneficiaries before commodity distribution.
7116.source: Ministry of Consumer Affairs  Food and Public Distribution
columns: Ration card holders under national food security act ( nfsa )
Ration cards involved in the transactions under national food security act ( nfsa )

7117.name: Automated & Unautomated Allocation & Distribution (Rice & Wheat)
7117.overview: This dataset reports the allocation and distribution of rice and wheat done using Electronic Point of Sale (EPOS) across states and union territory for public distribution system under 'One Nation, One Ration Card'.
7117.source: Ministry of Consumer Affairs  Food and Public Distribution
columns: District food supply office implementing this scheme
Allocated Quantity using electronic point of sale (ePoS)
Allocated Quantity without using electronic point of sale (ePoS)
key_columns: District food supply office implementing this scheme

7118.name: Number of Transactions Enabled through Ration Card Portability (Overall)
7118.overview: The eligible ration cardholders covered under National Food Security Act (NFSA) shall be able to lift their entitled food grains from any Fair Price Shop (FPS) of their choice anywhere in the country, by using their ration card after biometric or Aadhaar authentication on electronic Point of Sale (ePoS) device at the FPS through 'One Nation, One Ration Card' scheme by quoting either their ration card number or the Aadhaar number. This dataset consists of the Statewise information about the quantity and number of transactions made through intra- and inter-district portability.
7118.source: Ministry of Consumer Affairs  Food and Public Distribution

7120.name: Economic Census Employment
7120.overview: The sixth economic census provides up to date information on number of persons employed across the country. This is available activitywise in all the sectors of the country (excluding crop production, plantation, public administration, defence and compulsory social security). It includes their distribution at all-India, state, district, village/town or ward levels for comprehensive analysis of the structure of the economy (macro, regional and micro levels).

7121.name: Village Amenities or Directory from Census 2011
7121.overview: The Village Amenities dataset is one of the traditional compilations of the Census Organization. It gives the name of the village & its location code, location code of state, district, sub-district and community development (cd) block in which it falls, its area and usage in hectares, amenities available such as educational, medical, drinking water, post and telegraph, commercial and co-operative banks, agricultural, non-agricultural and other credit societies, recreational and cultural facilities, communication, approach to village, nearest town with distance, power supply, availability of newspaper and magazines etc.

7123.name: Periodic Labour Force Survey (PLFS) - 2018-20 - Survey of Households
7123.overview: Periodic Labour Force Survey (PLFS) 2018-2020 gives information regarding people surveyed and enumerated within households, blocks and village by their age groups and gender for each State or Union Territory. The main objective of PLFS is to give information about household and estimates of key employment and unemployment Indicators like the Labour Force Participation Rates (LFPR), Worker Population Ratio (WPR) and Unemployment Rate (UR) across rural and urban areas. It measures the dynamics in labour force participation and employment status in the short time interval of three months only for urban areas in the Current Weekly Status (CWS) and also estimates important parameters of employment and unemployment in both usual status (principal activity status (PS) + subsidiary economic activity status(SS)). This survey has data over various states, villages and urban blocks, covering households and enumerating persons of various age groups.
columns: Households surveyed under periodic labour force survey ( plfs )

It measures the dynamics in labour force participation and employment status in the short time interval of three months only for urban areas in the Current Weekly Status (CWS) and also estimates important parameters of employment and unemployment in both usual status (principal activity status (PS) + subsidiary economic activity status(SS)). The main objective of PLFS is to give information about household and estimates of Key employment and unemployment Indicators like the Labour Force Participation Rates, Worker Population Ratio and Unemployment Rate across rural and urban areas. It measures the dynamics in labour force participation and employment status in the short time interval of three months for only the urban areas in the Current Weekly Status and also estimates important parameters of employment and unemployment in both usual status (principal activity status (PS) + subsidiary economic activity status(SS)). This survey has data over various states, villages and urban blocks, covering households and enumerating persons of various age groups.

7126.overview: Periodic Labour Force Survey (PLFS) 2018-2020 gives the information regarding Education level either illiterate or literate e.g. diploma, graduate, higher secondary, primary, middle, post graduate and above, secondary, secondary and above, Percentage of Worker Population and Unemployment according to usual status. The main objective of PLFS is to give information about household and estimates of Key employment and unemployment Indicators like the Labour Force Participation Rates (LFPR), Worker Population Ratio (WPR) and Unemployment Rate (UR) across rural and urban areas. It estimates important parameters of employment and unemployment in both usual status (principal activity status (PS) + subsidiary economic activity status (SS)). This survey has data over various states, villages and urban blocks, covering households and enumerating persons of various age groups
columns: Labor force participation rate according to usual status based on different general education level

7127.name: Periodic Labour Force Survey (PLFS) - 2018-20 - Distribution of Usually Working Persons by Industry of Work

It measures the dynamics in labour force participation and employment status in the short time interval of three months for only the urban areas in the Current Weekly Status and also estimates important parameters of employment and unemployment in both usual status (principal activity status (ps) + subsidiary economic activity status(ss)). This survey has data over various states, villages and urban blocks, covering households and persons of various age groups.

7145.name: State or Union Territory wise Domestic and Foreign Tourist Visits
7145.overview: State or Union Territory wise Domestic and Foreign Tourist Visits is the data set by the Ministry of Tourism which compiles the data on domestic and foreign (tourist) visits in States or UTs based on the information received from the State Governments or UT Administrations. To encourage domestic tourists to visit such unexploited tourist destinations in various States or UT's and thereby project India as an attractive multi-dimensional tourist destination. To familiarize travel agents or tour operators or hoteliers about new tourism products and the latest developments in the field of tourism. The key statistics collected by the Division include data on foreign tourist arrivals, domestic and foreign tourist visits, foreign exchange earnings from tourism, etc.
columns: Growth rate of domestic tourist visits

7147.name: Indian Minerals Yearbook - State Reviews
7147.overview: Indian Minerals Yearbook - State Reviews data set provides various information or data on mineral based industries, mineral production, reserves, foreign trade, etc. mineral production was reported from states, Union Territories during the particular year.

7148.name: Integrated Skill Development Scheme Training
7148.overview: Integrated Skill Integrated Skill Development Scheme (ISDS) Training has been laid on selecting the trainees from the job seekers amongst the rural youth having educational qualification preferably 10, +2 standard. The key focus has been given to target weaker or underprivileged sections of the society for the upliftment of their economic status and to provide opportunities for livelihood. The scheme reach has been highly inclusive and major stress has been laid on targeting backward section and reaching the lowest stratum of the society. The Dataset contains the information about the Implementing Agencies, Training Centres, and Persons enrolled in this scheme.
columns: Persons got trained under integrated skill development scheme (isds)
Persons got assessed after the training

7151.name: Statewise Financial Report on Funds released under e-Utthaan
7151.overview: Statewise Financial Report on funds released under the e-Utthaan scheme is an initiative taken by the government of India to ensure that all segments of the society, particularly the Scheduled castes, are benefited. The Government allocates funds across Ministries or Departments for different schemes where targeted financial and physical benefits can accrue to the Scheduled Castes.
7151.source: Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment

7152.name: Villages covered under Pradhan Mantri Adarsh Gram Yojana (PMAGY)
7152.overview: villages selected under Pradhan Mantri Adarsh Gram Yojana (PMAGY) at a particular phase achieve a certain level of development, they may aspire to improve further and hence villages can again be included in subsequent phases of the Scheme for receiving multiple rounds of funding. An Adarsh Gram is one wherein people have access to various basic services so that the minimum needs of all the sections of the society are fully met and disparities are reduced to a minimum. These villages would have all such infrastructure and its residents will have access to all such basic services that are necessary for a dignified living, creating thereby an environment in which everyone is enabled to utilize her or his potential to the fullest.
7152.source: Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment
columns: Rank of village within a district under Pradhan Mantri Adarsh Gram Yojana

7158.name: Statewise Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana (PMUY) Connections Released
7158.overview: Statewise PMUY Connections Released with an aim to safeguard the health of women and children by providing them with a clean cooking fuel to poor households and replace the unhealthy conventional cooking fuels such as firewood, cow dung, etc. - Liquefied Petroleum Gas (LPG) connections released by Government under PMUY (Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana). The use of LPG has its benefits on the health of women and children, environment and economic productivity of women.

7159.name: State Level Climate Vulnerability Indicators
7159.overview: State Level Climate Vulnerability Indicators dataset carries out vulnerability assessment for India based on various indicators related to infrastructure, agriculture, employment, disease, and the environment. Climate change is a serious threat to socio-economic development globally and in India. Adapting to the present and future impacts of climate change is crucial to secure hard-won gains and increase the resilience of vulnerable communities, in particular for those living in fragile mountain ecosystems.

7161.name: Number of ITDAs, MADA Pockets and Clusters - ST Population and Workers aged 15 and above
7161.overview: Number of ITDAs, MADA pockets, and clusters dataset describes the Literacy Rate of All Population, Schedule Tribes, and Gaps according to Census 2011. Integrated Tribal Development Agency (ITDA) or Integrated Tribal Development Project (ITDP) is for effective implementation and delivery of services in tribal concentration areas. Modified Area Development Approach (MADA) was adopted to cover smaller areas with a total population of 10,000 and Scheduled Tribes (ST) concentration of 50% or more. Clusters were identified to cover smaller areas of tribal concentration with a minimum total population of about 5,000 and Scheduled Tribes (ST) concentration of 50% or more. This Dataset gives the Information about the Statewise population of Scheduled tribes and their working history.

7166.name: Basic Statistics of Panchayati Raj Institutions 2019  - Thirteenth Finance Commission Grants
7166.overview: Basic Statistics of Panchayati Raj Institutions is State-wise and Year-wise allocation and release of Thirteenth Finance Commission (TFC) grants to Rural Local Bodies during 2010-11 to 2014-15 . 7171.name: Estimated Number and Area of Operational Holdings by Size Classes and Tenancy Status
7171.overview: The estimated number and area of operational holdings dataset gives information about different types of holdings by size class and tenancy status, from 2015 to 2016, at the subdistrict level.It covers all lands that meet two conditions, regardless of title, legal form, size or location by size classes and tenancy status. The data was collected by the Department of Agriculture, Cooperation and Farmers Welfare and the Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare through a survey of operational holdings.
