The data presents the number of machines by holding (farm) size, machine type, machine name, and whether the machine is owned or rented. The data is at the district level and covers from 2016 to 2017.
7184.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

7186.name: Estimated Institutional Credit taken for Agricultural Purposes by Size Groups.
7186.overview: The estimated institutional credit taken for agricultural purposes by size group dataset gives information about the number of operational holdings (farms) receiving loans from banks, or the number of loans themselves. The data provide detail on the type of bank issuing the loan, and duration and size of the loan. These counts are presented separately by holding size. The data is at the district level and covers from 2016 to 2017.
7186.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

7187.name: Estimated Number of Holders who used Certified Seeds (Blue Tag) Etc. for Agricultural Purpose
7187.overview: The estimated number of holders who used certified seeds for agricultural purposes dataset gives information about number of operational holdings (farms) using each type of seed or seed promotion program, and whether they encountered seed quality problems. These counts are presented separately by holding size. The data is at the district level and covers from 2016 to 2017.
7187.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

7188.name: Estimated Number of Operational Holders by Educational Status
7188.overview: The estimated number of operational holders by educational status dataset gives information on educational qualifications of farmers. Educational qualifications are separated into different levels, like illiterate, up to primary level, middle, secondary, senior secondary, technical diploma below degree level and graduates and above. The data presents the estimated number of farms by farmer education level and holding size. The data is at the district level and covers from 2016 to 2017.
7188.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

7189.name: Average Age of Operational Holder (2016-17)
7189.overview: The average age of operational holder dataset gives information about of the average age of the farmers, with pre-defined age-groups like 18 to 30, 66 and above, 61 to 65, 31 to 40, 41 to 50, 51 to 60. The data presents number of farms and average farmer age by farmer age-group and holding (farm) size. The data is at the district level and covers from 2016 to 2017.
7189.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

7190.name: Average Size of Household of Operational Holders (no.)
7190.overview: The average size of household of operational holders dataset gives information about the average size of households of farmers, with pre-defined household size categories of up to 3 members, 4 to 6, 7 to 9, etc. The data reports the number of farms and average household size by family size group and holding (farm) size. The data is at the district level and covers from 2016 to 2017.
7190.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

7191.name: Registered Companies in India - Ministry of Corporate Affairs (MCA)
7191.overview: This dataset lists registered companies in India along with identifying details for each company. It refers to the companies that are incorporated under the guidelines for different types of company registration by the Ministry of Corporate Affairs.

7207.name: Mineral Production and Value of Mineral Production (Monthly)
7207.overview: Mineral Production and Value of Mineral Production data sets deals with the index of mineral production, production and value of minerals by minerals and by states, State-wise average sale price of minerals by grades for which royalty is chargeable on ad-valorem basis not linked to any International Benchmark Prices, London Metal Exchange (LME) prices for Aluminium (Al), Copper (Cu), Lead (Pb), Nickel (Ni) , Tin (Sn), Zinc (Zn) and also other London prices for Gold (Au) and Silver (Ag), production of iron ore by captive and non-captive use both in public and private sectors by states etc.

7208.name: Population Projections
7208.overview: Population Projections dataset gives the information about the projected population for each state of India till the year 2036. The Cohort Component Method is the universally accepted method of making population projections because of the fact that the growth of population is determined by fertility, mortality and migration rates. For the projections, for the years before 2014, combined SRS estimates of Andhra Pradesh and year 2014 onwards, separate SRS estimates of fertility and mortality of Andhra Pradesh and Telangana are used. The sources of data used are 2011 Census as well as the Sample Registration System (SRS). SRS provides time series data of fertility and mortality, which has been used for predicting their future levels
7208.source: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare

7209.name: Population Projections Urban
7209.overview: Population Projections Urban dataset gives the information about the projected urban population for each state of India till the year 2036. The Cohort Component Method is the universally accepted method of making population projections because of the fact that the growth of population is determined by fertility, mortality and migration rates. For the projections, for the years before 2014, combined SRS estimates of Andhra Pradesh and year 2014 onwards, separate SRS estimates of fertility and mortality of Andhra Pradesh and Telangana are used. The sources of data used are 2011 Census as well as the Sample Registration System (SRS). SRS provides time series data of fertility and mortality, which has been used for predicting their future levels.
7209.source: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare

This datasets contains the asset ownership details of Households dataset is about various assets like telephone, mobile, refrigerator, vehicles which is owned by the households.

7224.name: Update on Indian Port Sector - Trends in Cargo Handled at Major & Non-Major Ports
7224.overview: Update on Indian Port Sector Traffic Handled by Major and Non-Major Ports by Maritime States & UTs has been entrusted with the responsibility to formulate policies and programmes and their implementation for the development and monitoring of ports. A comprehensive policy package is necessary to address the diverse issues facing the Maritime transport sector. The Ports, Shipping and Waterways industry enabled to carry higher shares of the sea-borne trade in indigenous bottoms.
columns: Traffic handled by Non Major Ports

7225.name: Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (PMAY) Citywise Financial and Physical Progress
7225.overview: Citywise Financial and Physical Progress report under Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana scheme provides information on financial status like total amount invested, assistance sanctioned and released by central government and progress of houses like number of houses sanctioned, grounded and completed. The objective is to ensure that by the time the Nation completes 75 years of its Independence, every family will have a pucca house with water connection, toilet facilities, 24x7 electricity supply and access. The mission seeks to address the housing requirement of urban poor including slum dwellers.
7225.source: Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs

7227.name: Statewise List of Passports Issued in 2014-15
7227.overview: Statewise list of passports issued in 2014-15 dataset provides the state wise information on number of passports issued during the year 2014-15. Indian passports are issued by the Ministry of External Affairs through the Central Passport Organization and its all-India network of 37 Passport Offices, CPV Division (only Diplomatic and Official passports) and the Andaman and Nicobar Islands Administration.

7228.name: Statewise Central Public Sector Enterprises (CPSE) with Gross block and Employment
7228.overview: StateWise CPSEs (Central Public Sector Enterprises) with Gross block and Employment dataset provides information gross block and employment in Central Public Sector Enterprises across India. State-owned enterprises, popularly known as Central Public Sector Enterprises (CPSEs), in India have a twin objective of commercial efficiency and social responsibility. The challenge for these enterprises is to ensure a reasonable return on investment while discharging their constitutional and social obligations. As extended arms of the welfare state, the enterprises have the mandate to act as model employers and conduct their business in a transparent manner along with protecting the interests of all stakeholders.
7228.source: Ministry of Heavy Industries and Public Enterprises

7229.name: Statewise representation of members in the Lok Sabha
7229.overview: Statewise representation of members in the Lok Sabha dataset provides information on number of representatives in Lok Sabha. Lok Sabha is composed of representatives of the people chosen by direct election based on adult suffrage. The maximum strength of the House envisaged by the Constitution is 552, which is made up by election of up to 530 members to represent the States, up to 20 members to represent the Union Territories and not more than two members of the Anglo-Indian Community to be nominated by the Hon'ble President. The total elective membership is distributed among the States in such a way that the ratio between the number of seats allotted to each State and the population of the State is, so far as practicable, the same for all States.

7230.name: Statewise details on Crude Steel in 2020
7230.overview: Statewise details on Crude Steel during 2020 dataset provides the information on number of units, capacity, production and capacity utilized of crude steel across various states. Ministry of steel is responsible for planning and development of Iron and Steel industry, development of essential inputs such as iron-ore, limestone, dolomite, manganese ore, chromite, Ferro-alloys, sponge iron, etc. and other related functions.

7231.name: State or Union Territory wise details of Youth Hostels
7231.source: Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports

7232.name: State or Union Territory wise Number of Children (0-6 Years) Enrolled for Pre School Education (ECCE) in Anganwadi Centres as on 30.9.2018
7232.overview: Statewise data on the beneficiaries enrolled for preschool education under the Early Childhood Care and Education (ECCE) policy. The Anganwadi Services Scheme is one of the largest and unique programmes for early childhood care and development. The beneficiaries under this scheme are children in the age group of 6 months to 6 years, pregnant women and lactating mothers.
7232.source: Ministry of Women and Child Development
columns: Children enrolled for pre school education beneficiaries under early childhood care and education policy

7233.name: State or Union Territory wise number of Anganwadi Workers in positions in Anganwadi Centres as on 30.9.2018
7233.overview: The number of Anganwadi workers in positions in Anganwadi Centres in 2018. The Anganwadi Services Scheme is one of the flagship programmes of the Government of India and represents one of the world largest and unique programmes for early childhood care and development. It is the foremost symbol of the country commitment towards its children and nursing mothers. A response to the challenge of providing preschool non formal education on one hand and breaking the vicious cycle of malnutrition, morbidity, reduced learning capacity and mortality on the other.
7233.source: Ministry of Women and Child Development
columns: Female anganwadi workers government-part time ( honorary worker )

7234.name: Statewise number of Licensed Pharmacies
7234.overview: Statewise number of licensed pharmacies under Ayush as of 1.4.2020. Subject to other provisions of labelling, packing and standards of cosmetics rules, no person shall sell or distribute any cosmetic unless the cosmetic, of Indian origin, is manufactured by a licensed manufacturer and labelled and packed in accordance with labelling, packing and standards of cosmetics rules.
7234.source: Ministry of Ayurveda, Yoga, Naturopathy, Unani, Siddha, Sowa-Rigpa and Homoeopathy (AYUSH)

7235.name: Statewise Railway Track in Kilometers (Route, Running ,Total RailwayTrack)
7235.overview: Statewise Route Kilometre or Running Track or Total Track data set shows Route Kilometre, Running Track Kilometre. and Total Track Kilometre of railway lines across various States or Union Territories in 2016-17. The route length of Indian Railways covered 67,956 kms with running track length of 99,235 kms. The total trackage including yards, sidings etc. stood at 1,26,366 kms.

7236.name: Quarterwise Data of Pre School Education Beneficiaries (3-6 Years) for the year 2017-18
7236.overview: Quarterwise data on the number of beneficiary children (age 3-6) in pre school in each state. The Anganwadi Services under umbrella Integrated Child Development Service (ICDS) is a universal self-selecting Scheme available to all the beneficiaries who enrol at the Anganwadi Centres. At present, there are 3.02 crore children in the age group 3-6 years who are beneficiaries of pre-school education in Anganwadi Centres under Anganwadi Services.
7236.source: Ministry of Women and Child Development
columns: Pre - school education beneficiaries in the age group of 3 to 6 years

7249.name: Sub-mission on Agricultural Mechanization - Custom Hiring Centres, HI-TECH Hubs, Farm Machinery Banks
7249.overview: Sub-mission on Agricultural Mechanization (SMAM) is about increasing the reach of farm mechanization to small and marginal farmers and to the regions where the availability of farm power is low. This aims at reaching the unreached by making farm machines accessible and affordable for the small and marginal farmers (SMFs) through the establishment of Custom Hiring Centers (CHCs), creating Hubs for hi-tech and high-value farm equipment, and Farm Machinery Banks. Distribution of various subsidized agricultural equipment and machines to an individual farmer is also one of the activities under the scheme. Purchasing of farm machines for SMFs is not financially feasible therefore custom hiring institutions provide for hiring options of machines to SMFs. Creating awareness among stakeholders through demonstration of machine operations and skill development of farmers and youth and others are also the components of SMAM.
7249.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

7250.name: Sub-mission on Agricultural Mechanization - Distribution of agricultural machines
7250.overview: Sub-mission on Agricultural Mechanization (SMAM) is about increasing the reach of farm mechanization to small and marginal farmers and to the regions where the availability of farm power is low. This aims at reaching the unreached by making farm machines accessible and affordable for the small and marginal farmers (SMFs) through the establishment of Custom Hiring Centers (CHCs), creating Hubs for hi-tech and high-value farm equipment, and Farm Machinery Banks. Distribution of various subsidized agricultural equipment and machines to an individual farmer is also one of the activities under the scheme. Purchasing of farm machines for SMFs is not financially feasible therefore custom hiring institutions provide for hiring options of machines to SMFs. Creating awareness among stakeholders through demonstration of machine operations and skill development of farmers and youth and others are also the components of SMAM.
7250.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

7254.name: National Sample Survey (NSS) Round 75 - Education - Percentage Distribution of Households
7254.overview:
The main objective of NSS 75th round (July 2017- June 2018) survey on Household Social Consumption: Education, was to build indicators on the participation of people in the age group of 3 to 35 years in the education system, expenditure incurred on the education of the household members and various indicators of those currently not attending education (i.e, for the persons who never enrolled or ever enrolled but currently not attending education). Additionally, for persons of age 5 years and above, information was collected on the ability to operate a computer, ability to use internet and use of the internet during last 30 days. Data in this collection was collected between July 2017 and June 2018.

This dataset is extracted from summary Statement 3.2.1 in the NSS Report No 585, "Education in India".  It contains information on the percentage distribution of households by distance to nearest school having primary, upper primary or middle and secondary level classes for different States. It also gives information about asset value and Ginni coefficient of asset of households.
7254.source: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation

7277.name: National Sample Survey (NSS) Round 70 - Household Assets and Liabilities - Average value of assets, amount of debt, Incidence of Indebtedness and Debt asset ratio
7277.overview:
The main objective of NSS 70th round, information on assets and liabilities of the households; is to provide information on the amount of capital expenditure incurred by the households, cash borrowings and repayments made by the household, sale and loss of assets of the household through the debt and investment schedule. The National Sample Survey Office (NSSO) conducts nationwide socio-economic surveys and each survey takes a year to complete. The NSS surveys are conducted through household interviews on a random sample of households  designed to cover the entire country. Data in this collection was collected between January 2013 and December 2013.

This dataset is extracted from appendix table Table 1R/U in the NSS Report No 570, "Household Assets and Liabilities". It gives information on average value of assets, debt amount per household, indebted households and data-asset ratio of rural households.
7277.source: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation
columns: Average value of assets (ava) per household
Average amount of debt per household

7281.name: National Sample Survey (NSS) Round 70 - Household Assets and Liabilities - Asset value of households by asset name and asset type
7281.overview:
The main objective of NSS 70th round, information on assets and liabilities of the households; is to provide information on the amount of capital expenditure incurred by the households, cash borrowings and repayments made by the household, sale and loss of assets of the household through the debt and investment schedule. The National Sample Survey Office (NSSO) conducts nationwide socio-economic surveys and each survey takes a year to complete. The NSS surveys are conducted through household interviews on a random sample of households  designed to cover the entire country. Data in this collection was collected between January 2013 and December 2013.

This dataset is extracted from appendix table Table 7R/U in the NSS Report No 570, "Household Assets and Liabilities". It gives information about major household types, Asset Holding Class, assets types and average value of assets (AVA) per household.
7281.source: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation
columns: Average value of assets ( ava ) per household

columns: Households reporting having bullion and ornaments per 1000 households

7286.name: National Sample Survey (NSS) Round 75 - Health - Proportion of Persons Reported Ailing (age-group)
7286.overview:
The main objective of this survey was to gather basic quantitative information on the health sector: morbidity, profile of ailments including their treatment, role of government and private facilities in providing healthcare, expenditure on medicines, expenditure on medical consultation and investigation, hospitalization and expenditure, maternity and childbirth, the condition of the aged, etc. Data was collected between July 2018 and June 2019 through the NSS Schedule 25.0 (Household Social Consumption: Health).

This dataset is extracted from summary Statement 3 in the NSS Report No 556, "Health in India".  It contains information about the estimated number of persons in the population reported ailing in the past 15 days as a proportion of the estimated total population, categorized by age group.
7286.source: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation
columns: Persons in the population reported ailing (%)

7323.name: State or Union Territory wise Common Services Centers(CSC) roll-out status
7323.overview: State or Union Territory wise Common Services Centers(CSC) roll-out status provides data on number of Functional Common Services Centers(CSC) including Gram Panchayat(GP) and Common Services Centers(CSC) Registered during 2017. The role of Common Services Centers(CSC) is to create a platform that enables Government, Private and Social sector organizations to align their social and commercial goals for the benefit of the rural population in the remotest corners of the country through a combination of IT based as well as non IT based services.
7323.source: Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology

7325.name: State or Union Territory wise Aadhaar Saturation
7325.overview: State or Union Territory wise Aadhaar Saturation dataset provides category (0-5 years, 5-18 years and all) wise information on total population and number of Aadhaar assigned. The Unique Identification Authority of India (UIDAI) is a statutory authority established under the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology to issue Unique Identification numbers (UID), named as Aadhaar, to all residents of India. UIDAI is responsible for Aadhaar enrolment and authentication, including operation and management of all stages of Aadhaar life cycle, developing the policy, procedure, and system for issuing Aadhaar numbers to individuals and perform authentication and the security of identity information and authentication records of individuals.
7325.source: Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology

7327.name: Commodity Market Price - 2016
7327.overview:
The Agricultural Marketing Information Network (AGMARKNET) portal provides easy access to daily prices and arrval information of more than 2000 varieties and about 300 commodities from the wholesale markets spread all over the country. This dataset contains price data for 2016.

AGMARKNET facilitates generalization and transmission of prices, commodity arrival information from agricultural produce markets, and web-based dissemination to producers, consumers, traders and policy makers transparently and quickly.
7327.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

7335.name: State-wise List of Members in the Lok Sabha
7335.overview: State-wise List of Members in the Lok Sabha dataset provides information on the membership of representatives in Lok sabha for all rounds. Lok Sabha is composed of representatives of the people chosen by direct election based on adult suffrage. The maximum strength of the House envisaged by the Constitution is 552, which is made up by election of up to 530 members to represent the States, up to 20 members to represent the Union Territories and not more than two members of the Anglo-Indian Community to be nominated by the Hon'ble President. The total elective membership is distributed among the States in such a way that the ratio between the number of seats allotted to each State and the population of the State is, so far as practicable, the same for all States.

7336.name: Handbook of Statistics on Indian States - Government Hospitals and Beds

7351.name: SDG India Index : 7th Sustainable Development Goal - Affordable and clean energy: Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all
7351.overview: Sustainable development goal (SDG) Index by NITI Ayog is a collection of 17 interlinked goals, and this data set explains about the 7th SDG that aims at ensuring access to affordable, reliable, sustainable, efficient and modern energy for all by 2030. The world's economy is highly dependent on energy and the transition to more sustainable energy systems will impact the socio-economic resilience of communities. The 17 interlinked global goals are designed to be a "blueprint to achieve a better and more sustainable future for all". The SDGs were set up in 2015 by the United Nations General Assembly (UN-GA) and are intended to be achieved by 2030.
7351.source: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
columns: Households electrified under ministry of power in 2019 (%)
Lpg+png connections against number of households as per mopng calculations as on 31.07.2020 (%)

7352.name: SDG India Index : 6th Sustainable Development Goal - Clean water and sanitation: Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all
7352.overview: 6th Sustainable development goal (SDG) on Clean water and sanitation includes Safe and affordable drinking water aims at ensuring availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all also end open defecation and provide access to sanitation, and hygiene, improve water quality, wastewater treatment and safe reuse, increase water-use efficiency and ensure freshwater supplies, implement IWRM, protect and restore water-related ecosystems.This goal calls for access to safe and affordable drinking water, sanitation facilities, and hygiene for all by 2030. The SDGs or Global Goals are a collection of 17 interlinked global goals designed to be a "blueprint to achieve a better and more sustainable future for all". The SDGs were set up in 2015 by the United Nations General Assembly (UN-GA) and are intended to be achieved by 2030.
7352.source: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
columns: Rural population getting safe and adequate drinking water within premises through pipe water supply ( pws ) (%)

7353.name: SDG India Index : 13th Sustainable Development Goal - Climate Action
7353.overview: 13th Sustainable development goal (SDG) Index for Climate Action dataset gives information about indicators related to climate change measures, disaster risk measures and sustainable natural resource management across India. The goal is to implement the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change and to promote mechanisms to raise capacity for planning and management. This goal calls for climate action to take urgent action to combat climate change and its impacts by regulating emissions and promoting developments in renewable energy. The Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) are a collection of 17 interlinked global goals set up in 2015 by the United Nations General Assembly (UN-GA) designed to be a "blueprint to achieve a better and more sustainable future for all" and are intended to be achieved by 2030.
7353.source: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
columns: Human lives lost per 1 crore population due to extreme weather events

7354.name: SDG India Index : 8th Sustainable Development Goal - Decent work and economic growth
7354.overview: 8th Sustainable development goal (SDG) Index for Decent work and economic growth dataset describes employment and economic growth across all states in India.  8th SDG aims to promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all. It seeks to protect labour rights and promote policies to achieve full and productive employment, and decent work, for all women and men by 2030. The Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) or Global Goals are a collection of 17 interlinked global goals designed to be a "blueprint to achieve a better and more sustainable future for all". The SDGs were set up in 2015 by the United Nations General Assembly (UN-GA) and are intended to be achieved by 2030.
7354.source: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare

7355.name: SDG India Index : 5th Sustainable Development Goal - Gender Equality
7355.overview: 5th Sustainable development goal (SDG) Index for Gender Equality dataset compares gender on basis of various indicators like crimes, birth, wages or salaries, seats in legislative assembly, Labour Force participation rate (LFPR), operational land holdings, etc. The goal of 5th SDG is to achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls. This goal aims to grant women and girls equal rights, and opportunities to live free without discrimination including workplace discrimination or any violence. The Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) or Global Goals are a collection of 17 interlinked global goals designed to be a "blueprint to achieve a better and more sustainable future for all". The SDGs were set up in 2015 by the United Nations General Assembly (UN-GA) and are intended to be achieved by 2030.
7355.source: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare

7356.name: SDG India Index : 3rd Sustainable Development Goal - Good Health and Well-being
7356.overview: 3rd Sustainable development goal (SDG) Index for Good Health and Well-being dataset is regarding the health of people across India with respect to the indicators related to deaths, births, diseases and availability of physicians. The goal is to ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages. Universal health coverage, including financial risk protection, access to quality essential health care services and access to safe, effective, quality, and affordable medicines are integral to this goal. The Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) or Global Goals are a collection of 17 interlinked global goals designed to be a "blueprint to achieve a better and more sustainable future for all". The SDGs were set up in 2015 by the United Nations General Assembly (UN-GA) and are intended to be achieved by 2030.
7356.source: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare

Number of physicians, nurses and midwives per 10,000 population

7357.name: SDG India Index : 9th Sustainable Development Goal - Industry, Innovation and Infrastructure
7357.overview: The 9th Sustainable Development Goal is Industry, Innovation and Infrastructure is to build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization, and foster innovation. It further aims at promoting increased resource use efficiency and greater adoption of clean and environmentally sound technologies and industrial processes. This goal promotes investment in innovation; and reliable and resilient infrastructure which are crucial drivers of economic growth and development. It further aims at promoting increased resource use efficiency and greater adoption of clean and environmentally sound technologies and industrial processes. It also aims to Facilitate sustainable infrastructure development for developing countries; support domestic technology development and industrial diversification; universal access to information and communications technology.
7357.source: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
columns: Targeted habitations connected by all weather roads under pradhan mantri gram sadak yojana ( pmgsy )
Share of gross value added ( gva ) in manufacturing to total gross value added (gva) in current prices (%)
Manufacturing employment as a percentage of total employment (%)
Innovation score as per the india innovation index
Score as per logistics ease across different states ( leads ) report
Mobile connections per 100 persons (mobile tele density) as per dept.of telecommunications
Internet subscribers per 100 population as per dept.of telecommunications

7358.name: SDG India Index : 14th Sustainable Development Goal - Life below Water
7358.overview: 14th Sustainable Development Goal is Life below Water aims to Conserve and sustainably use the oceans, seas and marine resources for sustainable development. It focuses on preventing marine pollution, ending illegal and destructive fishing practices, and sustainably managing and protecting marine and coastal ecosystems while increasing scientific knowledge, research, and transfer of marine technology to improve marine health. The SDGs were set up in 2015 by the United Nations General Assembly (UN-GA) and are intended to be achieved by 2030.
7358.source: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
columns: Mean shore zone coastal water quality (Biochemical Oxygen Demand ( BOD ))
Mean shore zone coastal water quality (Total Nitrogen (TN))
Average marine acidity (pH) measured at representative sampling stations in the shore zone
Potential area available for developed under aquaculture (%)

7359.name: SDG India Index : 15th Sustainable Development Goal - Life on Land
7359.overview: The 15th Sustainable Development Goal is Life on Land which aims to protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss. The Goal is aimed at protecting, restoring and promoting sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems; sustainable management of forests; combating desertification; and halting and reversing land degradation in conjunction with integrating ecosystems and biodiversity into national and local planning. It also seeks to promote fair and equitable sharing of the benefits arising from the utilization of genetic resources, and prevent poaching and trafficking of protected species of flora and fauna. The SDGs were set up in 2015 by the United Nations General Assembly (UN-GA) and are intended to be achieved by 2030.
7359.source: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
columns: Forest covered to the total geographical area (%)
Tree covered to the geographical area (%)
Geographical area covered by forest and trees (%)
Area covered under afforestation schemes to the total geographical area (%)
Degraded land over total land area (%)
Cases under wildlife protection act (1972) per million hectares of protected area

7360.name: SDG India Index : 1st Sustainable Development Goal - No Poverty
7360.overview: 1st Sustainable Development Goal is No Poverty which aims to end poverty in all its forms everywhere. This goal encompasses the aim of eradicating poverty, not only in monetary terms but in all forms and dimensions by 2030. This involves targeting the most vulnerable and supporting communities affected by conflict and climate-related disasters and increasing basic resources and services. The Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) or Global Goals are a collection of 17 interlinked global goals designed to be a "blueprint to achieve a better and more sustainable future for all". The SDGs were set up in 2015 by the United Nations General Assembly (UN-GA) and are intended to be achieved by 2030.
7360.source: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
columns: Population living below the national poverty line (%)
Head count ratio as per the multidimensional poverty index (%)
Households with any usual member covered by a health scheme or health insurance (%)
Persons provided employment to the persons who demanded employment under mahatma gandhi national rural employment guarantee act (mgnrega) (%)
Population (out of total eligible population) receiving social protection benefits under pradhan mantri matru vandana yojana (pmmvy) and child development (%)

7361.name: SDG India Index : 16th Sustainable Development Goal - Peace, justice and strong institutions
7361.overview: The 16th Sustainable Development Goal Peace, justice and strong institutions, aims to promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels. Peace, stability and effective governance based on rule-of-law and upholding the principles of equality, human rights and justice are prerequisites for sustainable development. Reducing violent crime, sex trafficking, forced labor, and child abuse are clear global goals. The International Community values peace and justice; they call for stronger judicial systems that will enforce laws and work toward a more peaceful and just society. The 2030 Agenda aims to significantly reduce all forms of violence, and work with governments and communities to end conflict and insecurity. The SDGs were set up in 2015 by the United Nations General Assembly (UN-GA) and are intended to be achieved by 2030.
7361.source: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
columns: Cognizable crimes against children per 1,00,000 population
Victims of human trafficking per 10 lakh population
Cases under prevention of corruption act and related sections of ipc per 10 lakh population

7362.name: SDG India Index : 4th Sustainable Development Goal - Quality Education
7362.overview: 4th Sustainable Development Goal, Quality Education, ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all. Achieving inclusive and quality education for all reaffirms the belief that education is one of the most powerful and proven vehicles for sustainable development. This goal is aimed at ensuring that all girls and boys complete primary and secondary schooling by 2030 and are provided equal access to affordable vocational training, to eliminate gender and wealth disparities, and achieve universal access to a quality higher education. Major progress has been made in access to education, specifically at the primary school level, for both boys and girls. The number of out-of-school children has almost halved from 112 million in 1997 to 60 million in 2014. The SDGs were set up in 2015 by the United Nations General Assembly (UN-GA) and are intended to be achieved by 2030.
7362.source: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
columns: Adjusted net enrolment ratio ( aner ) in elementary education for classes 1 to 8
Average annual dropout rate at secondary level for classes 9 to 10

7363.name: SDG India Index : 10th Sustainable Development Goal - Reduced Inequality
7363.overview: The 10th Sustainable Development Goal, Reduced Inequality, aims to reduce income inequality within and among countries. The Goal calls for progressively reducing not only income inequalities but also inequalities-of-outcome by ensuring access to equal opportunities and promoting social, economic and political inclusion of all, irrespective of age, sex, disability, race, ethnicity, origin, religion or economic or any other status relevant within a society. It also aims at enhancing representation and voice for developing countries in decision making in international economic and financial institutions. This goal will ensure equal opportunity and reduce inequalities of outcome, including by eliminating discriminatory laws, policies and practices and promoting appropriate legislation, policies and action in this regard.The SDGs were set up in 2015 by the United Nations General Assembly (UN-GA) and are intended to be achieved by 2030.
7363.source: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
columns: Population in the lowest two wealth quintiles (%)

Rate of total crimes against scheduled tribes ( st ) per 1,00,000 st population

7364.name: SDG India Index : 12th Sustainable Development Goal - Responsible consumption and production
7364.overview: 12th Sustainable Development Goal, Responsible consumption and production aims to ensure sustainable consumption and production patterns. The Goal emphasizes on doing more with less thus promoting resource efficiency, green economies and sustainable infrastructure. It also focuses on reducing degradation and pollution and minimizing waste. The Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) or Global Goals are a collection of 17 interlinked global goals designed to be a "blueprint to achieve a better and more sustainable future for all". The SDGs were set up in 2015 by the United Nations General Assembly (UN-GA) and are intended to be achieved by 2030.
7364.source: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
columns: Use of nitrogenous fertilizer out of total n,p,k, (nitrogen, phosphorous, potassium) (%)
Quantity of hazardous waste recycled or utilized to total hazardous waste generated (%)
Plastic waste generated per 1,000 population-implementation of plastic waste management rules, 2011 census population projections
Biomedical waste treated to total quality of biomedical waste generated (%)
Installed capacity of grid interactive bio power per 10 lakh population

7365.name: SDG India Index : 11th Sustainable Development Goal - Sustainable cities and communities
7365.overview: The 11th Sustainable Development Goal for Sustainable cities and communities aims to make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient, and sustainable. The goal promotes inclusive and sustainable urbanization. Making cities sustainable means creating career and business opportunities, safe and affordable housing, and building resilient societies and economies. It involves investment in public transport, creating green public spaces, and improving urban planning and management in participatory and inclusive ways.By 2030, this goal will ensure access for all adequate, safe and affordable housing and basic services and upgrade slums. The SDGs were set up in 2015 by the United Nations General Assembly (UN-GA) and are intended to be achieved by 2030.
7365.source: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
columns: Urban households living in katcha houses (%)
Deaths due to road accidents in urban areas per 1,00,000 population
Wards with 100 percent door to door waste collection under swachh bharat mission urban sbm(u) (%)
Municipal solid wast ( msw ) processed to the total municipal solid wast ( msw ) generated sbm(u) (%)
Installed sewage treatment capacity to sewage generated in urban areas (%)

7366.name: SDG India Index : 2nd Sustainable Development Goal - Zero Hunger
7366.overview: The 2nd Sustainable Development Goal aims to end hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition, and promote sustainable agriculture. Globally, 1 in 9 people are undernourished, the vast majority of whom live in developing countries. Undernutrition causes wasting or severe wasting in 52 million children worldwide. It contributes to nearly half (45%) of deaths in children under five – 3.1 million children per year. The SDG involves promoting sustainable agriculture, supporting small-scale farmers and equal access to land, technology and markets. The goal also focuses at - doubling agricultural productivity, maintaining the genetic diversity of seeds, plants and farmed animals, and strengthening the capacity for climate change adaptive agriculture. The SDGs were set up in 2015 by the United Nations General Assembly (UN-GA) and are intended to be achieved by 2030.
7366.source: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
columns: Beneficiaries covered under national food security act (nfsa),2013 (%)

7367.name: SDG India Index : Composite score (2020-21)
7367.overview: Sustainable development Goals ( SDG ) index contains information on goal score computed by aggregating score under each SDG and composite score which is obtained by averaging all goal scores of all the states.  Based on the performance score of states, they were classified into 4 categories as, 0 to 49 are aspirants, 50 to 64 are performers, 65 to 99 are front runners, 100 are achievers. The Sustainable development Goals ( SDG ) Index by Niti Ayog, set up in 2015 by the United Nations General Assembly (UN-GA) are a collection of 17 interlinked global goals designed to be a "blueprint to achieve a better and more sustainable future for all". The Index, using a globally accepted and robust methodology, measures the progress achieved at the country and State/UT levels, thereby offering invaluable insights to policymakers on the remaining distance to travel, gaps, and data and statistical challenges.
7367.source: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare

7368.name: Unified District Information System for Education (UDISE) : Enrolment 1 - Social category and minority groupwise data for 2019-21
7368.overview: Unified District Information System for Education (UDISE) was created by integrating District Information System for Education (DISE) for elementary and secondary education. This dataset contains State wise enrollment of all social groups and minority groups enrolment by gender and level of education (Pre-primary to Class 12th) for the academic year 2019-20 and 2020-21.

7369.overview: This dataset provides information about the number of students (boys and girls) from age group of 5 to 23 enrolled in Pre-Primary class to Class 12 in academic years 2019-20 and 2020-21. Unified District Information System for Education (UDISE) initiated in 2012-13 integrating District Information System for Education (DISE) for elementary and secondary education is one of the largest Management Information Systems in School Education covering more than 1.5 million schools, more than 9.6 million teachers and more than 264 million children.

Unified District Information System for Education (UDISE) initiated in 2012-13 integrating District Information System for Education (DISE) for elementary and secondary education is one of the largest Management Information Systems in School Education covering more than 1.5 million schools, more than 9.6 million teachers and more than 264 million children.

7374.name: Agriculture and Allied - State wise Pattern of Land Use
7374.overview: State wise Pattern of Land Use under Agriculture and Allied Sector dataset gives information about the net sown area, gross sown area, net irrigated area, gross irrigated area and cropping intensity. The layout or arrangement of the uses of the land is known as “land use pattern”. The important types of land use in the country are forests area, land not available for cultivation, cultivable wasteland, fallow land and net area sown. The agricultural land in India is little more than 50 per cent of the total geographical area in the country.

7375.name: Social and Demographic Indicators - State wise Life Expectancy
7375.overview: Statewise Life Expectancy under Social and Demographic Indicators is a Quinquennial Survey by Census, gives detailed information about Life Expectancy in years across all the states. It is a statistical measure of the average time an organism is expected to live, based on the year of its birth, its current age, and other demographic factors like sex.

7376.name: Social and Demographic Indicators - Unemployment Rate
7376.overview: State wise Unemployment rate under Social and Demographic Indicators provides information on Unemployment rate per thousand across all the states. The unemployment rate is the share of the labour force that is jobless, represented as a percentage.

7377.name: Agriculture and Allied - State wise Per Hectare Consumption of Fertiliser
7377.overview: State wise Per Hectare Consumption of Fertiliser under Agriculture and Allied Sector provides information on consumption of fertiliser (N+P+K) in kg per hectare across all states. Fertilizer consumption measures the quantity of plant nutrients used per unit of arable land. Fertilizer products cover nitrogenous, potash, and phosphate fertilizers (including ground rock phosphate). The dataset is published in the 'Agriculture and Allied' section of the annual 'Handbook of Statistics on Indian States' publication by the Reserve Bank of India

7378.name: Agriculture and Allied - State wise Production, Area of Food Grains and Estimates of Yield
7378.overview: The State wise Production, Area of Food Grains and Estimates of Yield describes the estimated yield, type of production contains Food-grains, vegetables, fruits, non-food grains and type of crops like cotton, rice, sugarcane, wheat, oilseeds etc. The important types of land use in the country are forests area, land not available for cultivation, cultivable wasteland, fallow land and net area sown. The agricultural land in India is little more than 50 per cent of the total geographical area in the country. The dataset is published in the 'Agriculture and Allied' section of the annual 'Handbook of Statistics on Indian States' publication by the Reserve Bank of India.

7379.name: Industry - State wise Factories
7379.overview: State wise Factories Data under Industry sector dataset of Hand book of statistics on Indian Economy gives information about number of factories, fixed capital, working capital, physical working capital, productive capital, invested capital, number of workers, total persons engaged, total emoluments, total inputs, value of gross output, net value added, gross value added, net fixed capital formation, gross fixed capital formation and gross capital formation across all the states. This data is published by Annual Survey of Industries (ASI).

7380.name: Social and Demographic Indicators - State wise Birth and Death Rates
7380.overview: State wise birth and death rates under Social and Demographic Indicators provides detailed information on birth and death rates across all states of India. Birth rate and death rate indicates the number of live births and number of deaths occurring during the year per 1,000 population.

7381.name: Agriculture and Allied - State wise Storage Capacity of Food Grains
7381.overview: State wise storage capacity of Food Grains dataset under Agriculture and Allied sector gives information about storage capacity of food grains available with Food Corporation of India (FCI) and the State Agencies (both owned and hired capacity) across all states in India. The dataset is published in the ‘Agriculture and Allied' section of the annual 'Handbook of Statistics on Indian States publication by the Reserve Bank of India.

7382.name: Agriculture and Allied - State wise Meat, Milk, Eggs, Fish and Wool Production
7382.overview: This dataset under Agriculture and Allied dataset provides detailed information on production of animal based products like meat, milk, eggs, fish and wool across all states of India.

7383.name: Agriculture and Allied - State wise Storage Capacity for Foodgrains and Utilisation under Food Corporation of India (FCI)
7383.overview: State wise Storage Capacity for Food grains and Utilisation under Food Corporation of India ( FCI ) gives a detailed information about storage capacity, stocks held and utilised for food grains across all states. The storage capacity reflected in the dataset is according to the capacity available with FCI for storage of food-grains.

7384.name: Industry - State wise Number of Employees and Mandays
7384.overview: This dataset gives a detailed information regarding the employees in each unit and Man-day employees in thousands. Man-day refers to any calendar day or part thereof, during which a Licensor representative shall be engaged in work performed for owner including travelling time.

7385.name: Social and Demographic Indicators - State wise Infant Mortality Rate
7385.overview: State wise Infant Mortality Rate under Social and Demographic Indicators provides detailed information on infant mortality rate across all states. Infant mortality rate indicates the number of deaths of children less than one year of age per 1000 live births.

7386.name: Social and Demographic Indicators - Poverty Rate
7386.overview: The Poverty Rate under Social and Demographic Indicators sector gives detailed information on poverty rate across all the states The poverty rate is the ratio of the number of people (in a given age group) whose income falls below the poverty line; taken as half the median household income of the total population.

7387.name: Industry - Statewise Medium and Small scale Industries
7387.overview: This dataset provides detailed information about state wise total number of medium and small-scale units, total investment made for plant and machinery or equipment, total money spent on production of goods, and total number of persons employed in medium and small-scale industries. The Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises Development Act, 2006 aims at facilitating the promotion, development and enhancing the competitiveness of micro, small and medium enterprises.
columns: This data is collected from the nss 73rd round.
Medium and small scale industrial units
key_columns: This data is collected from the nss 73rd round.

7388.name: Social and Demographic Indicators - Population
7388.overview: The Population under Social and Demographic Indicators sector gives information about total population, population in rural area, population in urban area, sex ratio, literacy rate and density of population across all the states. These are based on Census data since 1951. Data for states created in recent years have been worked out by interpolation.

7389.name: Major growth rates and ratios - Select Fiscal Indicators of the Central Government (As Percentage to GDP)
7389.overview: Select Fiscal Indicators of the Central Government ( As Percentage to Gross Domestic Product ( GDP) ) under Major growth rates and ratios sector gives information about fiscal indicators of central government including gross fiscal deficit, net fiscal deficit, gross primary deficit, net primary deficit, revenue deficit, primary revenue deficit, draw down of cash balances, net RBI credit to centre, gross direct and indirect taxes, tax revenue net, revenue receipts, non-tax revenue, capital receipts, revenue expenditure, interest payments, subsidies, defence, capital expenditure, capital outlay. Net tax revenues are netted for states share and amount assigned to National Consumers Cooperative Federation ( NCCF ).

7390.name: Financial markets - Sector-wise Investments by LIC
7390.overview: Sector-wise Investments by LIC under Financial markets sector gives information about Investments by Public Sector, Private Sector, Joint Sector and Co-operative Sector in crores. Public sector includes G-secs ( Government Security ) and State Government securities.

7391.name: Financial markets - Instrument-wise Investments by LIC
7391.overview: Instrument-wise Investments by LIC under Financial markets sector gives information about investments by stock exchange securities and loans given by LIC in crores. Instrument-wise loans exclude policy loans, loans to HPF, money market investments and foreign investments.

7392.name: Output and Prices - Sector-Wise Cost Overrun of Delayed Central Sector Projects
7392.overview: Sector-Wise Cost Overrun of Delayed Central Sector Projects under Output and Prices gives information about the number of projects which are delayed, the original cost estimate, the anticipated cost  and the cost overrun due to the delay of the project. Cost overrun is taken as the difference between the 'anticipated cost' and the 'original cost'.
columns: Number of delayed central sector projects

7393.name: Trade and Balance of Payments - Foreign Exchange Reserves
7393.overview: Foreign Exchange Reserves under Trade and Balance of Payments sector gives information about type of foreign exchange reserves including special drawing rights (SDRs), gold, foreign currency assets and reserve tranche position. Foreign exchange reserves also called forex reserves or FX reserves are cash and other reserve assets such as gold held by a central bank or other monetary authority that are primarily available to balance payments of the country, influence the foreign exchange rate of its currency, and to maintain confidence in financial markets.
columns: Foreign exchange reserve amount in usd
Foreign exchange reserve amount in rupees

7394.name: Trade and Balance of Payments - Foreign Investment Inflows
7394.overview: Foreign Investment Inflows under Trade and Balance of Payments sector gives detailed information about types of foreign investment inflows including gross inflows or gross investments, repatriation or disinvestment, direct investment to India, FDI by India, net foreign direct investment and net portfolio investment. FDI net inflows are the value of inward direct investment made by non-resident investors in the reporting economy, including reinvested earnings and intra-company loans, net of repatriation of capital and repayment of loans
columns: Gross inflows or gross investments in rupees
Gross inflows or gross investments in usd
Direct investment to india in rupees
Direct investment to india in usd
Net foreign direct investment in rupees
Net foreign direct investment in usd

7395.name: Money and Banking - Average Monetary Aggregates
7395.overview: Average Monetary Aggregates under Money and Banking section is about the information on the currency with the public, demand deposits, time deposits, other deposits with RBI, reserve money, narrow money, broad money, net bank credit to government, bank credit to commercial sector, net foreign exchange assets of the banking sector, Government’s currency liabilities to the public and Banking Sector's net non-monetary liabilities.
columns: Net foreign exchange assets of the banking sector
Government currency liabilities to the public

7396.name: Output and Prices - Public Distribution System - Procurement, Off-Take and Stocks
7396.overview: Public Distribution System - Procurement, Off-Take and Stocks under Output and Prices section gives detailed information regarding procurement, off-take and stocks of rice and wheat crops. Procurement for 2021-22 relates to April-July 2021. Total Stocks include coarse cereals, Stock for 2021-22 relates to position as on August 01, 2021. Off-take 2020-21 and 2021-22 include off-take under PMGKAY, ANBP (Migrant) and Non-NFSA (Covid-19).

7397.name: Financial Markets - Financial Assistance Sanctioned and Disbursed by All Financial Institutions
7397.overview: Financial Assistance Sanctioned and Disbursed by All Financial Institutions under Financial Markets sector gives information about financial assistance sanctioned and disbursed by various types of financial institutions including UTI, IVCF, GIC, LIC, IFCI, IDBI, TFCI, IIBI, SFCs, ICICI Venture, SIDCs, SCICI, SIDBI, ICICI. Once loan is sanctioned, then request the bank to release the sanctioned loan amount.
columns: Name of bank or financial institution
key_columns: Name of bank or financial institution

7398.name: Money and Banking - Institutional Credit for Agriculture and Allied Activities
7398.overview: Institutional Credit for Agriculture and Allied Activities under Money and Banking section gives information about loans issued to various banks and outstanding loan amount which has not been repaid by those banks.

7399.name: Output and Prices - Minimum Support Price for Food and Non-Food grains according to crop year
7399.overview: Minimum Support Price (MSP) for food and non-food grains according to crop year under Output and Prices section provides detailed information on prices of various food and non-food crops in rupees. Minimum Support Price is the price at which the government is supposed to procure or buy that crop from farmers if the market price falls below it.

7400.name: Money and Banking - Savings Deposits with Commercial Banks
7400.overview: Savings Deposits with Commercial Banks under Money and Banking section provides information on deposits in savings account with Indian and Foreign commercial banks.

7401.name: Money and Banking - Liabilities and Assets
7401.overview: Liabilities and Assets under Money and Banking section provides information on value of various assets and liabilities. Assets and liabilities include deposits from state governments and banks, Loans and advances, gold coin and bullion, government of India Rupee securities, foreign securities, balances held abroad, investments, notes held in banking department, notes and coins, bills purchased and discounted.

7402.name: Indicators of Financial Health of State Co-operative Banks
7402.overview: Indicators of Financial Health of State Co-operative Banks dataset gives detailed information about the financial status of State Co-operative Banks, amount of profit or loss, Non-performing assets of loans outstanding and Recovery to Demand ratio. A State Cooperative Bank is a federation of the central cooperative bank and acts as custodian of the cooperative banking structure in the State. Its funds are obtained from the social capital, deposits, loans and overdrafts of the Reserve Bank of India.
columns: Non performing assets (npas) as percentage of loans outstanding (%)

7403.name: Indicators of Financial Health of District Central Co-operative Banks
7403.overview: Indicators of Financial Health of District Central Co-operative Banks provides detailed information on financial status of District Central Co-operative banks which includes their   amount of profit and loss, Non-Performing Asset  (NPA ) to loans ratio and recovery to demand percent. District co-operative banks are financial entities which belongs to its members, who are at the same time the owners and the customers of their bank provides wide range of banking and financial services.
columns: Number of district central co-operative banks ( dccb )
Profit incurring district central co-operative banks ( dccb )
Profits of district central co-operative banks ( dccb )
Loss incurring district central co-operative banks ( dccb )
Losses of district central co-operative banks ( dccb )
Non-performing asset ( npa ) to loans ratio

7404.name: Statewise Major Financial Indicators of Regional Rural Banks
7404.overview: Major Financial Indicators of Regional Rural Banks provides information on key performance indicators such as number of region rural bank branches earning profit, incurring loss, Gross Non-Performing Asset ( NPA ) and Capital to Risk-Weighted Asset Ratio ( CRAR ) across all the states. Regional Rural Bank is a scheduled commercial bank, it is primarily responsible for accepting deposits and disbursing loans to rural areas especially unbanked area.
columns: Branches of regional rural banks (rrbs) earning profit
Profit earning by branches of regional rural banks (rrbs)
Branches of regional rural banks (rrbs) incurring loss

Capital to risk weighted asset ratio ( crar ) (%)

7405.name: Money and Banking - Deposits and Credit of Scheduled Commercial Banks - According to Population Group
7405.overview: Deposits and Credit of Scheduled Commercial Banks - According to Population Group contains information on number of accounts and outstanding amount as per residence type such as rural, urban, semi urban and metropolitan areas.
columns: Category of credit or deposit of scheduled commercial banks
key_columns: Category of credit or deposit of scheduled commercial banks

7406.name: Output and Prices - Production and Imports of Crude Oil and Petroleum Products
7406.overview: Production and Imports of Crude Oil and Petroleum Products under Output and Prices section provides detailed information about the production and import of crude oil and petroleum, Oil and Lubricants (POL) products.
columns: Production of petroleum, oil and lubricants ( pol )
Import of petroleum, oil and lubricants( pol )

7407.name: Quarterly / Monthly series output and prices - Quarterly Estimates of Gross Domestic Product : Base Year 1999-2000
7407.overview: Gross domestic product (GDP) is the standard measure of the value added created through the production of goods and services in a country during a certain period. Quarterly estimates of Gross Domestic Product at Base Year 1999-2000 is presented in current and constant prices. The dataset includes the components of like private final consumption expenditure (PFCE), government final consumption expenditure (GFCE), gross final capital formation (GFCF), changes in stocks, valuables, exports and imports of goods and services, statistical discrepancies and gross domestic product at market prices.

7408.name: Quarterly / Monthly series output and prices - Quarterly Estimates of Gross Domestic Product : Base Year 2004-05
7408.overview: Gross domestic product (GDP) is the standard measure of the value added created through the production of goods and services in a country during a certain period. Quarterly estimates of Gross Domestic Product at Base Year 2004-05 is presented in current and constant prices. The dataset includes the components of like private final consumption expenditure (PFCE), government final consumption expenditure (GFCE), gross final capital formation (GFCF), changes in stocks, valuables, exports and imports of goods and services, statistical discrepancies and gross domestic product at market prices.

7409.name: Quarterly / Monthly series output and prices - Quarterly Estimates of Gross Domestic Product : Base Year 2011-12
7409.overview: Gross domestic product (GDP) is the standard measure of the value added created through the production of goods and services in a country during a certain period. Quarterly estimates of Gross Domestic Product at Base Year 2011-12 is presented in current and constant prices. The dataset includes the components of like private final consumption expenditure (PFCE), government final consumption expenditure (GFCE), gross final capital formation (GFCF), changes in stocks, valuables, exports and imports of goods and services, statistical discrepancies and gross domestic product at market prices.

7410.name: Quarterly / Monthly series output and prices - Quarterly Estimates of Gross Value Added at Basic Price (At Current Prices and Constant Prices) : Base Year 2011-12
7410.overview: Gross Value Added (GVA) is the value that producers have added to the goods and services they have bought. This Quarterly Estimates of Gross Value Added at Base year 2011-12 gives the estimates at current and constant prices. The dataset includes the components of like agriculture, forestry and fishing, mining & quarrying, manufacturing, electricity, gas, water supply & other utility, construction, trade, hotels, transport, communication and services related to broadcasting, financial, real estate and professional services, public administration, defence and other services.
columns: Electricity, gas, water supply and other utility
Trade, hotels, transport, communication and services related to broadcasting
Financial, real estate and professional services
Public administration, defence and other services

7411.name: Output and Prices - Annual Survey of Industries - Principal Characteristics
7411.overview: Principal Characteristics by Annual Survey of Industries presents the estimates of some important parameters including capital, employment, emoluments, and several other economic parameters relevant to industrial sector such as number of factories, fixed and working capital, total input and output, material consumed and ex-factory value of products and by-products. The Annual Survey of Industries (ASI) is the most important source of industrial statistics of the registered organized manufacturing sector of the economy.
columns: Addition in stock of material, fuels, etc
Addition in stock of semi finished goods
Addition in stock of finished goods

7412.name: Output and Prices - Pattern of Land Use and Selected Inputs for Agricultural Production
7412.overview: Pattern of Land use under Agriculture and Allied section contains information about net and gross sown area, net and gross irrigated area, area under high yield varieties and consumption of fertilizers and pesticides for the crop.

7413.name: Output and Prices - Annual Indices of Select Industries : Base Year 2004-05
7413.overview: Annual indices of select industries or index of industrial production for the base year 2004-05 measures the relative changes in the volume of production in non-agricultural commodities. It is an effective tool to measure the trend of  current industrial production. Different industries have been classified on the basis of use of items produced by these industries as primary goods industries, capital goods industries, intermediate goods industries, Infrastructure or construction goods industries and consumer goods industries to capture the performance of different industrial group. The methodology used for compilation of Index of Industrial Production is devised by Central Statistics Office ( CSO ), Ministry of Statistics & Programme Implementation, and Government of India.

7415.name: Quarterly / Monthly series output and prices - Consumer Price Index - Agricultural Labourers : Base Year 1960-61
7415.overview: Monthly estimates of Consumer price index with the base year 1960-61 is about the month-wise price index of agriculture labourers. Consumer price index is calculated from their respective annual average indices. In case of New CPI, data for the latest month is provisional.
columns: Consumer price index ( cpi ) of agricultural labourers with base year 1960-61

7416.name: Quarterly / Monthly series output and prices - Consumer Price Index - Agricultural Labourers : Base Year 1986-87

7417.name: Quarterly / Monthly series output and prices - Consumer Price Index - General Index and Food Group : Base Year 1982

7420.overview: Monthly estimates of Consumer price index (CPI) with the base year 2012 is about month wise price index of rural and urban areas. Consumer price index (CPI) is calculated from their respective annual average indices. In case of New CPI, data for the latest month is provisional.

7421.name: National Income, Saving and Employment - Net State Value Added by Economic Activity at Current and Constant Prices
7421.overview: This dataset is about sector-wise Net State Value Added (NSVA) at current and constant prices. It includes various sectors like agriculture, forestry and fishing, mining and quarrying, manufacturing, electricity, gas, water supply, construction, trade, repair, hotels and restaurants, transport, storage, communication and services related to broadcasting, financial services, real estate, ownership of dwelling and professional services, public administration, defence and other services, total NSVA at basic prices, air transport, communication and services related to broadcasting, crops, fishing and aquaculture, forestry and logging, hotels and restaurants, Livestock, NSDP, per capita Net State Domestic Product (NSDP), population, primary, railways, road transport, secondary, services incidental to transport, storage, subsidies on products, taxes on products, tertiary, trade and repair services, water transport.

7422.name: Output and Prices - Agricultural Production, Area, Yield - Food grains, Major Commercial Crops
7422.overview: With major contribution to the Gross Domestic Product (GDP) and providing employment to nearly two third of the work force, agriculture is so much at the centre stage in the Indian economy. this dataset provides a detailed information about agricultural production, area under cultivation and yield of food grains and major commercial crops such as rice, pulses, coffee, soya bean, sugarcane, tea, tobacco, wheat, cotton lint, groundnut, etc.

7423.name: National Income, Saving and Employment - State wise Per capita Net State Domestic Product At Current and Constant prices : Base Year 1980-81
7423.overview: The estimates of total Gross Domestic Product ( GSDP ) and Net State Domestic Product ( NSDP ) are divided by the estimated mid-financial year population of the state to get Per Capita Gross Domestic Product ( GSDP ) and Per Capita Net State Domestic Product ( NSDP ) respectively. This dataset gives information about the Per capita Net State Domestic Product ( NSDP ) at current and constant prices with the base year 1980-81 across all the states.
columns: Per Capita Net State Domestic Product for base year 1980-81

7424.name: National Income, Saving and Employment - State wise Per capita Net State Domestic Product At Current and Constant prices : Base Year 1993-94

This dataset gives information about the Per capita Net State Domestic Product ( NSDP ) at current and constant prices with the base year 1993-94 across all the states.

7428.overview: Gross Domestic Product (GDP) is an estimate of the value of goods and services at market prices produced in the economy over a period of time. The components of Gross Domestic Product at marekt price is presented in terms of the market prices at current and constant prices for the base yaer 1999-2000. The dataset includes components like exports of goods and services, gross fixed capital formation, private final consumption expenditure, discrepancies, valuables, GDP at market prices, import of goods and services, government final consumption expenditure, changes in stocks.

7431.name: National Income, Saving and Employment - Statewise Net State Domestic Product at Factor Cost : Base Year 1980-81
7431.overview: The estimates of State Domestic Product are prepared considering the value of the goods and services produced within the State.
