This dataset gives information about the Net State Domestic Product at Factor Cost with the base year 2011-12 across all the states.
columns: Net state domestic product ( nsdp ) at factor cost for the base year 2011-12

7436.name: National Income, Saving and Employment - Changes in Financial Assets or Liabilities of the Household Sector (At Current Prices)
7436.overview: Changes in Financial Assets or Liabilities of the Household Sector represents a movement in financial assets and liabilities of households which can provide an understanding of the dynamics of growth in the Indian economy.
columns: Units of uti ( unit trust of india )
Loans and advances from other financial institutions
Loans and advances from co-operative non-credit societies

7437.name: Output and Prices - Index Numbers of Agricultural Production - Major Crops : Base Year 1981-82
7437.overview: The Index numbers of agricultural production covers 46 crops under two main groups and eight sub-groups. This dataset provides information about Index numbers of agricultural production of major crops for the base year 1981-82. It is calculated on the basis of weights, where it is taken as the average production of the commodity in the base year, multiplied by the national average price of the commodity during the base year as obtained from the National Accounts Statistics. The average of triennium is taken to fix the base production by eliminating the cyclical fluctuations and evaluate the production with the same price for all states in view of wide variations observed in state prices.

7438.name: Output and Prices - Index Numbers of Agricultural Production - Major Crops : Base Year 1993-94
7438.overview: The Index numbers of agricultural production covers 46 crops under two main groups and eight sub-groups. This dataset provides information about Index numbers of agricultural production of major crops for the base year 1993-94. It is calculated on the basis of weights, where it is taken as the average production of the commodity in the base year, multiplied by the national average price of the commodity during the base year as obtained from the National Accounts Statistics. The average of triennium is taken to fix the base production by eliminating the cyclical fluctuations and evaluate the production with the same price for all states in view of wide variations observed in state prices.

7439.name: Output and Prices - Index Numbers of Agricultural Production - Major Crops : Base Year 2007-08
7439.overview: The Index numbers of agricultural production covers 46 crops under two main groups and eight sub-groups. This dataset provides information about Index numbers of agricultural production of major crops for the base year 2007-08. It is calculated on the basis of weights, where it is taken as the average production of the commodity in the base year, multiplied by the national average price of the commodity during the base year as obtained from the National Accounts Statistics. The average of triennium is taken to fix the base production by eliminating the cyclical fluctuations and evaluate the production with the same price for all states in view of wide variations observed in state prices.

7440.name: Money and Banking - Components of Money Stock
7440.overview: This dataset gives information about components of money stock like currency in circulation, cash with banks, currency with the public, other deposits with the RBI, bankers deposits with the RBI, demand deposits, time deposits, reserve money, narrow money and broad Money. Money stock refers to currency notes and coins held by the public excluding balances of the central and state governments held at treasuries and cash on hand with banks.

7441.name: Money and Banking - Sources of Money Stock
7441.overview: Money stock refers to the currency notes and coins held by the public excluding balances of the central and state governments held at treasuries and cash on hand with banks. This dataset gives information about sources of money stock like net RBI credit to central government, net RBI credit to state governments, other banks' investments in government securities, net bank credit to government, RBI credit to commercial sector, other banks' credit to commercial sector, bank credit to commercial sector, net foreign exchange assets of the RBI, net foreign exchange assets of other banks, net foreign exchange assets of the banking sector, government's currency liabilities to public, net non-monetary liabilities of RBI, net non-monetary liabilities of other banks, net non-monetary liabilities of banking sector, RBI's gross claims on banks.
columns: Net rbi credit to central government
Net rbi credit to state governments
Other banks investments in government securities
Other banks credit to commercial sector
Net foreign exchange assets of the rbi
Net foreign exchange assets of other banks
Net foreign exchange assets of banking sector
Net nonmonetary liabilities of other banks
Net nonmonetary liabilities of banking sector

7442.name: National Income, Saving and Employment - Components of Gross Value Added At Basic Prices : Base Year 2004-05
7442.overview: Gross Value Added (GVA) is the value that producers have added to the goods and services they have bought. Components of Gross Value Added at base year 2004-05 gives the estimates at current and constant prices. The dataset includes the components like agriculture, manufacturing, banking, communication, fishing, forestry, services, hotels and restaurants etc.
columns: Finance, insurance, real estate and business services
Gross domestic product ( gdp ) at market prices
Real estate, ownership of dwellings and business services
Transport by other means and storage

7443.name: National Income, Saving and Employment - Components of Gross Value Added At Basic Prices : Base Year 2011-12
7443.overview: Gross Value Added (GVA) is the value that producers have added to the goods and services they have bought. Components of Gross Value Added at base year 2011-12 gives the estimates at current and constant prices. The dataset includes the components like agriculture, manufacturing, banking, communication, fishing, forestry, services, hotels and restaurants etc.
columns: Gross domestic product ( gdp ) at market prices
Gross value added ( gva ) at basic price
Hotels, transport, communication and services related to broadcasting
Electricity, gas, water supply and other utility
Financial, real estate and professional services
Public administration, defence and other services

7444.name: Major Financial Indicators of State Co-operative Agriculture and Rural Development Banks
7444.overview: This dataset provides state-wise information about major financial indicators of State Co-operative Agricultural and Rural Development Banks (SCARDBs) such as profit or loss, Non-Performing Assets (NPA) to loans ratio and recovery ratio. State Co-operative Agricultural and Rural Development Banks (SCARDBs) operate at state level and comes under long-term co-operatives that provide funding for investment in agriculture including land development, farm mechanization and minor irrigation, rural industries and housing. They also provide term finance for capital formation and rural non-farm projects.
columns: Branches of state co-operative agricultural and rural development banks ( scardbs ).
Profit or loss incurred to state co-operative agricultural and rural development banks (scardbs).
Non-performing assets ( npa ) to loans ratio ( % )

7445.name: State wise Major Financial Indicators of Primary Co-operative Agriculture and Rural Developments Banks
7445.overview: This dataset provides state-wise information about major financial indicators of Primary Co-operative Agriculture and Rural Developments Banks such as number of profitable or loss incurring branches, amount of profit and loss incurred, Non-Performing Assets (NPA) to loans ratio and recovery ratio. Primary Co-operative Agricultural and Rural Development Banks (PCARDBs) operate in district or block level and comes under long-term co-operatives that provide funding for investment in agriculture including land development, farm mechanization and minor irrigation, rural industries and housing. They also provide term finance for capital formation and rural non-farm projects.

7446.name: National Income, Saving and Employment - Macro Economic Aggregates At Current and Constant Prices : Base Year 1999-00
7446.overview: Macroeconomics is the branch of economics that studies the behaviour and performance of an economy as a whole. It focuses on the aggregate changes in the economy such as unemployment, growth rate, gross domestic product and inflation. Current dataset provides macro-economic aggregates at current and constant Prices with respect to various economic indicators like Gross Domestic Product ( GDP ), Net Domestic Product ( NDP ), Net National Product ( NNP ), Gross National Product ( GNP ) at factor cost and market prices and consumption of fixed capital, net factor income, Private and government final consumption expenditure, GDP and NDP at public sector, per capita NNP and GNP at factor cost for the base year 1999-2000. Factor Cost is the cost of the factors of production (that is, labour, capital, land and enterprise). Market price is the current price at which an asset or service can be bought or sold.
columns: Gross domestic product ( gdp ) at factor cost

7447.name: National Income, Saving and Employment - Macro Economic Aggregates At Current and Constant Prices : Base Year 2004-05
7447.overview: Macroeconomics is the branch of economics that studies the behaviour and performance of an economy as a whole. It focuses on the aggregate changes in the economy such as unemployment, growth rate, gross domestic product and inflation. Current dataset provides macro-economic aggregates at current and constant Prices with respect to various economic indicators like Gross Domestic Product ( GDP ), Net Domestic Product ( NDP ), Net National Product ( NNP ), Gross National Product ( GNP ) at factor cost and market prices and consumption of fixed capital, net factor income, GDP and NDP at public sector, per capita NNP and GNP at factor cost for the base year 2004-05. Factor Cost is the cost of the factors of production (that is, labour, capital, land and enterprise). Market price is the current price at which an asset or service can be bought or sold.

7448.name: National Income, Saving and Employment - Macro Economic Aggregates At Current and Constant Prices : Base Year 2011-12
7448.overview: Macroeconomics is the branch of economics that studies the behaviour and performance of an economy as a whole. It focuses on the aggregate changes in the economy such as unemployment, growth rate, gross domestic product and inflation. Current dataset provides macro-economic aggregates at current and constant prices with respect to various economic indicators like Gross value added ( GVA ), Gross Domestic Product ( GDP ), Consumption of fixed capital, Net Domestic Product ( NDP ), Gross National Income ( GNI ), Net National Income ( NNI ), Primary income receivable and other current transfers from rest of the world, Gross national disposable income, Net taxes on products, Net national disposable income, Gross and Net savings, Gross and Net Capital Formation, Per capita GDP, GNI, NNI, Gross National Disposable Income, Private Final Consumption Expenditure for the base year 2011-12.

7449.name: Quarterly / Monthly series output and prices - Wholesale Price Index - Monthly : Base Year 1993-94
7449.overview: Monthly estimates of Wholesale price index with the base year 1993-94 is about the month-wise price index of all commodities, primay, food and non food articles, fuel and power, manufactured products. wholesale price index ( WPI ) comprise of three major groups, viz., primary articles, fuel and power and manufactured products. annual variation for all indices are calculated from their respective annual average indices.

7450.name: Quarterly / Monthly series output and prices - Wholesale Price Index - Monthly : Base Year 2004-05
7450.overview: Monthly estimates of Wholesale price index with the base year 2004-05 is about the month-wise price index of all commodities, primay, food anf non food articles, fuel and power, manufactured products. wholesale price index ( WPI ) comprise of three major groups, viz., primary articles, fuel and power and manufactured products having weights of 22.62 per cent, 13.15 per cent and 64.23 per cent, respectively. Annual variation for all indices are calculated from their respective annual average indices.

7451.name: Quarterly / Monthly series output and prices - Wholesale Price Index - Monthly : Base Year 2011-12
7451.overview: Monthly estimates of Wholesale price index with the base year 2011-12 is about the month-wise price index of all commodities, primay, food anf non food articles, fuel and power, manufactured products. Wholesale price index ( WPI ) comprise of three major groups, viz., Primary Articles, Fuel & Power and Manufactured Products having weights of 22.62 per cent, 13.15 per cent and 64.23 per cent, respectively. Annual variation for all indices are calculated from their respective annual average indices.

7452.name: Trade and Balance of Payments - Imports of Principal Commodities ( Old commodity classification )
7452.overview: Imports of Principal Commodities ( Old Items ) dataset gives us the information regarding commodity wise imports of petroleum, crude oils, Edible oils,  Gold, Iron, Silver etc., in USD( Million ) and INR( Crore ) per year. Imports are based on the general system of recording, according to which Imports relate to foreign merchandise, whether intended for home consumption, bonding or re-exportation.

7453.name: Trade and Balance of Payments - Imports of Principal Commodities ( New commodity classification as per 2009-10 )
7453.overview: Imports of Principal Commodities ( New Items) dataset gives us the information regarding commdity wise imports of cotton, vegetable oil, pulses, fruits, iron and steel, wood products etc., in USD( Million ) and INR( Crore ) per year. Imports are based on the general system of recording, according to which Imports relate to foreign merchandise, whether intended for home consumption, bonding or re-exportation.

7454.name: Trade and Balance of Payments - Exports of Select Commodities to Principal Countries ( Old commodity classification )
7454.overview: Exports of Select Commodities to Principal Countries ( Old Items ) dataset gives us the information regarding commodity wise exports of carpets, coffee, tea, rice, iron ore etc., in USD(Million) and INR(Crore) per year. Data for 2012-13 are revised and  for 2013-14 are provisional. Data on exports which include re-exports, relate to free on board (f.o.b.) values. Exports are based on the general system of recording, according to which exports relate to Indian merchandise and re-exports relate to foreign merchandise previously imported into India.

7455.name: Trade and Balance of Payments - Exports of Select Commodities to Principal Countries ( New commodity classification as per 2009-10 )
7455.overview: Exports of Select Commodities to Principal Countries ( New commodity classification as per 2009-10 ) dataset gives us the information regarding commodity wise exports of carpets, coffee, tea, rice, iron ore etc., in USD(Million) and INR(Crore) per year. Data for 2019-20 are revised and for 2020-21 are provisional. Data on exports which include re-exports, relate to free on board (f.o.b.) values. Exports are based on the general system of recording, according to which exports relate to Indian merchandise and re-exports relate to foreign merchandise previously imported into India.
columns: Export of selected new item commodities to principal countries.
key_columns: Export of selected new item commodities to principal countries.

7456.name: Tax Revenue of the Centre and the States
7456.overview: This dataset gives information about the central and state's share of direct and indirect tax revenue including total tax revenue, gross central taxes, net state’s share in central taxes, net central taxes, state’s own taxes and state’s tax revenue. Tax revenue is the income that is collected by governments through taxation. Taxation is the primary source of government revenue. Tax revenue forms a part of the Receipt Budget, which in turn is part of the Annual Financial Statement of the Union Budget.

7457.name: Tax - Gross Domestic Product ( GDP ) Ratios
7457.overview: This dataset gives information about direct and indirect tax revenue to GDP ratios including total tax revenue, gross central taxes, net state’s share in central taxes, net central taxes, state’s own taxes and state’s tax revenue. The tax-to-GDP ratio is the ratio of tax collected compared to national gross domestic product (GDP). The tax-to-GDP ratio gives policymakers and analysts a metric that they can use to compare tax receipts from year to year.

7458.name: Financial Performance of the States and Union Territories During the Five-Year Plans
7458.overview: Financial performance of the states and union territories provides information on agreed, projected and proposed outlays during the five year plans. The dataset considers agreed outlay for ninth year plan, projected outlay for tenth year plan, proposed outlay for eleventh and twelfth year plans.

7459.name: Financial Performance of the States and Union Territories During the Yearly Plan
7459.overview: Financial performance of the states and union territories provides information on yearly approved outlay and actual expenditure during five year plans. Five year plans included are ninth, tenth, eleventh and twelfth five year plans.

7460.name: Small savings Collections in States and Union Territories
7460.overview: This dataset is about gross and net progressive collections of Post Office savings account under Small Savings Scheme administered by Budget Division in Department of Economic Affairs. The increase in both gross and net collections can be attributed to the factors that Small Savings Schemes provide better returns as compared to other savings products in the market, along with taxation benefit on specified schemes. The net amount (gross collections minus repayments) is shared between the Centre and the States and forms part of the borrowed funds for partially financing the fiscal deficit of both Centre and States.

7461.name: Macroeconomic and Financial Indicators, Year Range from 2009-10 to 2021-22 [C]
7461.overview: This dataset provides information about macro economic and financial indicators such as real GDP at market prices, real GVA at basic prices, foodgrain production, Consumer Price Index (CPI), central and state government finances and their deficit, openness indicators, Wholesale Price Index (WPI), private transfers, net capital flows, NRI deposits,  etc.

7462.name: Growth rate of Real Gross Domestic Product at 2011-12 prices
7462.overview: This dataset is about growth rate of Gross Domestic Product at 2011-12 prices under various sectors like private and governmnet final consumption expenditure, gross fixed capital formation, change in stocks, valuables, net exports, exports, less imports, discrepancies, GDP, agriculture,  forestry and fishing, agriculture, industry, mining and quarrying, manufacturing, electricity,  gas,  water supply and other utility services, services, construction, trade,  hotels,  transport,  communication and services related to broadcasting, financial,  real estate and professional services, public administration,  defence and other services, GVA at basic prices, Community,  social and personal services under expenditure side of GDP and supply side of GVA. 7463.name: Share of Real Gross Domestic Product at 2011-12 prices
7463.overview: This dataset is about share of Gross Domestic Product at 2011-12 prices under various sectors like private and government final consumption expenditure, gross fixed capital formation, change in stocks, valuables, net exports, exports, less imports, discrepancies, GDP, agriculture, forestry and fishing, agriculture, industry, mining and quarrying, manufacturing, electricity, gas, water supply and other utility services, services, construction, trade, hotels, transport, communication and services related to broadcasting, financial, real estate and professional services, public administration, defence and other services, GVA at basic prices, Community, social and personal services under expenditure side of GDP and supply side of GVA. 7464.name: Gross Savings as Percentage of Gross National Disposable Income ( GNDI )
7464.overview: This dataset provides information about gross savings as percentage of Gross National Disposable Income ( GNDI ) under various sectors like non-financial corporations, public and private non-financial corporations, financial corporations, public and private financial corporations, general government, household sector, net and gross financial saving, saving in physical assets, saving in the form of valuables. Net financial saving of the household sector is obtained as the difference between gross financial savings and financial liabilities during the year.
columns: Saving in the form of valuables (%)

7465.name: Financial Saving of the Household Sector as Percentage of Gross National Disposable Income ( GNDI )
7465.overview: Financial saving of the household sector dataset provides information on gross financial saving, financial liabilities, net financial saving as percentage of Gross National Disposable Income ( GNDI ). Gross financial saving contain savings from currency, deposits shares and debentures, claims on government, insurance funds, provident funds, pension funds. Net financial saving is equal to Gross financial saving minus Financial liabilities.

7466.name: Inflation, Money and Credit : Base Year 2011-12
7466.overview: This dataset gives information regarding the inflation of consumer price index and wholesale price index of food and beverages, housing, fuel and light, primary articles, manufactured products, etc. with the base year 2011-12. The consumer price index is calculated from their respective annual average indices. Wholesale price index annual variation for all indices is calculated from their respective annual average indices.

7468.name: Combined Receipts and Disbursements of the Central and State Governments
7468.overview: This dataset gives information regarding the combined receipts and disbursements of the central and state governments which includes all developmental and non-developmental revenue, capital, loans, receipts on tax, income, interest, instrumental and institutional wise sources of financing, percentage of GDP etc. The adjustments are revenue receipts of the states and revenue expenditure of the centre are adjusted for grants from the centre to the states, revenue expenditure of the states and revenue receipts of the centre are net of interest payments to the centre by the states, capital receipts of the states and capital disbursements of the centre are adjusted for loans from the centre to states, and capital disbursements of the states and capital receipts of the centre are net of repayments of loans by the States to the centre.

7469.name: India’s overall Balance of Payments
7469.overview: This dataset provides information regarding India's balance of payments under various categories like current account, capital account, errors and omissions, overall balance, and monetary movements which are further divided into subcategories like exports, imports, trade balance, Banking capital, rupee debt, software services, private transfers, short term credit, reserves and monetary gold, SDR allocation, percentage of GDP etc.,.

7470.name: Foreign Direct Investment Flows to India : Country-wise
7470.overview: This dataset gives information regarding Foreign Direct Investment to India from foreign countries in billion dollars. In line with the international best practices, the coverage of FDI has been expanded since 2000-01 to include, besides equity capital, reinvested earnings (retained earnings of FDI companies) and ‘other capital’ (inter-corporate debt transactions between related entities).

7471.name: Foreign Direct Investment Flows to India : Industry-wise
7471.overview: This dataset gives information regarding sector-wise Foreign Direct Investment to India in billion dollars. Sectors include manufacturing, transport, construction, mining, trading etc. In line with the international best practices, the coverage of FDI has been expanded since 2000-01 to include, besides equity capital, reinvested earnings (retained earnings of FDI companies) and ‘other capital’ (inter-corporate debt transactions between related entities).

7472.name: Assets of Scheduled Commercial Banks
7472.overview: This dataset gives information about Assets of individual Scheduled Commercial Banks, excluding Regional Rural Banks which includes cash in hand, balances with RBI, balances with banks in India, money at call and short notice, balances with banks outside India, investments in India, investments outside India, advances, bills purchased and discounted, cash credits, overdrafts and loans, term loans, secured by tangible assets, covered by bank or Govt.guarantees, unsecured, advances in India, advances outside India, fixed assets, other assets and total assets. Scheduled banks comprise Scheduled Commercial Banks and Scheduled Cooperative Banks. Scheduled Commercial Banks in India are categorised into six different groups according to their ownership or nature of operation. These bank groups are Public Sector Banks, Private Sector Banks, Foreign Banks, Small Finance Banks, Payments Banks and Regional Rural Banks.

Investments on government securities in india

Stationery and stamps by other assets

7473.name: Liabilities of Scheduled Commercial Banks
7473.overview: This dataset gives information about Liabilities of individual Scheduled Commercial Banks, excluding Regional Rural Banks which includes capital, reserves and surplus, deposits, demand deposits, demand deposits from banks, demand deposits from others, savings bank deposits, term deposits, deposits of branches in India, deposits of branches outside India, borrowings, borrowings in India, borrowings outside India, secured borrowings included in borrowings, other liabilities and provisions, total liabilities. All banks which are included in the Second Schedule to the Reserve Bank of India Act, 1934 are Scheduled Banks. These banks comprise Scheduled Commercial Banks and Scheduled Cooperative Banks. Scheduled Commercial Banks in India are categorised into six different groups according to their ownership or nature of operation. These bank groups are Public Sector Banks, Private Sector Banks, Foreign Banks, Small Finance Banks, Payments Banks and Regional Rural Banks.
columns: Borrowings from reserve bank of india
Borrowings in india from other banks
Borrowings in india from other institutions and agencies
Bills payable by other liabilities and provisions
Subordinate debt by other liabilities and provisions
Deferred tax liabilities by other liabilities and provisions
Others (including provisions) by other liabilities and provisions

7474.name: Earnings and Expenses of Scheduled Commercial Banks
7474.overview: This dataset gives information about Earnings and Expenses of individual Scheduled Commercial Banks, excluding Regional Rural Banks. Data in this dataset are obtained from various schedules of profit and loss account as published by banks in their annual accounts. The item ‘profit’ is computed by subtracting interest expenses, operating expenses and provisions and contingencies from total earnings of the bank. ‘Total expenses’ shown in these tables exclude ‘provisions and contingencies’. All banks which are included in the Second Schedule to the Reserve Bank of India Act, 1934 are Scheduled Banks. These banks comprise Scheduled Commercial Banks and Scheduled Cooperative Banks. Scheduled Commercial Banks in India are categorised into six different groups according to their ownership or nature of operation. These bank groups are Public Sector Banks, Private Sector Banks, Foreign Banks, Small Finance Banks, Payments Banks and Regional Rural Banks.
columns: Interest or discount earned on advances or bills
Interest on balances with rbi and other inter-bank funds
Net profit (loss) on sale of investments
Net profit (loss) on revaluation of investments
Net profit (loss) on sale of land and other assets
Interest on rbi or inter - bank borrowings
Payments to and provisions for employees
Printing and stationery under operating expenses
Advertisement and publicity under operating expenses
Directors fees,allowances and expenses by operating expenses

7475.name: Provisions and Contingencies of Scheduled Commercial Banks
7475.overview: This dataset gives information about Provisions and Contingencies of Scheduled Commercial Banks which includes gross financial saving, currency, deposits, shares and debentures, claims on government, insurance funds, provident and pension funds, financial liabilities, net financial saving. All banks which are included in the Second Schedule to the Reserve Bank of India Act, 1934 are Scheduled Banks. These banks comprise Scheduled Commercial Banks and Scheduled Cooperative Banks. Scheduled Commercial Banks in India are categorised into six different groups according to their ownership or nature of operation. These bank groups are Public Sector Banks, Private Sector Banks, Foreign Banks, Small Finance Banks, Payments Banks and Regional Rural Banks.

7476.name: Contingent Liabilities of Scheduled Commercial Banks
7476.overview: This dataset gives information about Contingent Liabilities of Scheduled Commercial Banks which includes Liability on account of outstanding forward exchange contracts, Guarantees given on Behalf of Constituents in India, Guarantees given on Behalf of Constituents Outside India, Acceptances, endorsements and other obligations, Other Liabilities. All banks which are included in the Second Schedule to the Reserve Bank of India Act, 1934 are Scheduled Banks. These banks comprise Scheduled Commercial Banks and Scheduled Cooperative Banks. Scheduled Commercial Banks in India are categorised into six different groups according to their ownership or nature of operation. These bank groups are Public Sector Banks, Private Sector Banks, Foreign Banks, Small Finance Banks, Payments Banks and Regional Rural Banks.
columns: Liability on account of outstanding forward exchange contracts
Guarantees given on behalf of constituents in india
Guarantees given on behalf of constituents outside india

7477.name: Movement of Non Performing Assets (NPAs) of Scheduled Commercial Banks
7477.overview: Movement of Non-Performing Assets (NPAs) of Scheduled Commercial Banks provides information on changes in opening and closing balances of gross and net non-performing assets, addition, reduction and write-off of gross non-performing assets as on March 31. All banks which are included in the Second Schedule to the Reserve Bank of India Act, 1934 are Scheduled Banks. These banks comprise Scheduled Commercial Banks and Scheduled Cooperative Banks. Scheduled Commercial Banks in India are categorised into six different groups according to their ownership or nature of operation. These bank groups are Public Sector Banks, Private Sector Banks, Foreign Banks, Small Finance Banks, Payments Banks and Regional Rural Banks.
columns: Opening balance of gross non-performing assets ( npas )
Addition of gross non-performing assets ( npas ) during the year
Reduction of gross non-performing assets ( npas ) during the year
Write-off of gross non-performing assets ( npas ) during the year
Closing balance of gross non-performing assets ( npas )
Opening balance of net non-performing assets ( npas )
Closing balance of net non-performing assets ( npas )

7478.name: Appropriation of Profit of Scheduled Commercial Banks
7478.overview: Appropriation of profit of Scheduled Commercial banks describes profit appropriation in terms of net profit, profit brought forward, profit available, balance carried over to balance sheet, transfer of profit to statutory reserves, capital reserves, redemption reserves, fluctuation reserves and other reserves on individual Scheduled Commercial Banks, excluding Regional Rural Banks. All banks which are included in the Second Schedule to the Reserve Bank of India Act, 1934 are Scheduled Banks. These banks comprise Scheduled Commercial Banks and Scheduled Cooperative Banks. Scheduled Commercial Banks in India are categorised into six different groups according to their ownership or nature of operation. These bank groups are Public Sector Banks, Private Sector Banks, Foreign Banks, Small Finance Banks, Payments Banks and Regional Rural Banks.
columns: Transfer of profit to statutory reserves
Transfer of profit to capital reserves
Transfer of profit to debenture redemption reserves
Transfer of profit to investments fluctuation reserves
Transfer of profit to other reserves
Transfer of profit to proposed dividend
Transfer of profit to tax on dividend
Balance carried over to balance sheet

7479.name: Exposure to Sensitive Sectors of Scheduled Commercial Banks
7479.overview: This dataset gives information about Exposure to Sensitive Sectors of Scheduled Commercial Banks which includes advances to sensitive sectors of capital market, real estate and commodities on individual scheduled commercial banks, excluding regional rural banks. All banks which are included in the second schedule to the Reserve Bank of India Act, 1934 are Scheduled Banks. These banks comprise Scheduled Commercial Banks and Scheduled Cooperative Banks. Scheduled Commercial Banks in India are categorised into six different groups according to their ownership or nature of operation. These bank groups are Public Sector Banks, Private Sector Banks, Foreign Banks, Small Finance Banks, Payments Banks and Regional Rural Banks.
columns: Advances to sensitive sector of capital market
Advances to sensitive sector of real estate
Advances to sensitive sector of commodities

7480.name: Bank-wise and Category-wise Employees of Scheduled Commercial Banks
7480.overview: This dataset provides bank-wise and category-wise information about employees on individual scheduled commercial banks, excluding regional rural banks. All banks which are included in the Second Schedule to the Reserve Bank of India Act, 1934 are Scheduled Banks. These banks comprise of Scheduled Commercial Banks and Scheduled Cooperative Banks. Scheduled Commercial Banks in India are categorised into six different groups according to their ownership or nature of operation. These bank groups are Public Sector Banks, Private Sector Banks, Foreign Banks, Small Finance Banks, Payments Banks and Regional Rural Banks.

7481.name: Loan Subjected to Restructuring and Corporate Debt Restructured
7481.overview: This dataset provides information about loans subjected to restructuring and corporate debt restructured on individual scheduled commercial banks, excluding regional rural banks. All banks which are included in the second schedule to the Reserve Bank of India Act, 1934 are Scheduled Banks. These banks comprise Scheduled Commercial Banks and Scheduled Cooperative Banks. Scheduled Commercial Banks in India are categorised into six different groups according to their ownership or nature of operation. These bank groups are Public Sector Banks, Private Sector Banks, Foreign Banks, Small Finance Banks, Payments Banks and Regional Rural Banks.

7482.name: State-wise Distribution of Liabilities and Assets of District Central Co-operative Banks
7482.overview: This dataset provides information about State-wise Distribution of Liabilities and Assets of District Central Co-operative Banks (DCCBs). District central co-operative banks (DCCBs) are the intermediate tier in the short-term rural co-operative structure, mobilising funds through public deposits, borrowing from State Co-operative Banks (StCBs) and refinance from NABARD. DCCBs lend to individual borrowers as well as to Primary Agricultural Credit Societies (PACS). District Central Co-operative Banks (DCCBs) were established to provide short-term crop loans and working capital loans to farmers and rural artisans.

7483.name: State-wise Distribution of Liabilities and Assets of State Co-operative Banks
7483.overview: This dataset gives information about State-wise Distribution of Liabilities and Assets of State Co-operative Banks. State co-operative banks (StCBs) are the apex institutions in the rural co-operative structure and as such they are responsible for providing liquidity and technical assistance to the other two tiers. At end-March 2020, they operated with 2,072 branches across the country, providing credit for a range of agricultural as well as non-agricultural purposes, including loans to MSMEs, housing and education which together comprise more than half of their total lending activities.

7484.name: Unclaimed Deposits with Scheduled Commercial Banks
7484.overview: This dataset gives information about Unclaimed Deposits with Scheduled Commercial Banks. From 2018 onwards, the non-scheduled commercial banks are also included in the dataset and therefore, the dataset name is changed to ‘Unclaimed Deposits with Commercial Banks except Regional Rural Banks’. From 2019 onwards, the Regional Rural Banks are also included in the dataset and therefore, the dataset name is changed to ‘Unclaimed Deposits with Commercial Banks’. Scheduled Commercial Banks in India are categorised into six different groups according to their ownership and nature of operation. These bank groups are Public Sector Banks, Private Sector Banks, Foreign Banks, Small Finance Banks, Payments Banks and Regional Rural Banks. In the bank group-wise classification, IDBI Bank Ltd. is included in Private Sector Banks from March 2019 onwards.
columns: Number of accounts under current account
Number of accounts under savings account
Number of accounts under fixed deposits
Number of accounts under other deposits
Number of accounts under total unclaimed deposits
Amount outstanding under total unclaimed deposits

7485.name: State-wise Distribution of Banked Centres According to Number of Reporting Offices
7485.overview: This dataset gives information regarding statewise number of banked centres and their reporting offices based on population group. The population group ‘Rural’ includes centres with population of less than 10,000. The population group ‘Semi-Urban’ includes centres with population of 10,000 and above but less than of one lakh. The population group ‘Urban’ includes centres with population of one lakh and above but less than of ten lakhs. And the population group ‘Metropolitan’ includes centres with population of 10 lakhs and above. Population group-wise classification of banked centres is based on 1961 Census for the year 1969 to 1971, 1971 Census for the years 1972 to 1983, 1981 Census for the years 1984 to 1994, 1991 Census for the years 1995 to 2005, 2001 Census for the years 2006 to 2016 and 2011 Census for the year 2017 onwards.

7486.name: District wise Number of Reporting Offices, Aggregate Deposit and Bank Credit of Scheduled Commercial Banks (SCBs) in India
7486.overview: This dataset gives information regarding district wise reporting offices, aggregate deposit and bank credit of Scheduled Commercial Banks (SCBs). Aggregate deposits are defined as acceptance of money, which are repayable on demand or otherwise, and withdrawable by cheque or otherwise. It comprises of current deposits, savings bank deposits and term deposits. Bank credit represents total of loans and advances, cash-credits and overdrafts, and bills purchased and factored receivables.

7487.name: District wise and Type-wise Distribution of Aggregate deposits with Scheduled Commercial Banks (SCBs)
7487.overview: This dataset gives us the information regarding District wise and Type-wise Distribution of Aggregate deposits with Scheduled Commercial Banks (SCBs). Aggregate Deposits’ are defined as acceptance of money, which are repayable on demand or otherwise, and withdraw-able by cheque or otherwise. It comprises current deposits, savings bank deposits and term deposits.

7488.name: Revenue Receipts of States and Union Territories with Legislature
7488.overview: The  budget dataset provides information about revenue receipts of states and union territories with legislature. Revenue Budget consists of the revenue receipts of Government (tax revenues and other revenues) and the expenditure met from these revenues. Tax revenues comprise proceeds of taxes and other duties levied by the Union.
columns: Taxes on professions, trades, callings and employment
Taxes on property and capital transactions
State sales tax or value added tax (vat)
Other taxes on income and expenditure
Other taxes and duties on commodities
Advance release of plan assistance for natural calamities
North eastern council (nec) / special plan scheme
Grants for relief on account of natural calamities
Sales tax on motor spirit and lubricants
Medical, public health and family welfare

7489.name: Capital Receipts of States and Union Territories with Legislature
7489.overview: This dataset gives information about Capital Receipts of States and Union Territories with Legislature. All figures are on a gross basis including those under Public Account’. Further, WMA from RBI is included under Internal Debt’ while Cash Balance Investment Account’ and Deposits with RBI’ are included under Suspense and Miscellaneous’. Total capital receipts taking public accounts on a net basis are also given to provide comparable data with those of the previous years. Sub-groups Small Savings, Provident Funds, etc.’, Reserve Funds’, Deposits and Advances’, Suspense and Miscellaneous’ and Remittances’ pertain to the Public Account’. Where details are not available in respect of one or several sub-groups under a major group, the relevant amount is shown against the sub-group Others’. Where the break-up of loans for Central Plan Schemes’, and Centrally Sponsored Schemes’ are not available, the relevant amount is shown against Centrally Sponsored Schemes.
columns: Loans from sbi and other banks
Loans from national bank for agriculture and rural development ( nabard )
Loans from national co-operative development corporation
Ways and means advances (wma) from rbi
Special securities issued to national small saving fund (nssf)
Loans and advances from the centre
Advance release of plan assistance for natural calamities
Relief for natural calamities under non-plan
Loans and advances from the centre - non-plan under others
Ways and means advances (wma) from centre
Recovery of loans and advances under others
State provident funds, etc. under others

7490.name: Trend in Disbursements of Housing Loans to Individuals by HFCs in different States/ UTs
7490.overview: This dataset gives information about Trend in Disbursements of Housing Loans to Individuals by Housing Finance company ( HFC ) in different states or UTs. Housing Finance Companies have emerged as important intermediaries in India’s financial system and play a crucial role in providing financial assistance to the housing segment. Apart from regulating the Housing Finance Companies (HFCs), NHB also extends financial support by way of equity participation in HFCs and refinance facility to financial institutions.

7491.name: Trend in Disbursements of Housing Loans to Individuals by ACHFs
7491.overview: This dataset gives information regarding Trend in Disbursements of Housing Loans to Individuals by Apex Cooperative Housing Federations ( ACHF ). The co-operative housing structure consists of primary housing co-operatives at the grassroots level and Apex Cooperative Housing Federations (ACHFs) at the national level. Apex Financial Institution was formed under the Act of the Parliament with a mandate to promote, develop and regulate the Housing Finance Sector.

7492.name: Reserve Bank of India - Liabilities and Assets
7492.overview: This dataset gives information about Liabilities and Assets of the Reserve Bank of India which includes Notes issued, Notes in circulation and Notes held in banking department, deposits, other liabilities, total liabilities, foreign currency assets, gold coin and bullion, rupee securities (including treasury bills), loans and advances, bills purchased and discounted, investments, other assets and total assets. The structure of assets and liabilities of the Reserve Bank are, more or less, in line with the balance sheet followed by most central banks.
columns: Deposit of scheduled state co-operative banks
Deposits of financial institution outside india
Loans and advances to the central government
Loans and advances to state governments
Loans and advances to scheduled commercial banks
Loans and advances to scheduled state co-operative banks
Loans and advances to industrial development bank of india
Loans and advances to export-import bank of india
Loans and advances to financial institution outside india

7493.name: Foreign Exchange Reserves
7493.overview: This dataset provides weekly data about Foreign Exchange Reserves (FER) which comprises of Foreign Currency Assets (FCA), Gold, Special Drawing Rights (SDR) holdings and Reserve Tranch Position (RTP). Foreign exchange reserves also called forex reserves or FX reserves are cash and other reserve assets such as gold held by a central bank or other monetary authority that are primarily available to balance payments of the country, influence the foreign exchange rate of its currency, and to maintain confidence in financial markets. : Foreign currency assets expressed in US dollar terms include the effect of appreciation/depreciation of non-US currencies (such as Euro, Sterling, Yen) held in reserves and Excludes US$ 1181 million invested in foreign currency denominated bonds issued by IIFC (UK).

7494.name: Cash Balances of Scheduled Commercial Banks with RBI
7494.overview: This dataset provides information about cash balances of Scheduled Commercial Banks (SCBs) with Reserve Bank of India (RBI), excluding Regional Rural Banks (RRBs). This is daily data which is recorded at the end of fortnight. All banks which are included in the Second Schedule to the Reserve Bank of India Act, 1934 are Scheduled Banks. These banks comprise of Scheduled Commercial Banks and Scheduled Cooperative Banks. Scheduled Commercial Banks in India are categorised into six different groups according to their ownership or nature of operation. These bank groups are Public Sector Banks, Private Sector Banks, Foreign Banks, Small Finance Banks, Payments Banks and Regional Rural Banks.
columns: Cash balance as percent of average daily cash reserve requirement ( % )

7495.name: Scheduled Commercial Banks Business in India
7495.overview: This dataset provides information about business of all scheduled commercial banks in India. All banks which are included in the Second Schedule to the Reserve Bank of India Act, 1934 are Scheduled Banks. These banks comprise of Scheduled Commercial Banks and Scheduled Cooperative Banks. Scheduled Commercial Banks in India are categorised into six different groups according to their ownership or nature of operation. These bank groups are Public Sector Banks, Private Sector Banks, Foreign Banks, Small Finance Banks, Payments Banks and Regional Rural Banks.
columns: Demand and time deposits from bank
Other demand and time liabilities to banking system
Other demand and time liabilities to others
Borrowings from RBI All Scheduled Banks
Bal With RBI All Schedule Commercial bank
Money at call and short notice

7496.name: Ratios and Rates
7496.overview: This dataset provides information about weekly data of ratios and rates which includes cash reserve ratio, cash deposit ratio, credit deposit ratio, policy repo rate, bank rate, etc. Cash Reserve Ratio relates to Scheduled Commercial Banks (excluding Regional Rural Banks). Term Deposit Rate relates to five major banks for deposits of more than one year maturity. Savings Deposit Rate, Base Rate, MCLR (overnight) and Term Deposit Rate relate to five major banks. Incremental ratios: Increments are measured from the March (financial year). Treasury Bills (91-Day, 182-Day & 364-Day) yields are Cut-off price of the week indicated. 10-Year G-Sec Par Yield (FIMMDA): 10- Year benchmark Government Securities Per Yield calculated by Fixed Income Money Market and Derivatives Association of India (FIMMDA) using cubic spline method is being published in the table.
columns: Cash Reserve Ratio. Relates to Scheduled Commercial Banks (excluding Regional Rural Banks).
Marginal Cost of Funds Based Lending Rate(MCLR Overnight) Min
Marginal Cost of Funds Based Lending Rate(MCLR Overnight) Max

7497.name: Money Stock : Components  and Sources.
7497.overview: This dataset provides information about the fortnight data of components and sources of Money stock. Government balances as on March 31, 2016 are before closure of accounts. Bandhan Bank and IDFC Bank Limited are included from Sep 18, 2015 and Dec 11, 2015, respectively.
columns: Other banks credit to commercial sector
Investments by commercial and co-operative banks in other securities
Net Foreign Exchange Assets of Banking Sector
Other banks net foreign exchange assets
Governments Currency Liabilities to the Public
Net non-monetary liabilities of other banks (residual)

7498.name: Reserve Money : Components and Sources
7498.overview: This dataset gives information about Components and Sources of Reserve Money. Reserve money (M0), also called ‘base money’ or ‘high-powered money’, is the highly liquid component of money stock in the economy and plays a crucial role in the determination of other monetary aggregates. It broadly reflects the total monetary liabilities of the Reserve Bank. Monetary policy actions and market operations of the Reserve Bank that cause changes in the size of its balance sheet, whether on the asset or the liability side, could result in changes in the reserve money. In monetary statistics, changes in individual items on both the “components” and “sources” side could be seen to alter the stock of reserve money. Data are provisional. Bandhan Bank and IDFC Bank Limited are included from Sep 18, 2015 and Dec 11, 2015, respectively.
columns: RBI claims on banks and commercial sector
RBI claims on banks including NABARD
RBI claims on commercial sector excluding NABARD
Net foreign exchange assets of RBI
Government currency liabilities to the public

7499.name: Liquidity Operations by RBI
7499.overview: This dataset gives information about Liquidity Operations by RBI. Liquidity management refers to appropriate level of liquidity and overall monetary conditions. For a central bank, the concept of liquidity management typically refers to the framework and set of instruments that the central bank follows in steering the amount of bank reserves in order to anchor the money market interest rates around the policy rate. The importance of central bank liquidity management lies in its ability to exercise considerable influence and control over short-term interest rates and thereby affecting the entire interest rate term structure, which is important to monetary policy transmission. Central bank liquidity management has short-term effects on financial markets. However, the medium-term implications for the real sector and the inflation situation are particularly important.
columns: Special liquidity facility for mutual funds
Special liquidity scheme for non banking financial companies ( nbfcs ) or housing finance companies ( hfcs )
Special long-term repo operations for small finance banks

7500.name: Major Price Indices
7500.overview: This dataset gives information about Major Price Indices. The movement of wholesale price index (WPI) and consumer price index (CPI) are important determinants for formulation of monetary and other economic policies. WPI data is regularly compiled and published every month by the Office of the Economic Adviser to the Government of India, Ministry of Commerce and Industry. All India CPI, including that for rural and urban, is compiled and published every month by Central Statistics Office (CSO), Ministry of Statistic and Programme Implementation (MoSPI), Government of India. Monthly CPI-IW data is compiled and published by the Labour Bureau, Government of India. The index numbers are compiled on the basis of Laspeyres’ formula as weighted average of price relatives.
columns: Consumer Price Index for Industrial Workers (2001=100).
Consumer Price Index for Industrial Workers (2016=100).

7501.name: Certificates of Deposit
7501.overview: This dataset gives information about Certificates of deposit. Certificate of Deposit is a negotiable money market instrument introduced in June 1989, in order to widen the range of money market instruments and provide greater flexibility to investors for deploying their short-term surplus funds with banks and Financial Institutions. They are essentially securitised short term time deposits issued by banks and all-India financial institutions during periods of tight liquidity at relatively higher discount rates as compared to term deposits. At present minimum tenor of CDs should not be less than 7days and not to be exceeding 1 year. Certain portion of amount is being considered as proportion of average fortnightly outstanding aggregate deposits. Data is updated mostly on fortnightly basis.

7502.name: Commercial Paper
7502.overview: Commercial Paper (CP) is an unsecured money market instruments issued in the form of a promissory note. CP was introduced in India in January, 1990 with a view to enabling highly rates corporate borrowers to diversify their sources of short term borrowings and to provide an additional instrument to investors. Corporate, primary dealers and All India Financial Institutions are permitted to issue commercial paper to enable them to meet their short-term funding requirements for their operations. CP shall be issued at a discount to face value as may be determined by the user. CP is freely transferable; banks, financial institutions, insurance companies and others are able to invest their short-term surplus funds in a highly liquid instrument at attractive rates of return. The terms and conditions relating to issuing CPs such as eligibility, maturity periods and modes of issue have been gradually relaxed over the years by the Reserve Bank.

7503.name: Average Daily Turnover in Select Money Markets
7503.overview: This dataset gives us information regarding the Average daily turnover in select money market. The money market is a market for short-term funds with maturity ranging from overnight to one year. The basic function of money market is to provide efficient liquidity position for commercial banks, financial institution, Mutual funds, insurance companies, corporate etc. Turnover is twice the single leg volumes in case of call/ notice/ term money, CBLO; but four times in case of market repo and Repo in corporate bond. Efficient functioning of the money market is important for the effectiveness of monetary policy. Statistically, short term interest rate is expected long-term interest rate and since, central banks have only limited control over long-term interest rates, thus Reserve Bank controls interest rates through money market inter-linkages.
columns: Collateralised borrowing and lending obligation ( cblo )

7504.name: Government of India : Treasury Bills Outstanding
7504.overview: This dataset gives us the information regarding the Treasury Bills Outstanding by Government of India. Treasury Bills are the money market instruments issued by Government of India and play a vital role in its cash management. Currently 91-day, 182-day and 364-day treasury bills are issued on a regular basis. 91-day T-bills issues on weekly basis and 182-day and 364-day treasury bills issued on every alternate week. Characteristics like high liquidity and no risk have made Treasury Bills attractive instrument for short-term investment by banks, primary dealers, other financial institutions and corporates. The Treasury Bills are issued at discount wherein non-competitive biddings are also considered. This data contains the information on Government of India Treasury Bills outstanding as on close of the business on Friday. The entire treasury bills outstanding amount held under major categories (banks, primary dealers and state Governments).
columns: Treasury bills outstanding from government of india and state governments
Treasury bills outstanding from primary dealers

7505.name: Market Borrowings by the Government of India and State Governments
7505.overview: This dataset gives us information regarding Market Borrowings by the Government of India and State Governments this include Gross amount and Net amount. Gross market borrowing refers to net market borrowings plus the repayment amount (securities maturing) during the year. Net market borrowings refer to the amount of dated securities mobilized by Government of India and State Governments during a particular financial year. The amount to be raised is announced by the Centre in their budget every year. However, the borrowing amount may undergo change during the financial year. Gross and Net Borrowings of Central Government is related to securities more than one year maturity. However, other publication of the Banks may include 364-days T-Bills as a part of market borrowing.
columns: Gross amount raised by the Government of India and State Governments
Net amount raised by the Government of India and State Governments

7506.name: National Sample Survey (NSS) Round 71 - Education - Per 1000 distribution of persons by completed level of education for each State or UT
7506.overview: This dataset provides information on distribution of persons(per 1000) by completed level of education and gender. The surveys on Social Consumption relating to Education, conducted by the National Sample Survey Office (NSSO) in 71st round, are the primary sources of data on various indicators on education scenario of the country, like literacy rates, attendance ratios, incentives received by the students, expenditure incurred for the purpose of education, etc. A sample of 36479 rural households from 4577 villages and 29447 urban households from 3720 blocks was surveyed all over India.
7506.source: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation
columns: Distribution of persons (per 1000) by completed level of education

7507.name: National Sample Survey (NSS) Round 71 - Education - Percentage of persons among ever-enrolled (age 5-29 years) for different completed levels of education who are currently not attending in each State or UT
7507.overview: This dataset provides information on percentage of persons among ever-enrolled (age 5-29 years) for different completed levels of education and gender who are currently not attending. The surveys on Social Consumption relating to Education, conducted by the National Sample Survey Office (NSSO) in 71st round, are the primary sources of data on various indicators on education scenario of the country, like literacy rates, attendance ratios, incentives received by the students, expenditure incurred for the purpose of education, etc. A sample of 36479 rural households from 4577 villages and 29447 urban households from 3720 blocks was surveyed all over India.
7507.source: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation
columns: Persons among ever-enrolled (age 5-29 years) for different completed levels of education who are currently not attending ( % )

7508.name: National Sample Survey (NSS) Round 71 - Education - Per 1000 distribution of households by distance from school having primary, upper primary and secondary level classes for each State or UT
7508.overview: This dataset provides information on distribution of households (Per 1000) by distance from school having primary, upper primary and secondary level classes and residence type. The surveys on Social Consumption relating to Education, conducted by the National Sample Survey Office (NSSO) in 71st round, are the primary sources of data on various indicators on education scenario of the country, like literacy rates, attendance ratios, incentives received by the students, expenditure incurred for the purpose of education, etc. A sample of 36479 rural households from 4577 villages and 29447 urban households from 3720 blocks was surveyed all over India.
7508.source: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation
columns: Distribution of households(per 1000) by distance from school having primary, upper primary and secondary level classes

7509.name: National Sample Survey (NSS) Round 71 - Education - Proportion (per 1000) of households having computer for each quintile class of UMPCE for each State or UT
7509.overview: This dataset provides information on proportion (per 1000) and sample number of households having computer for each quintile class of Usual Monthly per Capital expenditure ( UMPCE ) for each State or UT. The different quintile classes referred to as 1 (lowest quintile class), 2, 3, 4 and 5 (highest quintile class) are generated separately for rural and urban with upper and lower limits for number of households for each class as rural : 1st - 0-786, 2nd - 789-1000, 3rd -1000-1286, 4th - 1287-1667, 5th - above 1667. For urban : 1st - 0-1200, 2nd - 1200-1667, 3rd - 1667-2250, 4th - 2250-3333, 5th - above 3333 of households. The surveys on Social Consumption relating to Education, conducted by the National Sample Survey Office (NSSO) in 71st round, are the primary sources of data on various indicators on education scenario of the country, like literacy rates, attendance ratios, incentives received by the students, expenditure incurred for the purpose of education, etc.
7509.source: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation
columns: Quintile class of usual monthly per capital expenditure ( umpce )
Sample number of households having computer
key_columns: Quintile class of usual monthly per capital expenditure ( umpce )

7510.name: National Sample Survey (NSS) Round 71 - Education - Per 1000 distribution of persons of age 5-29 years by current attendance and current enrolment status for each State or UT
7510.overview: This dataset provides information on distribution of persons (Per 1000) in the age group of 5 to 29 years by current attendance and current enrolment status for each State or UT. The surveys on Social Consumption relating to Education, conducted by the National Sample Survey Office (NSSO) in 71st round, are the primary sources of data on various indicators on education scenario of the country, like literacy rates, attendance ratios, incentives received by the students, expenditure incurred for the purpose of education, etc. A sample of 36479 rural households from 4577 villages and 29447 urban households from 3720 blocks was surveyed all over India.
7510.source: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation
columns: Distribution of persons(per 1000) in the age group of 5 to 29 years by current attendance and current enrolment status

7511.name: National Sample Survey (NSS) Round 71 - Education - Gross and Net attendance ratio for different levels of attendance for each State or UT
7511.overview: This dataset provides information on Gross attendance ratio and Net attendance ratio for different levels of attendance like higher secondary, secondary, primary and upper primary, primary, above higher secondary, primary to higher secondary, upper primary for each State or Union Territory. The surveys on Social Consumption relating to Education, conducted by the National Sample Survey Office (NSSO) in 71st round, are the primary sources of data on various indicators on education scenario of the country, like literacy rates, attendance ratios, incentives received by the students, expenditure incurred for the purpose of education, etc. A sample of 36479 rural households from 4577 villages and 29447 urban households from 3720 blocks was surveyed all over India.

7521.overview: This dataset provides information on proportion of households (Per 1000) having access to internet facility for each quintile class of Usual Monthly per Capital expenditure ( UMPCE ) for each State or Union Territory. The different quintile classes referred to as 1 (lowest quintile class), 2, 3, 4 and 5 (highest quintile class) are generated separately for rural and urban with upper and lower limits for number of households for each class as rural: 1st - 0-786, 2nd - 789-1000, 3rd -1000-1286, 4th - 1287-1667, 5th - above 1667. For urban: 1st - 0-1200, 2nd - 1200-1667, 3rd - 1667-2250, 4th - 2250-3333, 5th - above 3333 of households. The surveys on Social Consumption relating to Education, conducted by the National Sample Survey Office (NSSO) in 71st round, are the primary sources of data on various indicators on education scenario of the country, like literacy rates, attendance ratios, incentives received by the students, expenditure incurred for the purpose of education, etc.

columns: Quintile class of usual monthly per capital expenditure ( umpce )

key_columns: Quintile class of usual monthly per capital expenditure ( umpce )

7532.name: Region wise, State wise, District wise, Bank Group wise, Population Group wise Bank Deposits of Scheduled Commercial Banks (SCBs)
7532.overview: This dataset gives information on Bank Deposits of Scheduled Commercial Banks (SCBs) according to Region, State, District, Bank Group and Population Group. The publication ‘Deposits with Scheduled Commercial Banks’ presents the data collected through the annual Basic Statistical Return (BSR)-2, which includes data on composition and institutional ownership of deposits from 2019. This publication presents comprehensive data on deposits (e.g., ownership of deposits, distribution according to bank group or population group) of scheduled commercial banks (SCBs) {including Regional Rural Banks (RRBs)} and information on number of employees in these banks, as on 31st March for their branches or offices operating in India, where information on aggregate deposits is disaggregated into institutional ownership with their break-up into current, savings and term deposits.
columns: Number of accounts in scheduled commercial banks (scbs)
Bank deposits of scheduled commercial banks (scbs)

7533.name: Bank Group, Population Group, Occupation (Sector), District Wise Bank Credit of Scheduled Commercial Banks (SCBs)
7533.overview: This dataset gives information about Bank Credit of Scheduled Commercial Banks (SCBs) according to District, Occupation (Sector), Bank Group and Population Group. The publication presents comprehensive data on credit of scheduled commercial banks (SCBs) as on March 31, 2021. These data are collected through Basic Statistical Return (BSR)-1 from the SCBs in India including the Regional Rural Banks (RRBs) annually. Basic Statistical Return (BSR)-1 relates to gross bank credit and comprises bank credit including ‘dues from banks and bills rediscounted with the Reserve Bank of India and other financial institutions. Under this survey, information on type of account, organisation of the borrower, occupation/activity of the borrower, category of the borrower, district and population group of places of utilisation of credit, rate of interest, credit limit and amount outstanding are collected.
columns: Number of accounts of scheduled commercial banks (scbs)
Credit limit of scheduled commercial banks (scbs)
Outstanding amount of scheduled commercial banks (scbs)

7534.name: National Sample Survey (NSS) Round 71 - Health - Proportion of persons ailing during the last 15 days by age-group and gender
7534.overview:
The main objective of NSS round 71 (january - june 2014) survey was to gather basic quantitative information on the health sector: morbidity, profile of ailments including their treatment, role of government and private facilities in providing healthcare, expenditure on medicines, expenditure on medical consultation and investigation, hospitalization and expenditure, maternity and childbirth, the condition of the aged, etc. 
This dataset contains information about the estimated number of persons in the population reported ailing in the past 15 days as a proportion of the estimated total population, categorized by age group for each state or union territory. Ailment, i.e. illness or injury, meant any deviation from the state of physical and mental well-being.
7534.source: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation
columns: Proportion of ailing persons during the last 15 days before the survey

This dataset contains information about the distribution of persons(per 1000) by health expenditure coverage under various schemes like government insurance scheme, government/PSU as an employer, health protection act, insurance arranged by households etc.
7535.source: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation
columns: Distribution of persons(per 1000) by coverage of scheme for health expenditure support
Sample of persons having covered in health scheme

7536.name: National Sample Survey (NSS) Round 71 - Health - Distribution of hospitalised cases (EC) over broad age groups in selected States
7536.overview:
The main objective of NSS round 71 (january - june 2014) survey was to gather basic quantitative information on the health sector: morbidity, profile of ailments including their treatment, role of government and private facilities in providing healthcare, expenditure on medicines, expenditure on medical consultation and investigation, hospitalization and expenditure, maternity and childbirth, the condition of the aged, etc. 
This dataset contains information about the distribution of hospitalisation cases(per 1000) for different age groups for each state or union territory. Admission as in-patient to a medical institution for treatment of some ailment or injury, or for childbirth, was called hospitalisation. The birth of a baby in a hospital was not a case of hospitalisation of the baby. If, however, a baby who had never left the hospital after birth contracts an illness for which it had to stay in hospital, was regarded as a case of hospitalisation.
7536.source: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation
columns: Distribution of hospitalised cases(per 1000) for different age groups

7537.name: National Sample Survey (NSS) Round 71 - Health - Distribution of hospitalisation cases(EC) during the last 365 days by type of hospital and type of ward, separately for each State/UT [S]
7537.overview:
The main objective of NSS round 71 (january - june 2014) survey was to gather basic quantitative information on the health sector: morbidity, profile of ailments including their treatment, role of government and private facilities in providing healthcare, expenditure on medicines, expenditure on medical consultation and investigation, hospitalization and expenditure, maternity and childbirth, the condition of the aged, etc. 
This dataset contains information about the distribution of hospitalised cases (Per 1000) by different types of hospitals and wards for each state or union territory. Type of hospitals include public or private. Private institutions dominate the field in treating inpatients in the previous three decades, both in the rural and urban areas. A steady decline in the use of Government sources and a corresponding increase in the use of private sources over the last three NSS rounds are evident in urban India.
7537.source: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation
columns: Distribution of hospitalised cases (per 1000) by ward type and hospital type during last 365 days

7541.name: National Sample Survey (NSS) Round 71 - Health - Distribution of hospitalisation case (EC) by major source of finance of expenditure for each State/UT
7541.overview:
The main objective of NSS round 71 (january - june 2014) survey was to gather basic quantitative information on the health sector: morbidity, profile of ailments including their treatment, role of government and private facilities in providing healthcare, expenditure on medicines, expenditure on medical consultation and investigation, hospitalization and expenditure, maternity and childbirth, the condition of the aged, etc. 
This dataset gives information about the distribution of hospitalisation cases (EC) (Per 1000) by major source of finance of expenditure for each state or union territory. The total expenditure exclusive of the amount reimbursed was borne by the household. The sources of finance expenditure are sale of physical assets, households income or savings, friends and relatives, borrowings and other finance expenditures.

7543.name: National Sample Survey (NSS) Round 71 - Health - Average medical expenditure (Rs.) per hospitalisation case (EC) during last 365 days and its break-up for public hospital in each State or UT
7543.overview:
The main objective of NSS round 71 (january - june 2014) survey was to gather basic quantitative information on the health sector: morbidity, profile of ailments including their treatment, role of government and private facilities in providing healthcare, expenditure on medicines, expenditure on medical consultation and investigation, hospitalization and expenditure, maternity and childbirth, the condition of the aged, etc. 
This dataset gives information about the average medical expenditure per hospitalisation case (EC) during last 365 days by expenditure and hospital type for each state or union territory. Type of hospitals includes public, private and all type of hospitals. Medical expenditure includes package component, doctor or surgeon’s fee, diagnostic tests, bed charges, medicines and other medical expenditures. Other medical expenses include attendant charges, physiotherapy, personal medical appliances, blood, oxygen, cylinder etc.
7543.source: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation
columns: Average medical expenditure per hospitalisation case (ec)

7544.name: National Sample Survey (NSS) Round 71 - Health - Cases of hospitalisation (EC) reported per 100,000 persons during the last 365 days by State/UT and age-group.
7544.overview:
The main objective of NSS round 71 (january - june 2014) survey was to gather basic quantitative information on the health sector: morbidity, profile of ailments including their treatment, role of government and private facilities in providing healthcare, expenditure on medicines, expenditure on medical consultation and investigation, hospitalization and expenditure, maternity and childbirth, the condition of the aged, etc.
This dataset contains information regarding cases of hospitalisation reported per 100000 persons during the last 365 days before the survey by age group for each state or union territory. Admission as in-patient to a medical institution for treatment of some ailment or injury, or for childbirth, was called hospitalisation. The birth of a baby in a hospital was not a case of hospitalisation of the baby.
7544.source: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation
columns: Cases of hospitalisation reported per 100000 persons during the last 365 days by age-group.

7545.name: National Sample Survey (NSS) Round 71 - Health - Cases of hospitalisation(EC) on account of ailments of each broad ailment category reported per 100,000 persons during the last 365 days by gender States and all-India
7545.overview:
The main objective of NSS round 71 (january - june 2014) survey was to gather basic quantitative information on the health sector: morbidity, profile of ailments including their treatment, role of government and private facilities in providing healthcare, expenditure on medicines, expenditure on medical consultation and investigation, hospitalization and expenditure, maternity and childbirth, the condition of the aged, etc.
This dataset provides information on cases of hospitalisation(EC) reported per 100000 persons on account of ailments of each broad ailment category during last 365 days before the survey for each state or union territory. Ailment, i.e. illness or injury, meant any deviation from the state of physical and mental well-being. Broad ailment category includes infections, blood diseases (incl. anaemia), endocrine metabolic & nutrition, psychiatric and neurological, eye, cardio-vascular, respiratory, obstetric & neonatal and other ailments.
7545.source: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation
columns: Cases of hospitalisation(ec) reported per 100000 persons on account of ailments of each broad ailment category

7546.name: National Sample Survey (NSS) Round 71 - Health - Average total medical expenditure (Rs.) for treatment per ailing person during a period of 15 days by State/UT and gender.
7546.overview:
The main objective of NSS round 71 (january - june 2014) survey was to gather basic quantitative information on the health sector: morbidity, profile of ailments including their treatment, role of government and private facilities in providing healthcare, expenditure on medicines, expenditure on medical consultation and investigation, hospitalization and expenditure, maternity and childbirth, the condition of the aged, etc.
This dataset contains information regarding the average medical expenditure for treatment per ailing person during 15 day period of time by gender for each state and union territory. 15-day period is defined as the estimated number of persons in the population reported ailing as a proportion of estimated total population obtained on the basis of the survey data.
7546.source: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation
columns: Average medical expenditure for treatment per ailing person during 15 day period.

7547.name: National Sample Survey (NSS) Round 71 - Health - Average total medical expenditure for (non-hospitalised) treatments per person with only one ailment during last 15 days by level of care, State/ UT and gender
7547.overview:
The main objective of NSS round 71 (january - june 2014) survey was to gather basic quantitative information on the health sector: morbidity, profile of ailments including their treatment, role of government and private facilities in providing healthcare, expenditure on medicines, expenditure on medical consultation and investigation, hospitalization and expenditure, maternity and childbirth, the condition of the aged, etc.
This dataset contains information regarding the average medical expenditure for non-hospitalised treatments per person with only one ailment during last 15 days before the survey by level of care. Hospital type includes hospitals like HSC,PHC and others, private hospital, public hospitals, private doctor/clinic or all. 15-day period is defined as the estimated number of persons in the population reported ailing as a proportion of estimated total population obtained on the basis of the survey data.
7547.source: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation
columns: Average medical expenditure for (non-hospitalised) treatment per person for spell of ailment during last 15 days before the survey by level of care
Sample number of spell of ailments.
